author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1599312650}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an action role-playing game developed by Matt Roszak.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

In Epic Battle Fantasy 4 you have to control a group of fantasy heroes - together with their legless cat - through an exciting story. What initially appears after a hunt for the thieves of some stolen crystals turns out to be a mission to save the world as the story progresses. The legendary god cat once created the cats as ruling people - humans as their servants. Players must now prevent the Godcat from being awakened with the help of the stolen crystals. On their way they have to endure a lot of turn-based battles against large and small enemies as well as powerful bosses. In the best RPG manner, you have to take care of equipment and skills management, put experience points into new skills and use the respective strengths of the various heroes in a tactical manner. A total of over 140 different items and 130 different skills and spells are available.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ exciting story
+ good scope
+ Anime-style graphics
+ coherent soundtrack
+ many weapons and equipment are available
+ Achievements and trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- Boss fights are sometimes difficult
- bad keyboard layout

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 offers turn-based battles and a cute anime look that is reminiscent of classics like Final Fantasy. Clear buy recommendation.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 ist ein Action-Rollenspiel, welches von Matt Roszak entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

In Epic Battle Fantasy 4 Es gilt es, eine Gruppe Fantasy-Helden – zusammen mit deren beinloser Katze – durch eine spannende Story zu steuern. Was anfangs nach einer Jagd auf die Diebe einiger gestohlener Kristalle erscheint, stellt sich im Laufe der Geschichte als Mission zur Rettung der Welt heraus. Einst erschuf die legendäre Gottkatze die Katzen als Herrschervolk – Menschen als ihre Diener. Dass die Gottkatze mithilfe der gestohlenen Kristalle wieder erweckt wird, müssen Spieler nun verhindern. Auf ihrem Weg müssen sie dazu jede Menge rundenbasierte Kämpfe gegen große und kleine Feinde sowie mächtige Bossgegner bestehen. Im bester RPG-Manier muss man sich dabei um Ausrüstungs- und Fähigkeiten-Management kümmern, Erfahrungspunkte in neue Skills stecken und die jeweiligen Stärken der verschiedenen Helden taktisch klug einsetzen. Insgesamt stehen über 140 verschiedene Gegenstände und 130 unterschiedliche Fertigkeiten und Zaubersprüche zur Verfügung.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ spannende Geschichte
+ guter Umfang
+ Grafik im Anime-Look
+ stimmiger Soundtrack
+ viele Waffen und Ausrüstung stehen zur Verfügung
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- Bosskämpfe sind teilweise schwer
- schlechte Tastaturbelegung

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 bietet dir rundenbasierte Kämpfe und einen niedlichem Anime-Look, das an Klassiker wie Final Fantasy erinnert. Klare Kaufempfehlung.

review: I remember playing this on Kongregate when I was 12, and it's aged very well, as it's still a fantastic game to this day.  Nothing like the memories like trying to beat Mighty Oak on epic difficulty, and praying that a wooden idle of all things doesn't finish off Matt at 50 hp.  While you certainly don't need to extra Steam content to beat the game or anything, I still recommend buying this to support the dev as he works hard and still is making amazing games to this day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173745763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1708932037}
review: Epic battle fantasy 4 es un juego de navegador a la vieja escuela que fue relanzado en steam en un formato deluxe, secuela de juegos increibles, es un rpg por turnos en los cuales manejas a 4 protagonistas (y su gato) en una aventura para salvar el mundo (de nuevo), con incontables referencias al mundo gamer e interacciones divertidas entre ellos. esta aventura te mantendra enganchado gracias a sus mecanicas de juego, sus personajes, los toques de humor que posee y a los retos que se pueden superar en el postgame, si buscas una aventura la cual disfrutar en una tarde la cual no tienes nada que hacer, este es tu juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070017864', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1599524187}
review: I have played this on Kongregate back in the day, and payed for it when it came out on Steam. Graphics are pleasant and charming, combat and equipment has a lot of depth and is engaging. There's a ton of room for customizability and grinding, but it is not necessary to win in normal mode. Bosses are creative and challenging, dialogue is quirky and hilarious. The only annoyance I have is the animations are sometimes too long, but that's fine. This game pushes the limit of Flash and is one of the best free Flash RPGs ever made

author: {'steamid': '76561198225570696', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1699, 'last_played': 1610710388}
review:
Bigger and better than EBF3, if a bit overwhelming sometimes, and with a longer campaign.

The level cap to 30 is gone this time, so I guess it's possible to grind for experience if you don't want to bother with upgrading and changing equipment, optimising the party order and all that.

Though really, it is never required to grind for experience if your strategy is up to snuff.
Just play smart, and have fun!

(It's easy to have fun, as the staple dialogue from NPCs and reactions during battles are here again and as funny/ filled with references as ever.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198136486322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5625, 'last_played': 1505366622}
review:
Pra começar, fiquei sabendo da existência desse jogo apos jogar o Epic Battle Fantasy 3, que esta disponível DE GRAÇA aqui na steam, então se você não jogou ele ainda deveria jogar!!! O jogo assim como esse é excelente e te dará uma boa ideia do que esperar das sequencias. 
Jogo de RPG com batalhas em turnos e mecânicas clássicas, com uma enormidade de equipamentos com características e elementos diferentes, elementos que por sinal são uma grande parte das estrategias nos combates. Varias habilidades únicas para o estilo de cada personagem, além de avassaladoras habilidades especiais. A principio o gráfico do jogo pode parecer meio bobo mas não se deixe enganar, o jogo é muito divertido. O jogo consegue ter uma postura não muito seria, com piadas e referencias a todo momento, sem deixar de ter uma historia interessante e uma jogabilidade agradável.
O jogo não é tão difícil e você pode completa-lo de uma forma bem relaxante, alem de conter alguns segredos durante a jornada e modos extras ao finalizar o jogo.
E não vamos esquecer de um dos pontos mais interessantes do jogo, você pode clicar nos seios da personagem principal a praticamente qualquer momento para fazer eles balançarem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198293411361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2236, 'last_played': 1594341986}
review:
This is my first review, so bare with me.

GAMEPLAY
Epic Battle Fantasy 4, at first glance, just seems like your standard JRPG styled game, but it has very unique ideas that make it stand out. You're able to find (or buy) many types of equipment and upgrade them, giving the character who wears it resistances to different types of attacks or status ailments, so all of the different weapons, armor, and badges you find will be useful in certain areas and battles. There is also a skill-tree system that allows the player to upgrade the different magical abilities given to them and unlock new ones using Attack Points that are earned in battles. Some unlockable skills can be given to one of the 4 heroes (or one of a select few of them) at the player's choice, so each character's set of moves has a layer of customizability. In order to win you have to take advantage of enemy weaknesses with these skills and counter their strengths with your armor. As someone who's played a decent amount of RPGs, there was not a single moment that I found the battle system tedious or repetitive, which should speak volumes for its quality. There was also no times in the game where I felt I was required to grind for levels in order to progress, the enemy balancing was perfect to keep everything engaging while not causing unnecessary level spikes, at least on Normal difficulty. The overworld map is also full of puzzles to solve and hidden chests to find and unlock, which is paced very well with battles. Fights are not encountered randomly, as they are enemies on the world map that are interacted with, and the player can flee any fight anytime they want, both of these are very nice quality of life features. 

STORY/CHARACTERS
The game's story is very simple: get the three gems back and save the world. The story works for what it's going for. The characters are very charming though, all 4 of them have distinct personalities and their dialogue bounces off each other humorously. I really enjoyed the simplicity and carefree nature of the characters and story.

PRESENTATION
The game's art style is overall very simple, but all of the main characters look great. The enemy designs are creative and overall everything just looks very pretty. Frequently, you'll be given art stills over certain cutscenes, which look like they were hand made out of arts and crafts, which I thought was especially cute. A very pleasant surprise though was this game's music. Every track is knocked out of the park here, with some of my favorites being all the battle themes, Ashwood Forest's theme, and the final boss theme.

CONCLUSION
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an enjoyable little blast to play start to finish. With charming characters, awesome music, and a deep battle system at an affordable price, there's really no going wrong with picking up this hidden gem. Not only is this a great RPG to start with but it's also perfect for those familiar with the genre.

FINAL RATING: 5 STARS

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2121, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1561, 'last_played': 1642016855}
review:
Can't stand the 'classics' this particular game refers to on its store page but this one is an exception to me and it is designed to perfection. A game that can be (and i have) played in short sessions without losing the plot at any time. I am at the late game stage and i have been playing this game for years in small sessions here and there. 

I can imagine hardcore final fantasy players sneer at this filthy casual game but for my needs it is perfect. may probably be the only game of this type that i play as these games are so demanding on the concentration and time side yet this one has so expansive crafting/upgrade paths that there is always something to look forward to. Always a mission or upgrade to get but without the oh so modern stretched  'forced engagement with the product' that so many bigger titles want you to do nowadays. As said i have played this on and off as small sessions here and there and never lost where i am. 

So i suppose i recommend this. As long as you know the difference between a more hardcore experience and a more casual  like this one. Hard fights here as well but we are not even close to the frustrations i experienced a long time ago with Final Fantasy 7. I don't have time for that bs anymore. Life is too short. Don't want to 'engage with the product' too much when not needed. I could hardly care if ever finish this but at least i already know i have had a good run. Something that Final Fantasies never provided towards the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007792308', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1700283470}
review:
UPDATE: My review and my execution of user One Piece Was A Mistake was so angering to Kupo707 that he shat out a new update as a "i'm totally not mad guys haha!" Let it never be said that my rebellion against all attempts to control me is ineffective.

Flash games and retail games are two very different beasts. The former is expected to be janky compared to commercially available (non-AAA) games. and "so bad it's good" most of the time. The latter is where you expect to get your money's worth. Funnily enough, I paid nothing for this port of a flash game and I still feel ripped off.

Kupo707 always had a few problems with his style of development. When he's not searching VGcats for jokes to steal, he's busy being unable to stop doubling down on awful design decisions. Whether it's making health regenerate by walking to a point where it's a viable strategy to do something else in another window between fights, or deciding that the new original lesbian druid archer (who is a totally good idea to add shut up don't criticize me t. probably kupo) needs to be the most powerful character in the party for maximum mary sue points, but at least she wants to grab Natalie's jugs haha so epic am I right fellow gamers?

To get back on track; Kupo707 cannot grasp the concept of "dialing back." It seems that he looks at every awful idea from his previous games and says "I really, really need to double down." The combat system is proof of this, given how it was flawed from EBF1, i.e. the very beginning, and he still cannot make it tolerable once you look past the new weapons and skills to use. It's just such a slog, as if he saw the memes about PSX JRPGs having overly long battle animations and said "that's a great idea! Let's make this nigh-worthless attack have a cool satellite beam animation for SWAG! what do you MEAN, people didn't like that repetitiveness?"

All that, and the fact that he cannot grasp the concept of what I call "skill bloat." See, the big gimmick of EBF, aside from awful mid-2000s video game webcomic dialogue, is the AP system. You got a list of skills that you can buy in almost any order, with some weaker skills unlocking newer ones. See the problem? There's dump skills that are there for no reason besides "I need to inflate the AP economy, goy!" For christ's sake, Etrian Odyssey and 7th Dragon handle this problem relatively well, you have the template for how to make your game's skill system suck less RIGHT THERE.

In all frankness, I'm not kidding about paying nothing and feeling ripped off. I was given the EBF bundle as a very cruel gag gift, and I hope that the gifter can pull the mother of all cons and get a refund(you know who you are, I believe in your ability to lie your ass off). Turns out that deciding to 100% EBF3, the prequel that's somehow equally worse and better in various areas, was a horrible idea in MANY ways.

But hey, what do I expect from a dev who still thinks GamerGate was anything but controlled opposition. NPC developer, horrible game, 0/10 don't even bother with the flash version holy shit why would anyone pay money for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169773485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2392, 'last_played': 1577530655}
review: It's a funny and kind of cute turn-based RPG with a nice plot line. Nothing complicated, but it's not completely unoriginal. I played Epic Battle Fantasy 3 for a bit and this one is certainly an improvement. Controls aren't clunky and graphics are a bit nicer. Combat gets a bit boring once you get to the point where one fight takes over fifteen turns, but that's to be expected. I enjoyed the light-hearted humor. You should enjoy it if you enjoy other RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138117176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4639, 'last_played': 1591074366}
review:
Me gustan su por sus bromas, diversidad de enemigos y su estilo de diseño me atraen mucho. El echo de los personajes no se tome así mismo enserio hace que el juego sea divertido para pasar el rato, es fácil en temas de combos, puzzles y busqueda de items (aunque algunos no te vas a esperar que estén en ese lugar).
Aunque su dificultad es "Difícil" si no sos de este tipo de juegos pero tampoco es nada del otro mundo, vale la pena su compra si esperas divertirte y que no tengas la necesidad de farmear por 1 hora una zona para intentar ganarle a un jefe.
Hay juegos mucho mas difíciles pero este puede dar una experiencia mas relajante y divertida, aunque su historia no es nada del otro mundo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198438708214', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2773, 'last_played': 1706532276}
review:
Если вы любите лезть в достижения перед тем, как покупать игру, вы могли заметить, что некоторые достижения требуют от вас прохождение боссов на сложности Epic.
Эта сложность полностью раз***рит ваше духовное здоровье. Эта игра может вам казаться неплохой и даже хорошей, но только до тех пор, пока вы не смените сложность на Epic. Потом вы будете страдать. И эти страдания не стоят всего того удовольствия, что вы получите от игры. 
Я думаю, что само существование этой игры наказывает тех, кто стремится собирать 100% ачивок.
P.S. Чтобы не показаться казуалом, хочу отметить, что предыдущую игру серии я прошёл на Epic и получил все достижения. Даже Акрон на Epic по сложности просто меркнет.

review: Came back to this many years later, after playing it few times on ArmorGames. For those with the question of whether or not it's worth it--paying for a game they can play for free on a flash website: I say yes! With the amount of content that comes with EBF4 not found in a free-to-play source comes what is in fact a full-blown video game with hours upon hours of content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110344533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 2650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2637, 'last_played': 1589397946}
review:
Turn-Based RPG game with no annoying ambushes and no time limits or whatever in battles. Humor on point, lots of 4th wall breaking, silly plot and characters. Most of the battles you can win without any fancy tactics and strategies on lower difficulties, but it pushes you to think a lot more when you advance in the game. 
Overall I liked this game, but it had some annoying issues:
1) Frame drops when in battles. Doesn't affect gameplay at all tho.
2) Some secrets are hidden in walls without any hints. It's kinda annoying when you have to walk around the whole map, check every frame and press space, which often leads to accidental dialog skips.
3) Good luck remembering all those chests you can open when finally getting that key item, because map doesn't provide you with the location. Gets real boring exploring all previously explored areas 5x throughout the game.
4) Worst of all - When I finally made it to the final boss and nearly finished it after 20-30 minutes of struggling, for the first time - game crashed.   

I recommend it because of the humor, combat and vibe this game brings, but free roaming could be better.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1600841526}
review:
3.5.2020.									Game #120

I understand that this is an old game but for the sake of this review, let’s pretend like it had just come out.

[h1] So imagine that you work in a school as an RPG teacher…. [/h1]

You have a class full of bright young minds who all want to create great RPGs. You teach them about turn-based, action, Japanese, western … and all other kinds of RPGs. Eventually, you give a final test to your students. They each need to make their own RPG and submit it to you by a certain date.

Seeing how these are students, your expectations aren’t high. You think that most of them will just use a fancy engine and create a generic RPG that looks pretty or a really short one. Well, the assignments start coming in and it’s just as you expected. Most of the RPGs were made in the Unity engine with free assets, some of them are ok, some of them aren’t… just like you were expecting. Then it’s Matt’s turn. Now, Matt, is a student that you really like but Matt is also a rebel. He likes to challenge your knowledge every time he gets a chance and while you find it irritating, you also can’t help but feel proud that Matt has a mind of his own about RPGs. 

So Matt turns in his work and immediately you roll your eyes. 

[h1] What is this, Matt? (you ask with an annoyed tone) [/h1]

Matt notices that you have an annoyed look which makes him nervous but he is still keeping a confident look. He reassures you to take a look at his RPG before you dismiss it. You roll your eyes again and sigh because it is your job as a teacher to grade every single assignment fairly. You start looking at Matt’s work and as you are looking, these are the sounds you make (in this order).

[h1] Sigh. Silence. Silence. Chuckle. Hmm. Hmmmmmm. Aha. Cute. Nice. Interesting. Really?! Wow! [/h1]

Finally, you take a look at Matt and ask him what you have wanted to ask him since you started looking at his RPG.

[h2] Matt, did you make this all by yourself?![/h2]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a really well-made turn-based RPG, however, it’s really easy to dismiss it because of its looks. Yes, we all judge a book by its cover and honestly, I was ready to dismiss this one after about 10 minutes, but MAN, that would have been a waste.

[h1] Please don’t dismiss this game before trying it [/h1]

Basically, one look at this game, and you will set your expectations really low. This game was made in Flash Player (if I am not mistaken) which is almost non-existent in today’s modern gaming world. Because of this, the graphics are really primitive. They are bright and very much two-dimensional. The entire game looks like paper cut-outs that went out to have an adventure. It also doesn’t help much that the game makes it clear very early on that it doesn’t take itself seriously. 

[h1] A generic story that’s very much aware of how generic it is [/h1]

The story follows four heroes that go out into the world to recover precious magic stones that have been stolen by bad guys. The characters are really generic and are basically parodies of every other JRPG heroes we’ve seen a million times BUT, and this is a big BUT, they are all very much aware of their roles, as well as, that they are all inside a video game and they take full advantage of this. You won’t be blown away by the narrative but at least you will be laughing through it. The characters will spew one-liners about common RPG tropes and gaming culture. If you have played a few JRPGs such as Final Fantasy
 https://store.steampowered.com/app/312750/FINAL_FANTASY_IV/ 
or Dragon Quest https://store.steampowered.com/app/742120/DRAGON_QUEST_XI_Echoes_of_an_Elusive_Age__Digital_Edition_of_Light/, then you will undoubtedly find some of these really funny, I sure did.

[h1] A simple, yet effective, battle system [/h1]

While it looks like the most basic turn based battle system it has a lot of quality of life improvements that really made my time spent with this game more enjoyable. There are no random encounters and grinding is kept to a minimum. You can control three party members at once and they each have a unique class and unique weapons. You do have your very standard melee and ranged attacks and elemental strengths and weaknesses but you also have an SP meter. The SP meter fills out after every single attack you hit or miss and once you accumulate enough SP, you are able to summon a monster to your aid. Also, you don’t even have to summon them, sometimes, they will just summon themselves, free of charge, just to help you out. Characters also have limit breaks which can unleash some devastating attacks or a really strong buff to the party. 

The characters level up by gaining XP, as is expected, but they also gain AP. AP (Ability points) are nothing new, and you get to assign them to each party member on what you want. I was really happy that you could use AP to power up your basic attack, as if the game was saying: “Hey, if you don’t want any of these abilities, just buff up your attack, pal!”. I can really appreciate this.

[h1] The soundtrack BLEW MY MIND [/h1]

Can we just talk about how awesome the music is in this game? I mean, my GOD, I was not expecting such a simple game to have such catchy and adrenalin-pumping tunes. They are all really simple looping tunes but MAN, do they make me want to fight something. I especially loved the over-world theme of the first forest area. It’s way too epic for its own good.

[h1] Lots of other bells and whistles that matter [/h1]

So, as I was playing through this game, and enjoying myself, I kept noticing new things that just made me go “Wait, the game has THIS TOO?”. The game has quests (mostly, fetch quests), a bestiary, an endless battle mode, achievements… Look, I know that this is standard stuff in today’s games, but, you have to understand: this game really looks like it doesn’t have much and it is the complete opposite. The engine is really limited but the developer took full advantage of everything he knew about RPGs and squeezed it in there while adding his own flavor with a generous dash of silliness. 

[h1] Playing this game feels like visiting your home where you grew up and having that home-made dinner you can’t have anywhere else [/h1]

Again, I urge you not to dismiss this game because of how it looks. Yes, it’s old. Yes, it doesn’t look impressive. Yes, it is a game that doesn’t take itself seriously but it’s also really… well… epic. If you are a fan of JRPGs such as the ones I mentioned above, give this game a try. You might be pleasantly surprised. I know I was.

Also to note, you can totally play this game while you are doing something else, which is a huge plus for me who needs something to do while working. So, Epic Battle Fantasy 4, I'll see you at work.

Next game: Epistory – Typing Chronicles
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/398850/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. I’m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043434509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1589077117}
review:
Solid RPG, decent humor. Pleasantly challenging even for minibosses and some optional normal fights, though that may be because I'm playing on Epic difficulty. Volume's a bit high, but perfectly adjustable - I never went over 25% in the settings. I do miss EBF5's ability to control with mouse AND keyboard at once, but it's not hard to change. And since it can be 100% mouse controlled, this is excellent for use with Steam Link.
The biggest drawback is that I get a lot of slowdown/stutter and an eventual crash if I play in Windowed Mode for a couple hours. Works just fine in Fullscreen.

Definitely recommend, though the sequel is certainly better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1584286046}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#323 out of 612)... it's time for Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

Part adventure game, part JsRPG, all parody. I lost interest in Epic Battle Fantasy 4 pretty quickly (how did this thing wind up in my Library in the first place?). The reason why? Navigation is a pain in the ass. The art design is a bit grating and each map screen is very cluttered. Simply moving around from place to place felt tedious and annoying, and the full-on parody narrative did nothing to encourage me to keep with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026900478', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1583806075}
review: I don't even know how I purchased this game, in a bundle somewhere. Had no expectations, but proved to be way better than expected. Light, funny and casual. Will play the sequel someday.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998120102', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4996, 'last_played': 1583970932}
review: I bought this just to support the incredibly polished free versions of Epic Battle Fantasy that have been coming out for years; even without the added dungeon and mode, EBF4 is an amazingly fun and polished game. I love the old-school JRPG feel without old-school difficulty (unless you want it!), and finding all the secrets and finishing sidequests is super fun. The biggest downside is the edgy internet humor (lol feminists are zombies!!) marring the entertainingly goofy world; in addition, some of the battles are so long as to be tedious. Besides that, I'd highly recommend this and the sequel.

review:
Had high expectations, but starting out I was given no indication what I was doing, why I should care, how to play or why any of the characters mattered. This may come down the line, but I didn't see a lot of promise in the game and it quickly seemed it wasn't for me.

Probably not a flaw if you're coming from earlier games in the series or looking for something more sandboxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212769343', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 2546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1583088751}
review: Don't be fooled by the amateurish art style, this is a great RPG with loads of contents, a fun story, lots of parody from other games and a very decent difficulty progression. This one of the few games you want to complete everything. If you like JRPG you will most likely enjoy this game. The characters are very memorable and you will probably want to play the next game. This was a carefully designed game, not just a rushed cash grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030888821', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1581953644}
review:
파이널판타지에 영향을 많이 받은 게임이라고 하네유.
실제로 유사한 부분이 많으니 파판 재밌게 하신 분들이면 좋아하실 것 같습니다.

review: Makes it feel like you are playing old classic flash games on the web-browser. Well actually this game did originate from the old web browser game, so it does make sense for it to. It does have that turn based classic Final Fantasy feel with a twist, an action timer. The game does have a sort of replayability feature built in, as in explore newer areas you couldn't from the start. I do recommend this game because it brings nostalgic feelings from the past.

review:
I dont remember buying this, but I installed it just to play something light a couple days ago, and wow does this game deliver!  The fight mechanics and progression system are tight, and what the game lacks in polish it more than makes up for with terrible puns.

I haven't had such a simple rpg hook me in like this since I played "Dust" for the first time.  So after I 100% this im probably getting #5.  I've had so much fun playing through this silly silly game

author: {'steamid': '76561198149852513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2261, 'last_played': 1578516380}
review:
One of the last games of the Epic Battle Fantasy series I played back on the flash game websites, much more enjoyable on steam. Sure there's a price tag to this game, but it's worth it. There are plenty of hours of gameplay and a good many of things to learn/upgrade. Plus with the addition of the new character, Anna, you now have more customization of personal team composition and strategy.

I definitely recommend this game, but if you are not sold, then I suggest you download and play EBF3. If you find you enjoyed EBF3 and would like to see more of the characters and just generally more content, then go ahead and invest in EBF4!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044653396', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2729, 'last_played': 1577548059}
review:
I beat the game
8.5/10

At first I thought this game was going to be pretty basic and maybe not too fun. When I started to play, the controls were just point and click and the graphics were a bit poor compared to big box games. The dialog windows are very basic and the interface is big and boxy.
But then I played for a few hours and all that went away as I got used to the graphics. And suddenly it didn't really matter because the actual game play is great and the story is much deeper than I expected.

As you travel around the world map, you discover blocks you can't yet break, lily pads you can't yet walk across, bridges with gaps you can't cross, and so on. Later in the game you come across the items you need to travel back and accomplish those tasks, which typically give you more loot.

Fighting enemies involves strategy as you discover their weakness and strength and plan your attack and defense accordingly. If you have ever played an old Final Fantasy tactics game, then you will already be comfortable with the fighting style this game offers.

If you're on the fence about getting this game, go ahead and search Steam for Epic Battle Fantasy 3, which is free and is very similar to what you will get here. And keep in mind that Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is now available on Steam as well. If this information was helpful, go ahead and click the appropriate button below. =P

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 2516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2516, 'last_played': 1577465074}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Wer bereits vorangegangen Teile der Reihe gespielt hat, wird vieles wiedererkennen. Der Macher ist nicht all zuweit von seinem Erfolgsrezept abgewichen.

[b][u]Willkommen in der kunterbunten Welt blutiger Kämpfe[/u][/b]
Man bewegt sich via Mausklick durch die kunterbunte Welt und kann durch anklicken mit allerlei NPC und Objekten interagieren. [b]NPCs[/b] geben einem oft Quests, die eigentlich immer darin bestehen, bestimmte Objekte zu sammeln. Nach getaner Arbeit wird man recht oft mit noch wertvolleren Objekten belohnt wie etwa Ausrüstung. 
Um mit [b]Objekten[/b] zu interagieren werden nicht selten besondere Items benötigt wie der Hammer, um Geröll zu entfernen oder die Axt um Büche zu entfernen. Oft verstecken sich in den ehemaligen Hindernissen Gegenstände oder durch deren Beseitigung tun sich neue Pfade auf. Etwa zu [b]Schatztruhen[/b], die man aus anderen Genrevertrern ja kennt.

[b][u]Die wahr gewordene Fantasie epischer Schlachten[/u][/b]
Interaktion mit [b]Gegnern[/b] führt generell zum Kampf. Diese sind auf der Weltkarte fast immer sichtbar und sind nicht selten ein Hindernis, das beseitigt werden muss, um im Spiel weiter zu kommen oder um an Schätze zu kommen.
[b]Kämpfe[/b] laufen runden weise ab und manchmal muss pro Kampf mehr als nur eine Gegnertruppe dran glauben, bevor man die verdienten Erfahrungspunkte und Loot bekommt. 
Hierbei haben einige Gegner entweder zusätzliche Gimmicks wie die Beschwörung anderer Gegner oder andere Fähigkeiten, die ihrer Seite helfen. Und wir sind noch nicht ein Mal bei den [b]Bossen[/b], denn diese verdienen ihren Rang im Gegensatz zu denen in diversen anderen Spielen durchaus. Einige von ihnen machen es auf höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden sogar notwendig im Kampf die Ausrüstung zu wechseln, was den Zug eines Charakters aufbraucht, aber je nach Wahl den Kampf entscheidend abkürzen kann. 
[b]Taktik[/b] ist also keineswegs optional (es sei denn man ist überlevelt oder spielt auf leicht). 

[b][u]Dress Up Game?![/u][/b]
Ein wesentlicher Faktor des Spiels ist die Vielzahl an [bAusrüstungsgegenständen[/b], die der findige (und fündige) Abenteurer im Verlauf seines Abenteuers ansammelt. 
Diese besitzen oft besondere Eigenschaften wie die Zufällige Auslösung eines bestimmten Skills oder die Belegung von Gegnern oder Spielercharakteren mit mehr oder minder hilfreichen Zuständen. Zudem steigern oder senken fast alle von ihnen die Resistenzen gegen Elemente und Zustände. 
Durch das [b]Upgraden[/b] verstärken sich die Eigenschaften der Gegenstände noch. Zudem ist der Statusbonus, den die Gegenstände liefern stets prozentual, was sie über das ganze Spiel hindurch sinnvoll macht. Außerdem sehen viele von ihnen ziemlich gut aus.

[b][u]Magiiie[/u][/b]
Neben Ausrüstungsgegenständen können die Charaktere eine Vielzahl von [b]Skills[/b] erlangen, die zum Teil relativ frei vergeben werden können. Sprich: der Spieler entscheidet, wer Skill XY bekommt. Genau wie bei der Ausrüstung haben Skills oft mehr als nur den Effekt, Schaden zu verursachen und sie können [b]verbessert[/b] werden. 
Das erfolgt mittels Skillpunkten, die man neben Erfahrung durch Kämpfe erlangt. Durch Upgrades werden Skills stärker und ihre Begleitffekte (negative Zustände, Buffs etc)treten häufiger und stärker auf. Sollte man seine Wahl ein Mal bereuen, kann ein Charakter einen bereits erlernten Skill wieder vergessen 
(investierte Skillpunkte gibt es allerdings nicht erstattet)

Genau wie Ausrüstung kann man Skills auch in Kisten finden oder als Questbelohnung erhalten.

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Grafik ist kunterbunt, passend zum teils schrägen Humor der Serie und liefert auf den ersten Blick vielleicht einen falschen Eindruck über den spielerischen Anspruch der Reihe. 
Die Zwischensequenzen sehen aus, wie aus einem Bilderbuch und wie aus Tonpapier ausgeschnitten, was ziemlich gut aussieht. 

Der Soundtrack ist eigentlich durchgehend gut umgesetzt und durchaus hörenswert.

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*] taktisch tiefgehende Kämpfe
[*] vier Schwierigkeitsgrade (Leicht, Mittel, Schwer und Episch)
[*] viele Ausrüstungsgegenstände mit unterschiedlichen Eigenschaften
[*] Arenamodus
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*] "Ich bin kein Negativpunkt, ich putz hier nur."
[/list]

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 ist ein Spiel, das sich an Hardcorejünger des JRPG-Genres richtet, die bei Genrevertretern oft kritisieren, dass Kämpfe zu leicht währen. Grundsätzlich ist es auch für Casualgamer interessant, wenn sie sich nicht scheuen auf Leicht zu spielen.
Auf jeden Fall habe ich mit dem Spiel viel Spaß gehabt und vergebe daher eine vorbehaltslose Kaufempfehlung.

[b]------------------------------------------------------------------------

[i]Wenn ihr weitere ansprechende Reviews lesen wollt, 
dann folgt doch der [url= https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32139821/}]GermanReviewGroup[/url].[/i]

------------------------------------------------------------------------[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198167460183', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5682, 'last_played': 1708875733}
review:
The game is a great way of learning how to strategize and plan ahead, predicting moves that are lethal and not so lethal and giving that feeling of satisfaction or dissatisfaction after every battle and defeat, giving motivation to the player.
I played almost all of the ebf series and it does seem repetitive at some point but theres always something new in the upper games that makes it different, whether its status change or elemental difference.

tl:dr, this game is a really cool and smooth rpg with meta jokes and references that are real goofy :3

author: {'steamid': '76561197998877442', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1576989924}
review: I started playing this game as a meme but discovered how concise it is as an RPG and 30 hours later I'm grinding on Battle Mountain. This is unironically one of the most entertaining (albeit simple) RPGs I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050643998', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1574793877}
review:
O jogo mesmo é puro humor e realmente eu recomendo jogar, Pricipalmente quem já jogou o 1,2 e 3 (Sendo que os dois primeiros era bem você começa forte e se dá game over, volta desde do começo), Eu joguei bastante o 3 mas parei depois que tomei game over e quando joguei o 4, Amei e estou doido para jogar o 5 depois.

Os personagens são bem legais e seus rostos quando acontece é otimo! Porem você sempre vai querer colocar a Ana (Eu acho que esse é o nome dela) Math e Nat porque eles são os melhores (Ana não é muito mas eu faço ela Tank) e já o Lance é fraco, então fica longe. u3u

Se eu recomendo? Sim, Porque? Porque quem gosta de Final Fantasy, Esse jogo é otimo para jogar mesmo com o puro humor, Afinal... Capitão America falou: Eu entendi a referencia

author: {'steamid': '76561198064158594', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1662815959}
review: Eu sou um grande fã dessa série de jogos, então eu pago um pau imenso para eles. Porém, o jogo é de fato muito bom! Os gráficos são bonitinhos, eu diria, mas o foco mesmo é na narrativa e na interação entre os personagens! Diálogos cheios de referências e coisas cômicas. Além do próprio sistema de batalha, que também é muito interessante. Recomendo imensamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198158058289', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3174, 'last_played': 1604411724}
review:
Used to play the flash version of this game, loved it. Got this version during the sale and the extra battle mountain is certainly a treat!

The artstyle is pretty neat and the combat system is easy to understand.

The only few cons I'd give is that since the combat is a bit simple, strats for most of the early game usual become repetitive until you get to harder sections like boss rush and etc. Oh! This game is a bit old too so the jokes in here might be a bit out of date but hey! It's adorable to see them.

Anyways, if you want a simple RPG game with neat art and cute characters, this should be a great game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017079884', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4213, 'last_played': 1572406831}
review: "25 hours of gameplay" is a little misleading; if you're one to do sidequests and item upgrades like me, it'll probably take longer depending on the difficulty you have set (I bumped it up to Epic difficulty fairly early on in the game, and it's taken me about 70 hours to get to the final boss fight.) Other than that, I'd say it's pretty great. Some off-color jokes, but also some legit videogame humor and more importantly, earnest tactical gameplay (refreshing in the era of "click to win this fight" mobile gameplay). With difficulty readily adjustable on the fly, and Epic difficulty providing an earnest challenge while still only requiring just a smidge of grinding IME, this game is well worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1461896843}
review:
If you want to do some "JRPG-ing" just for the sake of doing it, EBF4 might be your sort of game. Additionally, if you are after a bit of parody concerning the genre, it does an alright job, though it is the thing it's parodying, so I wouldn't say it's particularly brilliant satire nor did I find it riotously funny. It's pleasant enough, though.

Since it is the thing it's parodying, one may as well simply play a full-on JRPG. It's not as though the "real deal" don't already have both deliberate and inadvertent comedy already built into them. If you dislike the genre enough to really want someone to crack down on it - as I said - you won't get that here since it [i]is[/i] what it's parodying. And if you really like the genre, unless you've played all the JRPG-style games you can get your hands on - and there are a [b]lot[/b] of them, those are games with more story/mechanics/character depth/visuals per mile than this game has to offer, and I would instead suggest playing those.

I'm on the knife's edge of whether to recommend it or not. It's not a bad game, and although it's not one I intend to finish, I am going to *not* recommend it as I was never really enjoying much of anything about it. To me, it's okay at best. If I'm going to recommend a game I am not going to finish, I would prefer it at least be a game that I would finish if I didn't have hundreds of other games pulling me away from this one. Instead, however, I stopped playing this game simply because I wasn't really delighted by it in any way, and there are so many other JRPGs I could try out for the first time or play again that I loved instead. If there was a middle/meh rating, I'd go with that instead. Until then, not recommending is all I can go with and be sincere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198720385648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1568113930}

author: {'steamid': '76561198353896449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 4122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1568516980}
review:
コマンドバトル型RPGです。
シリーズ物で話は前作の続きですが、複雑なストーリーでもないので前作未プレイでも問題ありません。

□長所
・仲間や敵がグリグリアニメーションし、装備に応じて見た目が変わるので見ていて楽しい
・音楽がむやみにかっこいい
・難しすぎず簡単すぎずちょうどいい難易度
□短所
・属性が8種類もあって多すぎる。このキャラは炎・氷・雷・聖のスキルを持ってて
  敵の弱点は水・風・聖だから聖スキルを使おう、というのを把握するのが大変
・スキル数も多くてごちゃごちゃしている

オーソドックスなRPGなのでこのジャンルが好きな人におすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198416430881', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1704462416}
review: What i mostly loved about this game was that there was finaly more use of new elements in the game like summons. Nearly every one were good and realy usefull but mostly why i loved the game were becouse of one new playable character. Yes i am talking about Anna the fricking nature green head girl. First thing that i love about her is the spells she became stronger every lvl up of skill and the best thing about it her damage is insane. I managed finish whole game without using lance ONCE in the game since i felt like he is useless for the first time in my life actualy and same goes in EBF 5 lance is still useless for me. Also lets not forget the amazing songs by Phyrnna that realy fits into the fights and even places where you are. What i didn't liked about game is sometimes more walking than you would want to and it realy makes the game longer but if you consider the fact of that the game makes you adicted like to drugs i think its fine to say overall that i actualy would say its worth to buy this game not to play it on like browser support a bit Matt in his hard work. In the end without him there won't be any EBF in the first place so he deserves it. In short buy EBF 4 if you want support Matt in his work and we might even get EBF 6 sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2984, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1565703189}
review:
Not terrible for the price.  This game aims to be very cutesy, and succeeds.   A watered down RPG focused more on the turn-based battles than anything else (hence the name?).  The skills/specials system seemed a bit weird to me...all skills are unique to one character but certain specials can only by learned by certain characters, and if one of the four learns it nobody else can?  Seems arbitrary.

This would be a good game for a younger kids getting into RPGs for the first time.  There are a couple of odd sexual references (several characters seem to obsess over one's breasts) that seem out of place to me.  Aside from that, though, this would make a great game for someone who loves the turn-based battle system of old-school RPGs, but not necessarily the drawn out storylines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129137447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1565907589}
review:
EPIC BATTLE FANTASY 4 - 10/10 - Excelente


O jogo é um rpg com gráfico simples, mas está recheado de referência, bom humor e apresenta um grau razoável de desafio. O jogo não é linear, possibilitando que o jogador volte  para áreas antigas. Com o progresso novas formas de exploração são descobertas e coisas novas podem ser achadas nos mapa já explorados (quase um metroidvania kkk) 

Eu me diverti bastante, indico esse jogo para fãs de rpgs.



- GUIA BÁSICO PARA O JOGO- 

- Inicialmente você começa apenas com a arqueira chamada Anna.Com o tempo o time fica completo: Natalie (maga), Matt (guerreira) e Lance (atirador).O time pode ter no máximo 3 jogadores ao mesmo tempo, o quarto fica na reserva.

O seu personagem possui um ataque básico, que varia de acordo com a arma equipada. Além disso existem magias  que consomem MP do personagem.

Especiais são magias diferentes, podem estar disponíveis para mais de 1 personagem, mas dois personagens não podem adquirir o mesmo especial. É uma questão de escolha.

PETS = Após derrotar um chefe, você pode invocar-lo  consumindo a barra de SP. O SP aumenta quando inimigos são eliminados.

LIMIT BREAK! = Habilidade poderosa que pode ser utilizada quando a barra vermelha está cheia. Essa barra aumenta quando o personagem perde vida.

Equipamentos = você vai achar equipamentos durante  o gameplay, cada um tem atributos e feitos diferentes. Faça seu próprio estilo de jogo. Equipamentos podem ser melhorados com recursos.

Itens = Alguns itens raros aumentam os stats permanentemente. Escolha em quem usar.

Comidas = Comida curam, retiram efeitos ou fortalecem seu aliados. As principais comidas são:

Café = Ressucita um aliado (salvou a minha vida varias vezes)
Chips = Cura 25% da vida de todos  aliados
Fritas = Cura 50% da vida de todos os aliados
Chocolate = Cura 300 MP de todos os aliados
Molho Chili = enche a barra vermelha de um personagem (comida boa, mas rara)

Enfrentar monstros garante,itens, dinheiro, AP, EXP e comida.

EXP faz o nível do personagem aumentar. É necessário um pouco de  grind (matar muitos monstros para passar de nível para poder passar  um chefe e ter acesso à outra áreas do jogo.

O AP possibilita aumentar as habilidades, especiais e limit breaks.


Pontos negativos: 

O jogo possui uma série de status: amnésia, condenação, veneno,  paralisia,etc. Sinceramente, só o veneno e queimadura funcionam de forma eficaz, inclusive são ótimas contra inimigos com muita vida porque podem ser acumuladas várias vezes.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Já que você leu até aqui, uma dica do faraquito: 

Algumas armaduras dobram os efeitos de magias e itens de cura. Sendo assim as chips irão curar 50% e as fritas 100%. É uma boa estratégia para usar um aliado como curandeiro secundário caso o principal seja paralisado ou quando enfrentar inimigos  que coloquem o status de amnésia.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198055994365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2639, 'last_played': 1528498931}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076290934', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1564360684}
review:
Cuarta entrega de la saga, la cual trae un nuevo personaje y varias novedades.

Después de aguantar las travesuras de Matt el ladrón comedoritos, Natalie la gruñona pechugona, Lance el flamer/rager/tóxico/nazi/etc, ahora Anna se une al escuadrón de gamberros con la excusa de que alguien ha robando las gemas de Diosgato, la deidad de su pueblo (porque el cristianismo ya quedó muy mainstream).

Dejando de lado las bromas, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 da un gran paso adelante en la saga por sus notorios cambios y a la vez no pierde su esencia de ser un juego de rol por turnos muy friendly para el jugador (esto lo explico más adelante).



En esta entrega, tenemos una nueva mecánica que son las mascotas.
Ahora cualquiera de los cuatro personajes pueden invocar una mascota que ofrece una habilidad única la cual gasta una serie de puntos que se van recuperando matando enemigos.

Las primeras mascotas son muy básicas pero muy efectivas a nivel bajo y gastan poquito, mientras que las más avanzadas gastan muchos puntos pero ofrecen habilidades muy poderosas que pueden cambiar el ritmo de la partida.

Otra de las novedades es que ahora que hay 4 personajes. 3 hay en combate y 1 se queda de reserva.
Esto lo he visto un poco OP, ya que el personaje de reserva se encuentra "a salvo", por lo que si un jefe poderoso lanza su Limit Break sin que lleves defensas, el personaje de reserva los revivirá a todos. De todas formas me sigue gustando esta mecánica ya que así da más estrategia porque el personaje de reserva es invencible pero tampoco hace nada en la pelea.



Dejando de lado estas novedades, hablemos del juego en profundidad:
Si no habéis jugado a los anteriores, tenéis que saber que EBF 4 es un juego de rol por turnos que puede parecer muy genérico pero en realidad tiene mucha personalidad.

Por ejemplo, os acordáis que decía que el juego era muy friendly?
Cuando digo que el juego es "friendly", es porque hay pocas penalizaciones a diferencia de otros juegos del mismo género, lo que lo hace más cómodo y disfrutable. Por ejemplo, aquí puedes abandonar cualquier combate sin problemas y los enemigos no tienen habilidades para que no huyas, ni hay posibilidades de no-huir. De hecho, puedes abandonar incluso peleas contra jefes.

Además, otra de las novedades es que los personajes se regeneran automáticamente, por no decir que existen fuentes para restaurar la vida y el maná al instante. Esto hace que ya no tengas que consumir comida o buscar un lugar para dormir (o lo que hacia yo era curar a todos con Natalie antes de terminar un combate).

Todo esto hace que el juego parezca fácil pero, al igual que el anterior, es muy fácil al principio y muy difícil al final. Tiene una de las mejores curvas de dificultad que yo he visto nunca.



Y hablando de cosas guays: ¡EBF 4 tiene post game!

A diferencia del anterior, este juego tiene contenido extra para cuando acabas la historia principal, aunque se puede jugar incluso al principio (no se recomienda ya que ahí no ganas ni dinero ni experiencia).

Son una serie de desafíos muy divertidos donde los enemigos se adaptan al nivel del jugador y los jefes son aún más poderosos. Además de tener unas buenas recompensas exclusivas al superar ciertos retos (armas, armaduras y accesorios).



Pero si hay algo malo que tengo que decir, es los crashes.

¿De verdad? Tengo una 1080ti, me va perfecto cualquier juego a 4k Ultra de 70 napos comprado en Steam verde. ¿De verdad este juego me ha crasheado 6 VECES? ¿PERO ESTO KE EEEEES?

No, ya en serio. El juego va bien de rendimiento, pero creo que hay un problema con la pantalla completa que hace crash y molesta bastante, en especial cuando estaba a punto de perder contra un jefe y perder igualmente mi progreso. ¡Que desperdicio!





Resumen:

*LO BUENO
- Sigue siendo un buen juego de rol por turnos con mucho contenido y exploración.
- Sigue teniendo una buena historia con personajes carismáticos y mucho humor.
- Sigue siendo muy friendly con el jugador. Muy fácil al principio y muy difícil al final.
- Personalmente, tiene la mejor BSO de los 5 Epic Battle Fantasy.
- Muchas novedades como las mascotas o el personaje de reserva.
- Contenido post-game.
- Está en español, yupi!!!

*LO MALO
- Crashes constantes a pantalla completa.



Ya habiendo dicho todo lo que quería decir, recomiendo EBF 4 a todos los que les gusten los juegos de rol por turnos, el ánime, los gatos, los perros, las cocodrilos, los dinosaurios rockeros y la pizza.

Aunque les recomiendo jugar antes a la tercera entrega, que es gratis. La 1ª y la 2ª no las recomiendo tanto porque son solo combates y no están en Steam, aunque las pueden buscar por Internet y probarlas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1564068423}
review: Un bon jeu dans le style RPG avec des combats au tour par tour. Les graphismes et les musiques sont assez réussis. Le monde est assez vaste et très coloré. Il y a 4 personnages jouables que l'on peut faire évoluer petit à petit avec de nouveaux équipements et de nouvelles capacités qui se débloquent avec l'obtention d'expérience. L'univers et les personnages sont attachants avec l'humour qui est omniprésent tout au long du jeu. La durée de vie est conséquente avec 15 à 20 heures pour terminer me jeu une première fois en fonction de votre envie d'aller trouver tous les coffres objets cachés. Le scénario est relativement simple, il s'agit de sauver le monde des déesses félines et de leurs sbires sans pattes. La progression des personnages est bien pensée et la difficulté est modifiable dans le menu des options. Au final un jeu agréable qui offre de nombreux défis. A noter la possibilité de recommencer en mode partie plus en conservant les modifications et l'équipement débloqué lors de la première partie. Elle permet de prolonger l'expérience dans cet univers à la recherche des nombreux secrets cachés ici et là.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345851445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1709516461}
review:
From someone who had never played any turn-based RPGs, I tried EBF3. And it was awesome. And, I decided to buy 4. Cause, why not?
And I can say confidently that it is better than 3.
A definite recommend if you like turn-based RPG. The story is simple  but fun and it surprisingly doesn't ever get grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113937504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1555286678}
review:
If I've got my history right, Matt Roszak was a guy who made animations on Newgrounds and stuff. They were pretty funny and had some cool fight scenes, too. Then he made a video game, and it was called "Epic Battle Fantasy". It was really only a parody game and it wasn't meant to be taken very seriously. I mean, the final boss was a freaking zombie Goku for Christ's sake. However, it was still fun, and had some funny bits in it too. Then he made another one, a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy. Still mostly a parody game. But then he made a third game, and this one wasn't as much of a parody game. It had a good story and it was the first to actually have an open world. It was decently long, too. Then came Epic Battle Fantasy 4. This was his first attempt at making a game big enough and good enough to be sold as an actual game, and not just some browser flash game. And let me tell you, he did an AMAZING job at it. Like the other games, it's a pretty basic turn-based combat system. It has a very long story this time, and definitely tells the best story of them all. Big world with several different environments, each with their own boss at the end. Lots of sidequests. A fuck ton of different weapons and armor sets to find, each with their own unique look and effects. Throughout playing all of the games, I've fallen in love with the characters (but trust me, you don't need to play the first three games to fall in love with the characters). They all have hilarious personalities and say funny stupid shit all the time. There's also a 5th game out now, but I'm not writing a review for that yet because I'm not even close to finishing it yet. I like it so far though, so I absolutely recommend you buy both games.









Matt for Smash

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198156611653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1545776770}
review:
Un excellent RPG, qui je pense peut plaire à n'importe quel amateur du RPG en tour par tour. Les difficultés à disposition permettent d'avoir l'expérience que l'on veut : parties rapides sans prise de tête, ou combats complexes nécessitant réfléxion, équipement approprié, ordre de tours réfléchis.

Un bon moment à chaque fois que l'on ouvre ce jeu, entre l'humour, les interactions entre personnages, la customisation, les level-up, les combats, les graphismes, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838303198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1678792761}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198446463553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 9332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1611190246}
review:
Un juego hecho con amor, cariño y más que nada, GANAS.

EBF4 es al igual que el 3 un juego donde no te da un reto a menos que quieras aumentar la dificultad o hacer los jefes en el mapa de retos por beneficios extra, pero lo principal es risa, un buen rato y tener buenos recuerdos si has jugado clásicos del estilo RPG.

Estoy seguro que más de uno habrá jugado éste juego en una página de juegos flash antes que en Steam, y creanme, vale la pena comprarlo aunque el creador tuviera el corazón de poner el 90% del juego gratis por ahí en Newgrounds y más allá.

Ésta saga realmente es como un anime de comedia y aventura con todo muy bien hecho. Personajes divertidos, buena musica, muy buen diseño que puede ser un anime cualquier día de la semana, humor negro, referencias del mundo del anime a patadas, chistes sexuales, machistas y una historia que aunque está ahí, es decente y sigue la linea argumental del juego anterior. 
Como dije, no es un juego para partirte la cabeza, (aunque tenga algunas secciones de puzzle y de tener objetos MUY escondidos) es un juego que está hecho con la intención de que te lo pases bien con unos personajes muy divertidos que a medida que avances, te vayas riendo y encariñando con ellos, siendo por ver qué más pasa entre ellos la razón de que prosigas.

El sistema de batalla está ligeramente más pulido que el de la entrega anterior, pero sigue siendo el mismo, clásico, accesible y sencillo sistema que está hecho enteramente de los RPG de la vieja escuela que resultará imposible el confundirte lo más mínimo.

En sí, éste juego o más bien, la saga, lo vale totalmente. Si quieres reirte, pasarlo bien, recordar los viejos y geniales RPG y tener el logro más gracioso y sensual posible, compralo. 
Si disfrutas del anime, los viejos RPG y chistes de toda indole, te apuesto lo que quieras a que te vas a divertir.

(También está la opción de censurar escotes y chistes sexuales para gente sin sentido del humor)

En cuanto a lo malo ... nada, quizás el traje de ninja que en la versión ´´chibi´´ del personaje, se ve otra cosa, pero por lo demás, si le encuentras un error, seguro es porque está programado para que te lo encuentres, porque el juego también rompe la cuarta pared con chistes de errores informaticos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014383949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1553922061}
review:
Entertaining combat with quite a bit of depth and gorgeous animations and humorous details. Fun lightweight dungeon navigation, with a slight "metroidvania" or Zelda-like touch to the unlocking of areas.

Figuring out which character gets which special skill is annoying though, since only one can get each one of them, and only three out of four characters are in the party at any given time. There's no way to respec, so this can lead to agonizing decisions which go against the otherwise lightweight and fun overall spirit of the game.

Reading the elemental resistances on all enemies can get tedious, too. Some quicker way to see at a glance what the various enemies are most vulnerable to would've been appreciated. Also in the usability department, you can see what upgrade requires which material, but you can't look at a list of materials to know where to find them and which upgrade they can be used for, you have to look at every monster description in the encyclopedia and every upgrade for that. An elaborate crafting system like this one desperately needs a cross-reference, something the Legend of Heroes: Tales in the Sky series understood.

Oh yeah. And this is a JRPG without controller support. In <insert current year here>? Mouse and keyboard only. My RSI thanks you.

Verdict: very flawed, but addictive and good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023474251', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2146, 'last_played': 1549965984}
review:
A charming parodic JRPG, which means it has self-aware/tongue-in-cheek humor. EBF4 has plenty of shout-outs/references to other games, anime, etc. You don't particularly need to play EBF1-3 to understand the story, as there is a small recap at the beginning. Although you can, since they're still technically free games hosted on Kongregate/Armor Games (Personally, I've played EBF1 and 2). The gameplay is solid (not unique, per se, since there's literally hundreds of JRPGs out there), the characters are unique, and the music is awesome (composed by Phyrnna/Halcyonic Falcon X)

This game is firmly in the mold of turn-based JRPG, so it does become a bit samey after about 30 hours. Whether that's a positive or negative is up to you. However, one thing I can say is that my PC could not get this game running at a consistent framerate, even with all settings turned down. Now whether that's due to being made in Flash (this series was originally played on web browsers, in the era of Adobe Flash) or my system memory/CPU being lazy, I don't know. But it definitely should not have had framerate issues on this game if it wasn't made in Flash and with my current system specs.

Regardless of the performance issues, I still enjoyed EBF4. If you like JRPGs, you'll probably find something enjoyable about this game. $12 is a hard asking price, especially if the free version is available, but if you have the cash, consider supporting this dude. EBF5 is also a good buy (currently enjoying it as I'm writing this review).

Number score if you care about that sort of thing: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164793141', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1627899307}
review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy franchise is something I have a personal attachment to. I remember when the third game wass current, I remember playing it to completion on Kongregate and needing a walkthrough for some hidden stuff. I remember the hype I felt when I saw this game was available on the site's then-new Beta feature. I remember looking at the teaser (as I could not access Betas) and wondering what the game would be, since the only screenshot I could see was one of the cutscene art. I will never in my life say this is a bad game.
However, now that I bring myself to writing this, I realize the game itself has little to write abbout. It has JRPG systems (HP and mana, Turn-Based Combat, Limit Breaks) we all know, and they work well here. The plot's actually original, though I've little memory of it.
To me, what shines is the HUMOR - The game is FULL of references, and only going through the series again in preparation for EBF5 did I catch just how many references there were.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128418462', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1547753328}
review:
Et voilà! chose promise, chose faite! ayant commencer par la version gratuite de ce beau petit jeu "RPG" je suis ensuite passé a la caisse.
Et bien évidement c'est plus complet et je ne regrette pas l'achat!
Je peus maintenant jouir du FR du jeu et de bien d'autre fonctionalité.
Je l'ai déjà dit a ma précédente review, j'ai bien apprécié le jeu, il a une direction artistique certe décalé et pas très éxeptionnel et s'apparente plus à un jeu flash qu'autre chose, cela ne l'empeche pas de ne pas être un jeu fini à la pysse*
Musique, bruitage, scénario, graphisme tout semble avoir été fait avec simplicité mais on se rend au final compte de la passion qui en émane.
Des clin d'oeuil fourmille également de partout jusque dans le débloquage de zone qui copie de manière non dissimulé les attaque propre au jeux pokémon! ce n'est bien sur qu'un exemple.
Un jeu qui parait simple mais qui vous surprendra si vous le sous estimé!
En gros bref je le conseille, un ptit jeu qui mérite amplement son petit prix :)
Ps: ça aime les gros lolo dans l'équipe des dev's à ce que je vois .w. *clin d'oeuil*

author: {'steamid': '76561198101131106', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1545851924}
review:
Прошел игру, сделав и собрав все что было можно.

Игра очень понравилась. В сравнении с другими, игранными мной JRPG, в первую очередь сильно выделяются системы боя, развития персонажей, скиллов, экипировки и исследования мира. Они тут очень детально проработаны и разнообразны.

Героев всего четверо, но каждый из них уникален, обладает индивидуальным набором скиллов, экипировки и имеет определенную функцию в бою, пусть и не столь узконаправленную как в тактических играх. Лучница с точными атаками и кучей статусных скиллов усиления и ослабления. Воин с разнообразными одиночными элементальными скиллами огромной силы. Маг с массовыми заклинаниями всех типов с сопутствующими им элементальными ослабляющими эффектами. И, внезапно, мастер стрелкового оружия в фашистской униформе и с ганблейдом наперевес, специализирующийся на атаках тьмой и взрывом. (самый редко используемый мной герой).

Скиллов в игре очень много и все они при этом имеют уникальный эффект, так что большинство пригодятся в ходе игры. При том часть из них герои имеют в личном распоряжении, а другие будут обнаруживаться в ходе игры, и их может изучить один из нескольких героев на выбор, что позволит либо еще больше расширить возможности героя в его специализации, либо же унифицировать кого-то, кто не обладает скиллами подобного типа.

Экипировка тут тоже не просто дает плюсы к параметрам, как в обычных играх, а обладает кучей особенностей, сильно виляющих на носящего их героя. Каждая вещь, помимо того, что поменяет внешний вид героя, как в бою, так и на локации, еще и обладает набором бонусов к сопротивлению магии и статусам, все они сильно разнятся по плюсам к характеристикам да еще и имеет особые эффекты от пассивных, таких как поглощение НР и МР, вешание статуса при атаках, до активных, которые активируют автоматическое применение скиллов во время боя или между ходами.

Все это многообразие возможностей героев, их скиллов и сочетания экипировки необходимо учитывать и применять в бою против монстров. И если против мелких врагов можно обойтись простым применением самых убойных скиллов, то против более сильных и опасных монстров, а особенно боссов, просто необходимо подбирать атаки элементом, к которым уязвим враг, и одевать героев в оружие и броню, которые снизят эффективность атак врага к минимуму.

Причем возможности боевой системы позволяют менять экипировку и активных членов партии прямо по ходу сражения, которое зачастую будет состоять из нескольких «волн» врагов. Из четверых героев только три состоят в активной партии, а последний сидит в резерве, каждый ход восстанавливая НР и МР. Заменой перса в резерв можно эффективно пользоваться в затяжных сражениях, когда герой сильно пострадал от атак, истратил всю ману или нахватался статус эффектов.

Помимо того в боевой системе есть возможность использования лимитов, как в FF7, которые по сути от обычных скиллов отличаются крутой анимацией и силой атаки.

Есть также возможность призывать особых монстров, дающих своим появлением очень полезные эффекты или обладающих очень мощным элементальным уроном на момент получения их игроком.

В плане исследования мира тут полноценно присутствует бектрекинг с открытием ранее недоступных мест с помощью новых «ключевых» предметов. На локациях полно секретов и сундуков с очень полезным содержимым.

Во вторую очередь игра выделяется своей пародийностью и наличием юмора. В игре много отсылок к другим играм. А музыка весьма нестандартна, радуя слух басами электрогитары и запоминающимися музыкальными мотивами.

Сюжет в игре наличествует минимально, и своими забавными и абсурдными событиями напоминает Disgaea.

Графон тут, помимо того, что сделан наверное на флеш-анимации, с «картонными» движениями персонажей и общим карикатурным чиби-стилем, радует глаз детальной проработкой каждого экрана локаций. Кроме того, все спрайты монстров и героев в бою имеют необычайно большой размер, а применяемые скиллы зрелищны, как в полноценной финалке. Анимация лимит-атак особо круты.

Рекомендую к прохождению всем любителям JRPG. Игра точно понравится если не обращать внимания на особенности графики и сюжетную составляющую.

Из минусов тут можно придраться только к тому, что по сути эта игра просто улучшенная и расширенная EBF 3. Скорее всего и пятая часть геймплейно будет не сильно отличаться от этой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206101415', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2530, 'last_played': 1451066735}
review: O jogo é excelente,você não vai ser arrenpeder se compra-lo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388660255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 70, 'playtime_at_review': 2519, 'last_played': 1712266617}
review:
Very fun turn based RPG. Highly reccomend buying it; it is worth every coin. 

I've played Matt's EBF games in the past and they are extremely addicting. Even without the story, it was easy to love the characters.
EBF4 is probably my favorite game in the series, beating even EBF5 (this review has been updated). The art is excellent, the gameplay is simple, the story is well written and humorous, and the mechanics offer a lovely challenge. Bonus: the music is awesome.

Protip: scan every enemy and find what they're weak to both elementally and statistically.

EDIT: I forgot to leave numbers on this review. 9.5 / 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412804583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1545662925}
review: 趁着打折果断入手，虽然看不懂英文但是玩的很爽！音乐好评，就是找（隐藏）箱子有点让我痛苦，多了还不只是箱子的（隐藏）玩意！

author: {'steamid': '76561198013005714', 'num_games_owned': 6683, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1549007894}
review:
虽然美术简陋，但是作为一个回合制RPG，其丰富的技能系统和武器系统使得这种类型的战斗并不枯燥。其核心系统的理念就是不同的队伍状态在不同的战斗场景有不同的战术，极大的扩展了回合制RPG的不确定性，使得线性的战斗变得更加有挑战和策略。
但是游戏的其它部分做的很迷，无论是关卡的设计，还是游戏的流程，似乎都不见得有多好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198078507256', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1547870380}
review: I played this game for hours and hours when it was a flash game. This is one of those few franchises that is hopeful to actually survive the death of flash games. Very great game, and worth full price, but you should always try and wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072861675', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2210, 'last_played': 1695089707}
review:
E um otimo jogo! principalmente pra quem esta no tédio e quer experimentar coisas novas, o jogo é em turnos com personagens carismaticos e inimigos fofos e amedrontadores ao mesmo tempo. As musicas são 10/10, grind aceitavel e muita customização de roupas e elementos.

A historia é simples mas nao é cliche, vá por mim, é divertido de ler todas as frases que aparecem, inclusive dos npc's
Se for jogar na dificuldade Épica, tome cuidade, grinde bastante, pois o boss final é bem complicado e vai levar o jogador a entender todas as mecanicas de atributos e provavelmente buscar todos os equipamentos do mapa bonus.

Recomendo fortissimo esse jogo, como o da serie inteira!
Vale a pena, principalmente quando o jogo entra em promoção.
