author: {'steamid': '76561198093861407', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1492198941}
review:
Rasowy jRPG - ratujesz świat przed zagładą powoli odkrywając jego mroczną [kocią] mitologię. 

Wszystkiemu towarzyszą ironiczne i niezwykle trafne komentarze bohaterów odnoszące się zarówno do wydarzeń i powagi innych tego typu gier rpg. Świetna zabawa.

Minusem gry może być brak trybu auto-battle - każdą akcje trzeba wyklikać, a dość sporą część gry spędza się w walce.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1484731393}
review:
[b]One of the most enjoyable turn based strategy games I have played[/b]

[b]8/10[/b]

[b]Status: Playing - 15 hrs[/b]

[b]Worth The Price?:[/b] $12.99 is a solid price for the amount of content packed into this game, the game is clearly crafted with love.

[b]PROS:[/b]
-LOTS of skills, weapons, gear & enemies
-Catchy soundtrack
-Unique style and nice effects
-*click on the boobs meme that the developer loves being written about* 
-Fun puzzles
-Cats

[b]CONS:[/b]
-Exhaustingly repetative at times, feels like stuff is reused and crammed in to prolong the game making some levels painfully slow to progress
-The character swap out mechanic. This is a very personal con as this is just something I don't like in these type of games, I want to level up and grow my teams strength and not have to worry about who has to sit it out and gain nothing. Needless to say Lance keeps the bench nice and warm the whole game
-It seems like there are a lot of useless skills that you would never use

I have played most games in this series since they were free browser games, I enjoyed them enough to grab this one on steam. I really enjoy the Epic Battle fantasy games for their charming humor, unique design and the sense of adventure and wonder it gives, keeping me excited for what is on the next screen or what new interesting treasure is in that chest just out of reach. The CONS I listed above do bother me, but the PROS outweigh them. I look forward to the next in the series and seeing how it is tweaked to come even closer to god cat status.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995284950', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1966, 'last_played': 1491488565}
review:
I bought this game from the Overwhelmingly Positive Humble Bundle for 1€.

I can't believe i'm writing a review of this game on Steam after playing EBF2 on Newgrounds in 2009. Time flies.
What is this game about? How the description on the store page says, this is a turn based rpg with cute graphics and stupid humor, how i like it. At first the gameplay seems simple but the game tells you from the first battle to scan every enemies because elemental weakness and resistances are the core of this game.
The game gives you a lot of equipment because to succeed you need to change your gear before starting an encounter or between waves to not be overwhelmed by your opponents. This is a good layer of strategy alongside the usual buff your party and debuff your enemies.

This brings another point i liked of this game, the forging. It's quite simple here, you need to have the materials acquired by slaying enemies or bought by stores to increase the atrritubutes of your gear and some also have passives like random chance to summon a belly flopping mammoth on an enemy each turn, auto cast buffs on your party or a damaging spell after attacking. So try equip and upgrade different piece of gear for some nice combos, don't focus on what looks the best!



The plot is quite simple and funnily enough it serves just as a background for our "heroes" to adventure on the map and acquire gear while doing stupid stuff. That's the charm of this series, the party is a bunch of goofballs with barely working brains. As Anna said: "I have no idea how they survived this long with no survival skills". Quite a different tone from your usual RPG.

Finally, the soundtrack, which is free by the way, is really good. It set up the pace perfectly with happy tunes while exploring the grass areas or fighting the early enemies, to dark tones in the toughest fights. The composer is really good and she made EBF3 music too, check that out!

Now, after praising basically everything, i will nitpick a couple of complains. First of all, some fights will drag a lot, expecially on higher difficulties, where the stats of enemies are increased, and when i saw an encounter was composed of 7 waves i was already rolling my eyes after finishing another long wave or a boss fight. I don't think it's boring, but i tended to overthink my strategy and equip for each wave and probably my brain was melting.
Second problem is that the game offers 4 characters, but unfortunatly it's best to focus on 3 and two slots are occupied by Matt (warrior) and Nat (Mage) for their highly specialized stats so the third slot is contested by Lance (Gunner) and Anna (Archer) that overlap a bit on their utility but many guides and myself went with Anna in the end since she is the newcomer and brings a bit more on the table than Lance (cough, evasion buff).

To conclude my fanboy review, i say this game gave me more than 30 hours of enjoyment for just 1€, and i plan to play   new game+ on Epic difficulty, but i can say that i should have bought this earlier, even at full price (11€.... not a lot) because it's a bargain for someone that enjoyed in his youth Final Fantasy and other turn based rpgs in the PSX era. Just don't let the "anime" graphic, "childish" humor and flash coding influence your opinion on this game.
If you aren't sure, you can play this for free on Kongregate or Newgrounds, the only thing you will miss is Battle Mountain, another end game with extra loot, but unrelated to the main quest, so you aren't missing any plot by not playing it. So you also have a demo, what more do you want?! :D

Now, i'm waiting for EBF5, currently in development, and this time i will get it as soon as possible.

TL. DR. game is good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014613743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1486213094}
review:
Conoscevo questo gioco da quando girava in rete gratis e quando lo provai dissi ''queste persone si meritano i miei soldi''
non sarà particolarmente complesso, non sarà disponibile in italiano, forse 10 euro sono pure troppi, ma potete scommetterci che mi ha divertito.
Personaggi simpatici, combattimenti che necessitano un minimo di preparazione senza però rendere il tutto complicato, mondo, nemici e abilità creativi e una colonna sonora valida rendono il gioco un piacevole passatempo senza entrare nelle complessità di giochi più moderni e avanzati, rendendolo un titolo tranquillo, solido e divertente.
Come ho detto non credo che valga 10 euro, ma con degli sconti su lo prenderei ad occhi chiusi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052438209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4622, 'last_played': 1709462988}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 (EBF4 for short) is the fourth installment of popular jRPG-esque series
that originated as web browser games. The series is basically a parody of famous Japanese RPG games (mostly Final Fantasy). If you want some more preview on the older games, I suggest you read my review on previous game, EBF3 (which is also on Steam), if you haven't already.

But to keep things short, I'll just give you a small preludium: 
the series started as free browser games that were made for fun and played to kill some free time, and even EBF4 itself can be played via your browser, but there's also an expanded, paid version (AKA the one I'm reviewing now), and it's not exactly cheap, 11,99 USD. Some professional games cost as much, and thus, the game will be judged like one.


So, first, what's the premise?
As a rather typical jRPG like game, you can expect the usual: explore the world, find treasures, both hidden and not, talk to stupid NPCs so they can give you their stupid quests, upgrade your skills and fight the enemies ( and there's lot of those).


[b] The game world	[/b]
The creator approched the matter with a safe and proven method: 
the world itself is open, but it's filled with various obstacles and road blockers (such as rocks or trees, but also more absurd ones, like floating clouds) that make your road linear at first, but with time you acquire means of bypassing them, one by one. This not only allows you to progress, but also lets you find hidden treasures, enemies, and other content, so you will definitely be coming back to old places through your entire playthrough.

As I've said, it's a safe method that was used in countless titles. And it's not a bad thing really. Experimenting is good if you know what you're doing, but if something just works, I see no reason not to use it.

The world itself will charm you with its simple graphics (which are still a major improvement over the previous one) and varied environment, as well as subtle themes to be found, such as various references to other media and clever comments spoken by your team members.  
Overall it may not be masterfully crafted, but it's full of its own unique charm.


[b] Combat[/b]

Combat has always been [u]THE[/u] core element of these games, and as such I'm very happy to say it spectacularly failed to disappoint me. 

Not only it's great on its own, it also improved on everything from the previous games without changing the basis even slightly.
Aside from the usual stuff like attacking, healing and using your Limit Breaks, there's 12 different status effect, 10 elements and over 100 unique skills which can be used BY you, or AGAINST you. Add shiploads of unique pieces of equipment and you've got EBF4.
That means a vast array of different strategies that you can use to defeat your enemies, and believe me, if you play on Epic (the hardest difficulty), you will want to spend some time thinking about them.
Want to debuff your enemies to such point they can barely scratch you? Sure. 
Want to go full offense and counter your lack of defense by making your enemies unable to move? Guess that will work too.
Naturally enemies have their strengths and weaknesses, and there's a whole lot of them (147, to give you the idea), so you will have to use everything at your disposal thorough the game.
Overall it's just what a good turn-based jRPG should look like. Give the players freedom in their playstyle and let them experiment. I have absolutely no reason to complain.

[b] Story and quests [/b]
Each game has its pros and cons, and I've already explored the pros.
Now, the story was never the main focus of these games, but it still deserves some attention. I can't really say much without spoiling it (as the story is partially revealed thorough the game). I'll just say that if you're enjoying the game itself, then the story will keep you interested, but if the game doesn't turn out to be your type, you won't stay just for the story.
The quests are just what they were in the previous game - that is, fetch quests. You are told to get some items, and you either get them from defeating monsters (or buying them from shop), or from some treasure chests, or from other quests. Simple as that. I can't say I expected more, but it certainly would be nice to see a more expanded and developed quest from time to time. Say, a bunch or chain of quests that all give you key items that together allow you to challenge some hidden boss or whatever.


[b] Finale [/b]

The game is moderately long, with plenty of additional content (most notably a fully optional location featuring lots of optional bosses and extremely long and challenging enemy waves, full of unique treasure), and fun gameplay will make sure you will play more than one time.
If you're an old-school fan of the jRPG genre (I'm not, personally), it's a must have.
If you're new to jRPGs or RPGs in general, you should at least give this game a try. If you're not sure about spending money on it, go ahead and try the browser version (or previous games whatsoever). If you happen to enjoy them, then definitely buy it, as it's only better than all that came before.
I give it a solid 9/10

review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an awesome role-playing game. The game is wickedly funny (sometimes in a lewd way xD) with cute graphics and has amazing battle soundtracks that pump you up. The best part about the game is the combat system heavily based on elemental strengths and weaknesses that make you think what the best gears and skills to equip before boss battles. Highly recommended if you're into turn-based game with role-playing adventure elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263337216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1527388662}
review:
Recomendado para aquellos que les gustan los juegos RPG:
-Exelente musica.
-Gran sistema de juego.

Debo admitir que cuando lo vi en la tienda al principio no me convencia por la forma visual como se veia, lo compre cuando estaba en oferta solo por curiosidad, pues tenia muy buenos comentarios, pero despues de jugar la primera hora de juego me atrapo completamente, no se arrepentiran de tenerlo en su biblioteca.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995417364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 6103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3296, 'last_played': 1670690382}
review: A casual game that makes fun of itself and gaming in general.  You have to love how it doesn't take itself too seriously.  Cats (cute, cuddly cats) are trying to destroy the world.  Well, F*** cats!  Turn based combat has some decent stacking and order of operation strategy.  Debuffs and resist gear are key on harder levels.  Heal with ice cream cones and steak.  What's not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561198013457785', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1706577679}
review: Acompanho toda a franquia desde o Epic Battle Fantasy 1, rodado em flash, sempre fui apaixonado pela sua jogabilidade e seu enredo engraçado. Excelente jogo, mecanicas siples, história engraçada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156469720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2807, 'last_played': 1494340184}
review:
I've began playing EBF series since my schooldays. My PC was never good enough to handle all the triple A games from that time so flash games were the only type of games I kind play. EBF series were the best of them. I tried playing EBF 4 when it first came out (4 - 5 years ago?) and never finished it because my save files got corrupted. 

Now that I have Steam knowing that EBF 4 is available here was a delight for me. I knew I had to play it to rekindle my teenage memories. I went so far as to 100% it because of passion.

EBF series has this thing that no triple A games have, amidst all those excellent graphics and complicated gameplay : It has charm. You can feel the love that the creator poured onto making the game. 

Cannot recommend enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150119804', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1822, 'last_played': 1451601490}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2491, 'last_played': 1574742273}
review:
Except for the occasional instadeath attack (which can be easily countered with a certain buff), I've actually come to appreciate this game. As you can see on the video the combat feels nostalgic as in turn-based, deals heavily with element dynamics and has a rather expansive rock paper scissors feel to it.  It wasn't an extremely long adventure but there was a bit of grinding toward the end (If you choose to leave it on hard).  

I should mention I got it in a bundle, as that sweetened the deal for me a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018056824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4212, 'last_played': 1429389087}
review:
If you loved the gameplay of old-school JRPGs, then Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is right up your alley. It's one of the few examples of a Flash game that's actually good. The story is silly and almost nonexistant, but the gameplay is satisfying and scratches that JRPG itch. The game is well-balanced almost all the way through, with almost no points that feel badly-designed. If you do pick up EBF4 do yourself a favor and start on the highest difficulty (Epic), as I feel that's the way it's meant to be played. You can always switch to a lower difficulty if it ends up being too much, which is nice.

The biggest flaw I can find with EBF4 is the 3-character party. There are 4 playable characters, but because there are permanent stat-boosting consumable items, the optimal way to play is to choose your party and completely ignore the 4th character for the whole game, because any stat-boosters would be wasted on them.

Other than that, EBF4 is a great game that, while it may not be a masterpiece, is still a lot of fun and an homage to a genre that the game industry has long since forgotten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109172060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4845, 'last_played': 1694155884}
review:
A turn-based RPG with a somewhat unique take on the genre, at least in terms of the usual story vs. gameplay argument. I've never subcscribed to the idea that an RPG needs to have a massive, epic, complex story, and this game seems to agree with me. The story of this game is basically an RPG story template that hasn't really been filled in or built onto, though the details that are there are at least charming and lend a little bit of an identity.

Instead, this game really seems to lean on its gameplay and its combat system. The weapons and armor that you equip can have a huge impact on your stats, and require different tactics to capitilize on their various perks and bonuses. There's a pretty good amount of enemy variety, and encounters are scripted instead of random encounters, leading to some battles that are created specifically to encourage you to take advantage of different armor and weapon sets.

Defeating enemies gives you ability points, which you can spend to learn new skills or upgrade ones you already have. You've got a lot more control over the tools available to you than some other games give you, and I really appreciated that. However, the fact that better versions of skills are added on top of the weaker ones instead of replacing them, and the fact that some skills give you little to no reason to use them mean that the skill pool is smaller than it looks like it is.

Playing on Normal difficulty, I never found myself having to grind for experience or ability points to be able to move forward, but some enemies reappear when you leave and come back, so it's possible to save up some more EXP or AP if you think you need a bit more of an edge. Even when playing on the hardest difficulty, the boss fights never really pushed me too hard, though some of them did take a long time to beat. Worst case scenario: one of tne of the post-game bosses in the Battle Mountain area took me 47 minutes to beat, but I still managed it on my first try.

Beating the game adds a New Game+ mode, scaling up the enemy levels and letting you replay the game starting with all of your endgame equipment. This opens up strategies you may not have had the first time through, and gave me a reason to play the game again. Beating New Game+ gives you New Game++, which just scales up enemies even more. it's basically just New Game+ again, so there's no real reason to play a third time unless you want all the achievments.

The game just endlessly repeats there. You can keep playing New Game++ over and over, and continue getting more stat-boosting items (whose effects carry over as well), leading to some absolutely ridiculous stat levels, and even the highest difficulty fails to provide any meaningful challenge after a while. The game kinda ends on an anti-climax, but the path there is definitely interesting, and given the price tag, it's worth a look, even for people who aren't super into RPGs, since the combat system is so well-refined and easy to get into.

Oh, and the music is just, amazing. Especially that final boss theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053716831', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 5312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5260, 'last_played': 1459972712}
review:
Although there will always be some who are resistant to Kupo's monetary direction with the Epic Battle Fantasy franchise, I for one am glad that I can finally support this indie developer who is beloved by his fanbase, not only for the plethra of content he's put out for free online, but for the continued, friendly support he's shown across the board on his games and site.

With that said, EBF4 is a light-hearted take on the RPG genre that takes the best out of its traditional norms and combines them into new, fun, and creative systems. Gone is the abnormally intense grind to level your characters beyond all reason, as enemies and bosses scale to player level, and can be brought down using a variety of strategies based on equips, attacks, and status effects, all of which you continually obtain more of to keep the battle system fresh and flexible to differing playstyles. The story is limited but enjoyable, requiring no previous experience with the series to appreciate fully. And while the map progression is a little linear at first, various secrets and puzzles still make exploration rewarding, not to mention the lack of random battles means you can set your own pace with the game, choosing the order of battles at your leisure.

The addition of Battle Mountain to the Steam version was a welcome change to returning fans, and a great place to accquire game-changing gear to boost your battle tactics throughout the story and beyond. Not to mention, by the endgame, quite a challenge to clear all the boss rushes, making the last dozen or so achievements quite satisfying to get. All-in-all, a must-have for any RPG and/or Flash enthusiasts; the port from Newgrounds/Kongregate was masterfully done, with no noticeable performance issues on my end, as Kupo was thorough in addressing them into and well after release.

If the price tag is a little too steep for you, pin it on your wishlist for a while, Kupo's never modest about putting EBF4 for generous sales throughout seasonal events and not. Or check out his other titles first, here or elsewhere: EBF3 is up on Steam for free, and is a good demo of what you'll be seeing in this one.

review: This is a simple but fun flash game. At the time I was in such a rush to play it as soon as steam put it up for sale I bought it. It is kinda a knock off version of Final Fantasy. It is a turn based game. If you want to buy it go ahead but I would recommend instead save that money for another game, go and find it on some random flash game site and play it for free. It is a game worth playing and if you do choose to buy it it is worth playing but if you can play it for free why not just play it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008059823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1484244308}
review:
Awesome semi-light JRPG whose simple graphics is redeemed by brilliant humour and fun and engaging gameplay.

If you like Final Fantasy games but think that they can take themselves a bit too seriously at times this is your game! I've laughed out loud many times while playing this game, and I still think I'm missing quite a few of the subtle (and sometimes not so subtle) jokes and digs at the genres tropes.

The battle system is engaging with decent skill and monster variety and lifted by the awesome attack animantions and party banter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141919718', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1590164107}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985179247', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1487881910}
review:
The story is silly and funny. It's full of little intenet speech and memes references.

The big thing that has me recommend this game though is the combat system. It is hands down one of the single best turn based combat systems I have EVER played. I have been playing RPGs for over 20 years, hundreds of them completed. This not small praise. It's an excellent system.

Unlike many RPGs, elemental effects actually matter. Ever single enemy has elemental weaknesses to take advantage of. All your weapons (bar a few non-elemental ones) have elements that deal damage of its type and buff spells of its type.
The game actively encourages you to swap equipment mid-combat to take advantage of the situation. Giving yourself over 100% resistance to an element will allow you to be HEALED by that element! More than once I've had all my team with close to, if not over, 100% resistance and the normally very strong enemy deals pathetic amounts of damage.

I cannot recommend this enough if you love RPGs and especially love good combat systems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113496314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2438, 'last_played': 1527452491}
review:
As a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy 3, this games improves on pretty much every aspect of the previous entry in the series. You liked the previous one and want more ? You'll like this one.

If you haven't, you can start by playing the others but it is by no mean necessary. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a basic Rpg made by one man and although it sometimes shows, the game is worth playing if you can get past a few things. Those things will change depending on the player. I, for instance, had to get over the graphics that feel extremely simple, the humor that can be plain or corny sometimes, and maybe the length of the fights toward the end. But once again, those might be assets to some peolpe.

What else is there ? The game is quite long ( about 25-30 hours ), it's got some depth to it that goes beyond enemy weaknesses / resistances, and overall you have fun most of the time you spend in the game if you get hooked. It's honestly still quite impressive for a one-man-game. Plus there's post-game content !

For the price it's at, if you like the rpg genre, and if you have nothing better at the moment, this will definitely be worth your time as a filler while you wait for another release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134511021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8181, 'last_played': 1679067416}
review: The Epic Battle Fantasy series in general is great to play.  Fun, relaxing, comedic, nostalgic, and if you're into it, quite challenging if you like to play on the hardest difficulty a lot.  As with a lot of RPGs, I find it's quite difficult to make a route to speed run it, but it's still fun to try and see what the possibilities are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025164374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2562, 'last_played': 1527468037}
review:
Ok, this game totally took me by surprise. Don't let the rough graphics fool you, this is a full-fledged game with a lot of content. Good content, too.
And the music, oh boy the music, I just love it. It's still playin in my head as I type this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044882132', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1535497435}
review:
This game is great. I first played this game when it was still in development on Kongregate, having a Kong Plus membership which allowed me to play unreleased, in beta games, one of which was EBF4. I beat it once before it's official release, twice afterwards when the official release was hosted on Kongregate, and now I am part way through my fourth playthrough here on Steam, and one thing I can say is that I still enjoy this game as much now as I did when I first booted up so long ago.

Now, for some actual pros and cons.

Pros:
+Easy to learn battle system, allowing even new players to easily hop in and play.
+Fun, humorous dialogue/situations, one of the best parts of this entire game.
+An awesome soundtrack, with each theme fitting the environment it plays in very well.
+Well designed environments, that do actually feel like they should.

Cons:
-Not really a con, but if you do not properly equip your team, you are going to have a bad time. For example, not using fire-type weapons on Mr. Murderous Plant.
-Some of the puzzles can be confusing, and irritating to solve.
-Monoliths.
-Expanding on the above point, that one battle where you cast Syphon 5 times, and it only works once, and the damn thing keeps healing itself and using charged attacks.
-Expanding even further, RNG.

Maybe not exactly a complete review, but it is 3:15 AM as of the time of me writing this, so excuse me for being half asleep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065046369', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1484244078}
review:
8/10 Toll.
Für Leute die kein Interesse an den im Trailer gezeigten Dingen haben ist es einfach nicht das Richtige.
Für Gamer die Indiegames mögen, oft mal alleine spielen ist es ein tolles Spiel.
Es erinnert mich an meine alte Zeit wo Browsergames noch spielbar waren und Steam noch nicht so verbreitet war.
Ein Kauf lohnt sich eindeutig, die Charaktere sind sehr süß und man sieht die Arbeit die in dem Spiel steckt,
Der Soundtrack ist auch sehr schön und einzigartig.
Ich habe die Zeit genossen dieses Spiel zu spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013443508', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1491588487}
review:
If good art (by good art I mean art that isnt from DeviantArt) is a necessary for you then you will not like this game and I whole heartedly do not recomend this to you.

HOWEVER if you want a game that you can sit down and lose about two hours before you recognize it then this is for you.
Pros
Very easy combat system
Combat system can get very complex should you want
Dungeons can take a decent amount of time if thats your thing
On the medium difficulty the game has a decent what I call "start as baby to plow through enemies" 
^Given this theres a good option for easy breezy to choke me and call me a bitch

Cons
VERY niche art style 
very ok jokes some leaning on cringey memes
music is very forgetable some sounds like rip offs from other games

Overall I do recomend this game because its fun which is what a game should be but the creative aspect of it can be limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134705018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4100, 'last_played': 1544548838}
review:
全成就了撒花纪念一下----

在此之前我对于flash游戏的评价都觉得是那种短流程小品级的游戏,直到我接触了EBF这个系列才彻底颠覆了我的看法

最早接触EBF系列是在网上玩到了3代,当时就对于这个看似简单但实际各种要素异常丰富的游戏留下了深刻的印象,甚至主动去接触了2代和1代,4代出了很久才玩到也是怪我自己没认真找,不知不觉拖到5都快出了真是(....

作为一个文字量不小的游戏没有中文支持虽然会有点难过,不过实际上并不会要求太高的词汇量,剧情轻松有趣,战斗系统的各种状态和效果也很简洁直白,稍微熟悉一下应该就能灵活掌握

游戏难度上较3代有所提升,系统也丰富了不少,还增加了新角色[spoiler]终于有人和Natalie抢装备了[/spoiler],虽然我因为觉得前代三人组很亲切所以我基本没让Anna上过前排,然后玩下来感觉Lance这作的技能才是最惨的好后悔[spoiler]MD喜新厌旧(X[/spoiler]另外最纠结的莫过于技能的分配,很多前作用的顺手的技能到了这作要其他人才能学真是过了好久才习惯...地图和前作一样特色分明,怪物的资料也清晰详细了不少方便攻略,最高难度下对于装备和技能搭配上要求变的非常高,BOSS的弱点更合理[spoiler]再也没有和3代最终战一样那种无脑沉默的战术了[/spoiler],唯一不太开心的就是虽然有通关三次的成就,但是后两次剧情并没有变化,估计也是制作者认为很多东西要积累到三周目才方便挑战吧...虽然其实不用

我看到评测里有因为难度问题差评的,但事实证明一周目直接全程Epic难度通关完全没问题,而且增加属性的道具以及稀有的恢复道具完全不吃都可以,我自己在一周目就是这样把除了5个rush的成就都做完了,这里不得不再次感叹一下游戏的难度和平衡性设计的如此之好,如果想要享受真正的回合制RPG游戏在此强烈推荐直接一周目走Epic难度,不是靠等级和伤害赶流程,而是充分考虑队伍技能装备的搭配,这样才能真正的感受到这个游戏的魅力

说来这个游戏3代在steam上免费,推荐大家可以先去体验一下3代,喜欢的话再入4代坑,虽然画面还是一成不变的flash,但是内容上绝对对得起这个价钱,5代出的话自己一定立刻去买,虽然预感到到时候自己又要坑进去近百个小时了(ry

review:

Gameplay clásico de Jrpg, combate por turnos muy dinamico gracias a su interfaz, tambien a la hora de explorar. El juego fue creado en flash de ahi el estilo de graficos que tiene.
Posee una buena cantidad y variedad de skills,items,gears,secretos,enemigos,puzzles,etc. Es un estilo de parodia con buenos toques de humor, buena musica que acompaña a la exploración y los combates.
Un relax puro de aproximadamente 20 horas.
Cromos y varios logros, soundtrack dlc gratis, mas no se puede pedir por el precio.
Se consigue a un dolar y menos tambien en paginas conocidas.

review: This is far better than I expected. It's a very dynamic game. You're able to really chose between what you want to use and there aren't many "direct upgrades" to things. It's pretty challenging too, and has just my type of humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004604866', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1590100582}
review:
Un bon petit RPG choppé à vil prix sur humble bundle.

Je commence par les moins (-) :
- Le style graphique, faut aimer mais au début je me suis demandé où est ce que je met les pieds.
- La mécanique simple qui est très bonne en soit manque d'un petit truc comme le vol de skill pour être vraiment prenante.
- L'histoire, soit un truc m'échappe encore, soit il n'y en a pas vraiment ... ce qui pour un RPG ... 
...

Les plus (+) :
- Le coté loufoque, l'humour est présent et bien placé.
- Pas mal de references au monde numérique et aux jeux vidéos, Pokemon reviens frequemment, petit clash sur le gamersgate, blagues de geek, bump de boobs...
- La variété d'items disponibles, on retrouve avec un gros shifumi, eau, glace, feu, electricité, terre, poison, sacré, tenebre... A organiser en fonction des combats et de la zone explorée.
- Le système de combat, simple et bien fichu, conforme au mode. Compétences, pouvoirs, invocations... Avec en prime des compétences liées à l'équipement, ainsi on peut voir débarquer pendant le combat un chat d'attaque, un mamouth, des frappes d'artillerie, du soin ...
...

Pour résumer un petit jeu plaisant qui se laisse explorer avec le sourire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207107097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 20321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1885, 'playtime_at_review': 7345, 'last_played': 1711938351}
review: Buying the game is definitely a very smart idea, the expansion adds much more to the game, which I was kind of missing since I'd played the game 5 times over on Kongregate and nothing was really new...

author: {'steamid': '76561197999139803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3087, 'last_played': 1485131784}
review:
tl;dr - if you can deal with the performance problems and like JRPGs definitely worth a playthough but expect frequent disruption even on top-end systems.

Pros - Good JRPG style game. Includes all the typical trope along with a unique plot (sort of - team up and save the world, JRPG style) and likeable characters. Very fun and funny game, easy to learn and a ton of stuff to do. Decent but not great controls.

Cons - None with the content or gameplay. Better controls would be helpful but not a big deal. Only real issue was frequent performance problems (the reason I stopped playing). With no resource pressure game frequently lags during combat and screen transitions. Searching the web, this is a common issue. It's apparently a side effect of translating from a Flash game to an exe and the dev can't do anything about it. The issue becomes increasingly more frustrating as you advance - the longer a fight is, the more frequently you'll see framerate drops or even complete freezes that don't correlate to resource contention. Once you get into long fights (post-endgame content) it's not worth the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229702236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1485063146}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059140487', 'num_games_owned': 2171, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1486745824}
review: I haven't even finished this game yet, as of writing this review (6 hours in), and can already say that this is great to play.  The sense of humor is delightful, and includes many homages to classic RPG's.  The difficulty curve at this point is well balanced between intentionally overly difficult and trivially easy, and the battle system is broad enough to require tactical thought, but simple enough to be easy to learn.  But the real strength of this game, as noted above, is in the comedy, which balances subtlety and silliness rather well, imho.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993748260', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1523084924}
review:
I remember playing this game on Kong and boy was it addictive. I didn't get as far into as I am now since Kong games were pretty much play on the fly. I'm on Epic difficulty, and not having too hard of a time, yet. Will update as I play through.

I'd recommend getting the game and playing through it, especially to support the developers (even though it was a flash game). Hopefully, they can move onto making a better platform for us to play this series on.

I've also played through the originals as well, I would recommend checking those out. I think I saw an announcement on this game's steam board that 3 is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024792117', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4761, 'last_played': 1485905148}
review:
I have played through and enjoyed all three other Epic Battle Fantasy games, and i enjoyed the series. Sure, it's not the best or most complex game, but the skillsets and itemsets and the way the combat work are grippingly fun and highly strategic, and the enemies were interesting the whole way through.

That is, until this one.

The game now no longer lets you win by strategy and you can't use the team you want. Unless you find the secret items or buy the exact ones which you have to use for each specific fight, and then GRIND until max level, you literally cannot win without turning down the difficulty at which point you may as well not play the game, because the story isn't gripping or interesting in the slightest.

If you're thinking of buying this game, play Epic Battle Fantasy 3 for free instead, i wouldn't even pay £5 for this let alone it's actual asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1496000491}
review:
Turn Based Combat Spiel / Auflevel-Simulator.
Von RPG habe ich nicht viel gemerkt (außer dem Hochleveln, aber das hat meiner Meinung nach nichts mit RPG zu tun).
Kämpfe bestreiten, Kisten öffnen, Blinker suchen, Hochleveln.
Das Kampfsystem ist extrem rudimentär. Die 8 Elemente sind reine Augenwischerei, es ist einfach nur aufgebläht um den Anschein von Komplexität zu vermitteln.
Es gibt unendlich viele unterschieliche Dinge zu farmen. Wieder nur künstlich verkompliziert ohne echte Tiefe zu bieten.
Der Humor war imho "In RPGs ist dies und das immer das Selbe" zu erwähnen um dann genau das Selbe zu machen. Na ja.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077184252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3036, 'last_played': 1704811629}
review:
decided to buy this on a whim because i love rpgs. it has not disappointed in the least!! i was flying through the game and was sad at how easy it was until i saw they had 4 difficulties. makes it fun for anyone at any skill level and the dialougue is hilarious. and during battle some of the things they say make me laugh til im crying.

crafting system is interesting and can buy most of the items nedded so you dont have to farm the same monsters for an eternity. leveling is about par with story so you never have to power farm either. 10/10 would have paid 3x the price for it

author: {'steamid': '76561198012925597', 'num_games_owned': 2019, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1484598378}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good, even great, JRPG that nails the Final fantasy style of game in an indie package pretty damn well. First and foremost it´s extremely flashy and looks great thanks to constant lively animations, vibrant colours and a ton of variety. The combat is engaging enough to keep up the pace and as the game progresses one does need to start paying more and more attention to elemental strengths/weaknesses, though it doesn´t get overly complex at any point(at least on the first playthrough).

The structure of the game carries it and exploring the world opening treasure chests, new story bits, talking to people and beating some mosnters is blast all the way through. The humour works with some stuff landing, some not but the tone is consistent and enjoyable. That said it´s worth keeping in mind that this is very much a full-blown JRPG first and a comedy-game second. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is both proudly part of the genre and makes fun of the funny parts of it, exactly as a good comedy-game should be.

All and all I couldn´t really recommend this game more for anyone feeling like playing a solid and pretty as hell JRPG

author: {'steamid': '76561198026089591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1484889513}
review: Very fun little RPG game.  It's a bit hard to figure out what spells, stats, etc. do since I guess they expect people to have played the earlier ones.  Overall, on normal it also has spikes where you'll be barely thinking and killing battle after battle, then get completely owned in one fight or another, usually boss fights, but not always.  Still great game and the 3rd is free to play on Steam (permenently?) and if you like fairly basic light RPGs it's hard not to love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303753026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1496609358}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a Fairly mindless JRPG parody. It's 45% JRPG jokes and 45% Internet memes and 10% random stuff (which could be memes I don't recognize.) 

The leveling system is just interactive enough to be satisfying. Your characters level linearly but they also accumulate AP to learn and level up skills however you like. Equipment can be leveled up by spending materials you collect. 

This might be the ideal RPG to play when you're sick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122070918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1501004530}
review:
When I first saw this game, I thought it was just another run of the mill clicker rpg thing... I hadn't ever played any of the ones before this in the series so I didn't know what to expect.
Now that I've played a bit, I'm hooked! It constantly makes fun of the genre, the characters are animated and lovable inside and outside of combat. The skills and all of that which is usually something that takes time to learn in other games, was a breeze to catch up on and deal with.

All in all, an enjoyable, comical game. Worth the 11 bucks and time spent on it. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198276438871', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1852, 'last_played': 1651348228}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 to kolejna świetna część serii. W przeciwieństwie do EBF 3 ta część jest płatna, jednak o wiele bardziej rozbudowana.przejście gry w 100%, czyli zebranie napierwszym sevie wszystkich medali, ekwipunku czy przejście również bonusowego rozdziału Strefa Walki zajeły mi około 40 godzin, przy czym zrobienie tego w 3 części mniej niż 20 godzin, więc widać wyraźną różnice. Grafika została również poprawiona a sama gra zyskała wieeele nowych funkcji.


Plusy :
- Zróżnicowana i świetna rozgrywka
- Chumor
- Pomysłowi przeciwnicy
- Wieeeele broni i zbroji
- 4, a nie 3 jak w EBF 3 postacie
- Wciąga na długie godziny
- Bonusowy poziom z epickimi nowymi przeciwnikami (przy kupnie na steam)

Wady :
- BRAK

Podsómowanie :
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 to genialna gra jeszcze lepsza od poprzedniej części. Jest tak dobra, że dostaje o demnie ocene 10/10 . (teraz czekać tylko aż ukończą 5 część)

author: {'steamid': '76561198133341439', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1500072918}
review:
J'ai mis la main sur ce jeu pendant les soldes steam, il etait presque donné (c'est la seule raison qui ma fait l'acheter.)

J'adore les RPG, ca a bercé ma jeunesse (les final fantasy, les tales of, les baldur gate etc) Et ce jeu promettait beaucoup de ce coté la ... Eh bien il tient toute ses promesses.

Le jeu est varier:
-Arbre de competence global (vous voulez un guerrier tank/soigneur? c'est possible) 
-Forge. 
-Systeme tres bien ficelé de combat elementaire (mouillé un ennemi avec une attaque eau, suivi d'une attaque electrique multiplie les effets, de la meme maniere, l'electricité + le feu crée du plasma, etc)
-Monde ouvert et pas du tout lineaire
-Des personnages vraiment marrant, qui sortent des blagues tout au long de l'histoire, et qui finissent par devenir attachant (Nathalie je t'aiiiime)

J'oublie enormement de choses forcement, mais je recommande ce jeu fortement.
Si vous etes Fan de RPG en general, que vous avez pratiquer, c'est une avalanche de clin d'oeil (minecraft, pokemon, fallout, FF, mario, Dark Soul, y'en a partout) et vous ne serrez pas perdu dans les mecaniques de jeu, car il reprend tout le meilleur du type.
N'hesitez pas, ce jeu est meilleur que nombre de RPG sortie dernierement !!!

(J'ai voulu le tester hier, ca faisait 5j qu'ils etaient dans ma biblio ... j'ai pas pu le lacher avant d'avoir passé 7h dessus)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080264555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1670990244}
review:
I remember playing this and its earlier parts on some websites, and i was more than happy when i got it as a gift.

It's an amazing game with good soundtrack, nice visuals and it doesn't take itself very serious, which makes the plot interesting and funny. It's worth getting it on steam even if you played it before, as the steam version has some additional content.

The only thing that i'm sad about is that monolyth enemies are weaker than they were in EBF3. I liked their design and difficulty, but in EBF4 they seem much easier to beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218696369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1541749210}
review:
A highly polished gem that takes the older Final Fantasy battle system, and does it really right. 
Pros
The battle system -
 Highly polished. Enemies can attack in waves. 
Summoning done in an intelligent way that makes them significantly more useful.
Incredible enemy variety. It seems like nearly every screen in the game introduces new enemies to fight. 
Plenty of strategy in battles

Characters Customization
Secrets are littered throughout the game, if you like collecting items.
The characters, although cheesy were enjoyable.

Cons
The story, being a parody isn't particularly great, but it's not terrible. 
I think the ending was a little disappointing.

Overall - I give this game a 9/10. If it were made by squeenix, or some other large company I would give it an 8.5/10. 
It's all around excelllent, and I really enjoyed it. And this game has cats.
How can it go wrong?

author: {'steamid': '76561198253537743', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 10243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1699921345}
review:
Não conheci a franquia, fiquei sabendo agora, mesmo assim não gostei do jogo, eu amei ele, muito bom em diversos aspectos, joguei por 3 horas, porém acho que é o suficiente pra criar uma analise.

Pra quem jogou ou joga Undertale, Epic Battle Fantasy é super recomendável, a trilha sonora é agradável, a movimentação no cenário é boa, não vi nenhum defeito neste quesito, apenas em sua otimização pra computador, o jogo meio que pede o Framerate muito rápido chegando a travamentos extremos, mesmo assim não chega a atrapalhar na jogabilidade, o estilo lembra muito jogos do 16 Bits do Mega Drive/Super Nintendo, se você é amante de RPGs, recomendo muito.
O Humor do game também é bom, como o jogo esta 100% em português, você vai entender muitas piadas durante sua jogatina, recomendo muito mesmo, o jogo agora esta por R$6,59, mesmo estando R$19,90 ainda vale muito a pena.

Jogabilidade: 10/10
Fator Replay: Ainda não analisado
Personagens: 10/10
Trilha sonora: 10/10 (A musica da primeira aventura me supreendeu muito)
Otimização: 5/10 (Infelizmente, não posso dá nota mais alta, preciso ser sincero)
Gráficos: 9/10
Animação: 10/10
Efeitos sonoros: 10/10

Nota final: 9,1

author: {'steamid': '76561198061048547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2990, 'last_played': 1492481633}
review:
[h1]Cosas buenas:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Un nuevo personaje.
[*]Más habilidades, enemigos y equipos.
[*]Arte en flash más pulido.
[*]Invocaciones. Estas no son tan emocionantes como deberían, ya que se trata de las típicas en las que gastas el turno para invocar y realizan un ataque especial para luego irse, lo que se significa que técnicamente son como otra categoría de hechizos. Lo que los sigue haciendo especiales es que los puede realizar cualquier jugador en cualquier momento (porque las animaciónes de la criaturas son muy bonitas y eso, pero en cuanto a mecánica de juego no aportan nada). Otra cosa a favor es que el Contemplador vuelve como compañero para el equipo, lo cual es bueno.
[/list]

La lista de cosas buenas es tan escueta como es, porque este juego es al anterior lo que el segundo fue para el primero: más de lo mismo pero mejor. Así que todo lo que falta por decir está dicho en la entrega anterior y no hace falta repetirlo. Sin embargo encontré varias cosas que no me gustaron y que por alguna razón no me resultaron tan molestas en la anterior entrega.

[h1]Cosas malas:[/h1]
[list]
[*]El sistema de habilidades especiales (las que puedes elegir a qué jugador asignar) no tiene punto medio: o está totalmente claro a cuál de los personajes se la tienes que dar (porque todos los demás tienen ya una que es igual o parecida) o no tienes ni puñetera idea de quién debería tenerla. Sería mucho mejor un sistema con roles más definidos que siga permitiendo repartir algunas habilidades, pero sin dejarte hacer un desmadre. Porque al final acabas buscando consejo en internet de cómo hacer una build que valga la pena en lugar de experimentar y dejarte guíar tal y como deberías hacer.

[*]Hay [b]demasiados[/b] elementos. Esto es más cuestión de gustos, pero en mi opinión con fuego, hielo, electricidad, sagrado y oscuridad basta y sobra. Humedecer a los enemigos para provocarles más daño con rayo o hielo tiene sentido, pero ponerlo como un elemento propio teniendo ya el hielo se me hace redundante. Al veneno tiene sentido que se pueda ser más resistente o más vulnerable, pero no me parece interesante más allá de ser un hechizo que haga daño en cada turno, y en estos juegos los hechizos de tierra y aire siempre me parece que están puestos sólo porque se los considera elementos en otros contextos y parece más completo, pero por lo general no tienen mucho sentido. Y considerar la bomba como un elemento propio (en vez de darle daño de fuego y/o eléctrico), es lo que el agua al hielo. Parece que es ya meter por rellenar.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198134496402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1505956553}
review:
"Начальник пропросил меня отчитаться о проделанной работе и я скинул ему на почту дамп системы, теперь у него переполнен рабочий ящик и он не может мне ответить. Ха-ха!"

"Я постоянно читал на работе R*ddit, босс спалил и уволил меня. Я отомстил - снес пароли к базе данных. Теперь ни у кого нет доступа и мы не можем починить эти компы".

Все сисадмины волосаты и с кружками в руках, хиппи из "Бивеса и батхеда" с плакатом пацифика, бог-кошка котрой не понравилось что кошки тусят с людьми, женский прикид с костюмом коровы и фраза, когда  вылезает монстр - "to eat or not to eat", есть или не есть. 

И т.д. Шутки веселые и они не отдают тухлятиной как сейчас очень модно,  и в то же время игра вполне серьезня. Больше всего напомнил фф8. Есть глубина боевой системы, разнообразие скилов и монстров. Единстыенное что напрягает - нет автобоя, приходится вручную гриндить тысячи монстров чтобы на высоком уровне сложности забить боссов, и я не нашел, где посмотреть какой враг чем атакует.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101587775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4534, 'last_played': 1626287949}
review:
One of the best RPG games I have played.

I had originally played the online Kongregate version way before the Steam version released. Everything from the characters to the anime references and memes are memorable. Gameplay is fair, it isn't too hard on normal, and although it is challenging to beat on Epic (very hard), it is not relentlessly so. This version also contains features that were not present in the Kongregate version, such as the Battle Mountain, as well as new pieces of equipment. The music is phenomenonal. Fitting for the scenario and masterfully made. Overall a great game.

Pros: Improves upon what made the previous version better and adds more replay value. Good music. Humourous. Great difficulty. Addicting.

Cons: The challenges imposed by Battle Mountain may be too rigourous for some, and that could lead to frustration (also, the final boss, lol). But other than that, I cannot seem to find any other bad things about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039746673', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2481, 'last_played': 1482747266}
review:
Best RPG combat system I've played in my life (have played about 40 RPGs). This game is not easy and you really have to think and understand it to play on harder difficulties (and you must min-max to win on hardest), but you can enjoy lower difficulty without much thought if you prefer to just have fun. About 50-100 hours of content. Fun and detailed art style, TONS of personality, a lot of scenario variety, and lots of humor.  I haven't had this much fun playing an RPG since I was a kid playing FFX. 


I cannot recommend this game highly enough. I [b]strongly[/b] suggest you stop reading, buy this game (small file-size) and if for some reason you aren't wholly, ridiculously and entirely entertained... well, you can just refund it then (unlikely scenario).

review: It's a fun game, made even better if you have a guide handy. I've played the others in the series too but it's not really necessary to have played them to understand this one. THe only downs I've come across is it will after some time start seriously lagging, sometimes to the point of locking up completely during particularly active battles. I have a pretty decent computer setup and even with it running on my SSD I have this problem. I would blame it on the limitations of Flash. Fortunately it auto saves each screen so when it does lock up you won't lose much progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139249783', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3775, 'last_played': 1561819788}
review:
Compré este juego en las rebajas de Steam, gracias a la recomendación del foro de EOL, y no puedo estar más contento con la adquisición. Un juegazo de ROL al más puro estilo reto, pero quitando, como bien explican en la descripción del juego, los aspectos más molestos de los clasicos RPG. 

La historia no es muy buena, pero sus puntos cómicos y referencias a otros juegos son buenisimos. Asímismo, los combates son extremadamente tácticos, se necesitan planificar muy bien los combates, sino quieres tener una cruel derrota.

NOTA: 9

author: {'steamid': '76561198096054438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1587, 'last_played': 1518420011}
review:
很早之前玩的3就喜欢上了，现在入个正，很休闲很有爱的游戏，一个鼠标就能玩，史诗难度大概25小时通了战斗山脉
史诗难度下的战斗山脉简直。。。现在玩了27个小时躺了460次。。。基本上90%都在战斗山脉
比如说对面5个石碑，群体高伤加冰冻加驱散。。。比如说evil Natalie，驱散全看脸，经常是魔攻叠上去一个火系高级魔法，就是那个群攻的，直接团灭_(:зゝ∠)_更别提大招了。。。。加魔防照样躺，只能靠morale状态和自动复活续1秒，有大就莽一波，没大基本上就是一波过后还剩一个，复活复活加血。
总而言之感觉最重要的BUFF还是morale和自动复活，战斗山脉一个石头玩偶在我60%的物防buff下打我1W6~2W的血你敢信。。。。
最喜欢anna的炼金弓，拿到后就一直没卸下来过，我的玩法是matt肉盾加输出，Natalie牧师加输出，anna放弃输出全加状态，lance打酱油_(:зゝ∠)_（3里面Lance的空袭好厉害，4代削成狗）玩主线时拿着炼金弓照面就是一个箭雨，战斗山脉起手就是加自动复活状态，驱散，给boss加虚弱疲劳，喂队友吃药，辅助加加血，叠叠毒，绝对零度控场
总体来说质量很高的一款游戏，期待EBF5，准备圣诞把那个弹幕游戏也入了_(:зゝ∠)_估计也是手残各种被虐

author: {'steamid': '76561198167173649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1484851360}
review:
TL:DR - 8/10 would highly recommend to those who love collecting-achievements and RPGs without taking them seriously

+ 12+ Hours of gameplay
+ New Game+
+ Achievements

- Lag/slow down issues
- Bestiary does not save to other files


Unlike Epic Battle Fantasy 3, I find this version to be harder. The game is longer due to the bigger worlds so EXP and AP leveling is a bit slowed down it seems to make up for the larger worlds and more battles.
Plenty of unlockables and pathways to go, however I find myself rarely using the new girl unless one of the original characters is dead and I am too lazy to revive them.

The puzzles are still a nice challenge, not too hard but not too easy but at the same time some of them are just time consuming and this is due to the slow down.
EBF3 did not have slow-down but even with turning off animations and making the graphics as low as possible my game still slows down and seem to freeze when changing to a new scenary. Heck my game crashed on me after a battle even though I had nothing else running. Now I keep saving more than ever incase it randomly wants to break down on me.

I enjoy the game but the lag/slow down issues need to be fixed, other on forums have reported this. It may be due to the game being larger in size then EBF3 but my game can handle much bigger and better games graphical-wise so the issue is just a massive let-down, specially when re-checking areas for 100% completion.

I would still recommend this game, I have not even completed it once yet and still have 12+ hours clocked in on this and I know generally know what to do and know the enemies already so you do get your money's worth.

Only other bad thing to say is the fact Bestiary does not save over to other save-files unlike in EBF3 where they did and this was helpful because scanning was a pain. The scanning in this one is not so much of a chore but still annoying you need to rescan everything when you start a new game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026931793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1459670612}
review:
Эту игру я приобрел не раздумывая, будучи под впечатлением от предыдущей игры серии, Epic Battle Fantasy 3, встеченной на одной из крупных платформ флеш-игр. Забавные герои, тактические бои, шутки и отсылки к штампам жанра и массовой культуры - все оказалось как и в предшественнице. Если хочется развлечься пошаговыми тактическими боями, несложными головоломками и спасти мир от могущественных противников, то лучше игры не найти.

Плюсы:
+ пошаговые бои с широким выбором ударов, заклинаний и спец-приемов, различающиеся типами урона и дополнительными особенностями
+ обмундирование не только разбито на тематические наборы и забавно выглядит, но и активно поддерживает попадающие в тему костюма действия. Например, в костюме медсестры героиня будет сильней лечить, а в форме офицера темной армии героя будет поддерживать огнем танк.
+ приятно отрисованные герои и забавные противники
+ герои имеют свою индивидуальность, в сюжетных вставках подшучивают друг над другом и штампами жанра
+ сложность сражений можно настроить - от беззаботной прогулки до серьезного вызова вашим тактическим навыкам

Минусы:
- хоть игра и не отличается сверх-графикой, на слабых планшетах подтормаживает
- чтобы прокачать полюбившийся доспех или оружие, иногда приходится погриндить ингредиенты

Отдельно стоит сказать, что и Epic Battle Fantasy 3 уже доступна в Steam, с ачивками и немного улучшенной графикой, при этом еще и бесплатно. Попробуйте - получите море позитива. И если вам полюбятся ее герои и обаятельный мир - без сомнения покупайте продолжение :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035650635', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1481292690}

Price:

Gameplay:
a good and silly turnbased game. You will be forced to change gears to accomodate each section of the map, or you know, overlevel yourself. So many items and skills to choose from.

Story:
existent but not super important

Tags:
Orbs, Cat stuff, Jiggle Physics, Animated ultimates

Verdict:
Whether you Buy this at steam sale or during normal days, you'll get hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048287597', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6261, 'last_played': 1545703460}
review:
I followed this series back in 2009 (starting from EBF 1) and am still following it.

This game was first introduced on a flash game website and to have it ported to my personal PC is the nicest thing to have.

The game is a simple RPG with a linear story line. Tons of unique (even fanmade!) monsters as well as an abundance of costumization for your characters to use. Each enemy has their weakness and each character is good at dealing certain types of damage or being a certain type of "stereotype" role.

Epic Battle Fantasy is a homage to your good ol' JRPG (Japanese Role-Playing Game) and features a keyboard usage as well as mouse usage, depending on what your preference is. The EBF series also has a lot of connections (and easter eggs!)  with Japanese stuff related, especially anime. 

For those who want a simple, yet fun RPG with tons of references to anime, J-games, this game will be fun for you!

The creator is also creating on a sequel of EBF 5 and spin-off bullet hell versions. Also check out EBF III, the prequel of this game! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198089882088', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5047, 'last_played': 1697569373}
review: Totally amazing. I'm a big fan of RPGs, adventure games and explorer type such; but being the completionist I am, this one takes the prize. Well designed graphics, well designed game mechanics proving challenge without a need to drop a drop of sweat. If you're looking for a chill, time consuming game; with the RPG/adventure aspect to it, you've came just to the right place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101130716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1533538390}
review:
我是从这个系列的早期作品（EBF1,2,3代）中了解这个作者的，这个系列真的成长了很多，从最早的一个小的flash作品到现在这样一个非常成熟的游戏。而且要感谢phyrnna（HFX）一直以来都极为优秀的音乐。现在，我决定应该为这个系列写一个评论，同时也是我steam上的第一个评论。

[b]优点：[/b]
-复古的回合制战斗系统，适合喜欢早期最终幻想等日式rpg游戏模式的玩家
-各种装备、技能、抗性、buff、debuf和替补f组成了游戏中的战术选择，每一个区域，每一个BOSS和小BOSS都有自己的特色，需要相应做一些准备
-不错的游戏平衡性，如果有一定的经验的话，可以比较轻松的通关，不需要太多的练级
-令人眼前一亮的画风，有非常可爱的猫和史莱姆，也有霸气的执政官机甲和三头龙
-有趣的剧情、对话
-有一些谜题让人时不时的换一换脑子，然而又不至于喧宾夺主
-出彩的音乐，而且音乐dlc完全免费
-游戏内容（绘画、编程）完全由一个人制作，音乐制作则另有其人
-大量的steam成就和卡片供人收集

[b]争议点：[/b]
-战术在高难度（史诗）略微单一，加各种buff是一定要做的，而且由于永久性增强物品的存在，有些人会选择固定增强某几个角色，所以阵容选择也会固定在几个角色上，导致战术核心的替补系统有时候会被无视掉。个人感觉这个更多是每个人的选择，因为我也确实见过、也试过不同的增强选择，多数都是有可行性的（物攻系的Lance,Anna），当然，给Nat加强物攻等除外。（这一点作者在EBF5的更新日志中说到他会根据这些做出一定更改）
-剧情总体有些老套，属于那种坏蛋毁灭世界，好人打败坏人，拯救世界那种，没有太多跌宕起伏的转折。不过各种细节足够风趣。

[b]缺点：[/b]
-没有中文（作者Matt说过，如果他认为这个游戏在中国能获得一定成功的话，会考虑在EBF5添加中文版的）
-Kongregate等小游戏网站上有免费版，缺少一些内容，但大部分主要内容都是能玩到的

嗯，差不多评测就到这里了。游戏时间供大家参考，我现在新档17个小时差不多要打最终BOSS了。不过我在k站上大概还有40小时左右的游戏时间。
假如你不太确定是否愿意买这款游戏的话，可以先试试史诗幻想3（也在steam上，而且免费）和flash版。
另外，做一下广告，作者最近在制作史诗幻想5，进度在他的个人网站([url=www.kupogames.com]kupogame.com[/url]）上可以看，但由于英文有些人看不太懂，我在帮忙管理一个官博（伪），负责将更新翻译成中文，并转载。新浪微博，名字叫EBF_，同时，这个游戏也有贴吧和qq群，欢迎大家关注

author: {'steamid': '76561198047332051', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2551, 'last_played': 1466364973}
review:
Душевная пошаговая JRPG-шка в духе старых финалок, но менее серьезная. Играется приятно, персонажи запоминающиеся, множество скиллов, саммонов и экипировки позволяют некоторую гибкость в билдах (да, Мэтт прирожденный мечник-танк, но даже ему можно выучить ряд магических атак и дать бустящую их экипировку, сделав его, например, хилером через Power Metal).

Хороший баланс - на нормальной сложности бои приятные и не напрягающие, на эпической - нужно знать слабости и способности противников (не проблема, ведь их можно сканировать, открывая запись в кодексе и всплывающую подсказку на самом враге), подбирать экипировку под них перед каждым боем (или даже во время боя, теряя ход), комбинировать бафающие, дебафающие и дамажные умения, и вообще всячески потеть и стараться, что играется очень интересно.

Мир статичный, но прорисован заботливо, содержит секретные области и предметы, а самое главное - по мере прохождения можно легко вернуться в старые зоны не по длинному извилистому пути, как шли, а срезав кустик или отодвинув камушек, сократить себе дорогу раза в три. Есть некоторое количество головоломок, но более сложные из них не обязательны для прохождения.

Единственный недостаток - Flash движок, из-за которого ограничено максимальное разрешение игры, и поиграть на весь экран в Full HD не выйдет - точнее, можно, но изображение может быть растянуто и некрасиво, как было у меня. Однако, это одна из лучших Flash игр, которые я видел за последние лет 10, а по количеству контента и детальности проработки не уступает многим "взрослым" играм от серьезных студий.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132245266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1703251042}
review:
Je suis fan de la série depuis ses débuts sur kongregate, lorsque j'ai appris que matt a fait une version améliorée de son dernier jeu sur steam, j'ai sauté sur l'occasion.

Mais pourquoi acheter ce jeu si on peut y jouer gratuitement sur flash? diront certains...
Voici les ajouts faits à la version de base:

-Un nouveau monde optionel, peuplé d'ennemis coriaces et de versions améliorées de tous vos boss précédemments vaincus

-4 nouveaux ennemis, qui vous prometteront un combat memorable

-quelques corrections de bugs et glitches dont souffraient la version flash

-De nouveaux achievements

-Nouvelles armures, armes et badges

-La superbe OST de Phyrrna, disponible en DLC gratuit

-2 "fins" supplémentaires (en fait c'est juste un moyen bateau de te faire traverser le jeu 3 fois, une sorte de New Game +)

bref, ce jeu vaut-il son pesant en flouze? ca dépend de votre talent de statège, étant plutot bon dans cette catégorie, il m'aura fallu entre 20 et 30 heures pour tout finir, mais sachez que j'avais déja fini le jeu sur kongregate, un néophyte à la série mettra sans doute plus de temps, ce qui est recommandé pour apprecier ce jeu à sa juste valeur.
Ce jeu mérite ses 10€, mais si vous en etes pas convaincus, vous pouvez tester la version gratuite sur kongregate ou vous prendre la version remasterisée d'EBF 3 disponible gratuitement sur steam.

review: This is definetly an underknown gem in this genre. It was, and I would argue that it still is the most fun I have ever had playing an RPG game. The humor is amazing and holds basically nothing back, the battle sistem is super pollished and extremely well done. Anyone who loves or even only likes JRPG games will definetly love this game. I would even recommend this to people who don't normally play JRPG games. And obviously would recommend this to that frend with a weird sense of humor and loves the stupid and entertaining side of life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247358758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 5728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4775, 'last_played': 1709529527}
review: This game is very much a product of its time. It condenses all that was irreverent, wonderful, and magical about the internet culture of 2010. EBF4 is impressive in its scope. Its art-design remains fresh & unmistakably original. And, its level of challenge is almost without peer. It's also brimming with memes...ancient memes. References that were stale at its launch, and by now practically paleolithic. However, if you experienced the golden age of 4chan first hand, or ever doodled on drawball.com, or spent endless hours playing every free to play game that used to pop up on Newgrounds front page, than Epic Battle Fantasy 4 will be a perfect time capsule for an internet culture long gone, but warmly remembered. Highly, HIGHLY recommended for most every netizen in their mid-late 20s. For others...less so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186348128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1999, 'last_played': 1707523397}
review: This game actually inspired my life, I found the series when i was eight, and played it for hours on end. Now I am older, and I look back at the old games and think about how much it inspired me. I do art now, and i write spectaculacular stories, and I started them becuase I was writing fan fictions. I didn't knwo they were called fanfictions, or anything like that. I made stories about the characters and I still love them today. Love you Matt Kupo!!! <3 :D

review:
EBF4 is a fantastic game for anyone who likes RPGs and laughing. You can spend dozens of hours with it and it does not get boring. The fighting system is pretty detailed and even when you finish the game for the first time, you probably won't know all the tricks about it. The graphics are also great, made with lots of time and love. 
In fact, a very good game for its relatively low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036398544', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1480065023}
review: Возможно самая необычная JRPG из когда мною виденых. Начиналась данная серия игр вообще как бесплатные флэш-игры на сайте armorgames. Однако уже к 2 части появились действительно смешные диалоги, к 3 цельная механика открытого мира, а в 4 все составляющие довели до совершенства. Откровенно говоря тут радует все - няшный визуальный стиль (перемежающийся до абсурдного эпичными кадрами типа орбитальной бомбардировки мамонтами), очень богатый и живой саундтрек, целый вагон "пасхалок" на всех видов и цветов. По сути своей это практически идеальная JRPG для знакомства с жанром. Все что нужно, все наместе + нет мозговыносящей сложности или каких-то излишне затянутых моментов. Все легко запускается на современных системах (в отличие от некоторых легендарных но старых тайтлов из страны восходящего солнца). Короче берите и наслаждайтесь!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023343442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1590280893}
review: I've put off reviewing this game from fear of not doing it proper justice, but I feel I must make an attempt. I absolutely adore this game. From the great artwork to the gorgeous soundtrack, the fantastic replayability to the hilarious easter eggs. Every aspect beams with pride and quality from the lessons learned from previous iterations and the love that was poured into it. Any fan of classic turn-based RPGs will not regret checking out this gem. Thank you Matt and Phyrnna for creating something that has brought me as much joy as this has, I can't wait to see what you come up with in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107182741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1514491173}
review:
Considering this is not only a (loving) parody of JRPGs, but was also originally a Flash game, this game is somehow really amazing. 

The turn-based battles are pretty simple, but the summoning system and being able to swap in a backup character - even when the one you're swapping out is dead- is a nice change. And the variety of weapons, armor, and accessories give a ton of options to tackling enemies. Then there's the fact that they can all be upgraded to be even more useful. 

The art style is simple too, but also pretty clean and nice to look at. Basically, it won't turn any heads, but this game is technically several years old from the time of Kongregate. The characters all look really nice and have a lot of charm, especially in their idle animations that love to add in a few fun references. And the characters themselves also have some fun personalities and banter. I really only wish that there was a little more development involved in it.

Next up is the music, which is very fun-sounding and doesn't get tiring to listen to. And considering the soundtrack is free, its definitely worthwhile. The only real complaint I have is that the tracks themselves don't seamlessly loop like you would expect, so it's pretty obvious when they do.

One of the biggest differences from the original browser version is the addition of Battle Mountain, a side world with extra-tough battles. And grinding isn't an option since levels scale (but try to come back later with more skills). It's a nice addition that will keep you coming back for a challenge, in addition to the game's already solid level of content. 

This game is overall a fun experience, that while a bit dated, can still bring some chuckles and enjoyment. So play it if you like simple turn-based RPGs.
