author: {'steamid': '76561198040820850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1553, 'last_played': 1442430119}
review:
It's a very good game for it's price if you don't take it too seriously. 

The game is very easy (specially if you compare it to some old rpgs) but the gameplay is fun with no random encounters (you can still powerlevel by leaving the area and coming back).

It has a simple UI, easy to understand and allows you to battle faster than in other turn-based rpgs.

Nice crafting system, very simple but effective, only really needed to play on max difficulty (where you get most steam achievements)

Don't expect too much from the storyline though.

Fun game overall to spend some hours. (I'd recomend using some sort of speedhack like in most rpgs if you plan on powerleveling)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048785147', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1969, 'last_played': 1426366324}
review:
Wow, this game is fun... and big! I'm amazed it's just a Flash game. If you're a fan of the old-school Final Fantasy games, this game is for you, especially if you like cats. :3 It's very rewarding, too, since the visuals are fantastic, the writing is fun, and the battles are tense (especially toward the end). I can't count the number of times when I was sure I was going to lose, but I somehow managed to get it together just enough to crawl to victory.

The final boss is the most tense battle I've ever fought in an RPG. The game does its best to kill you, but there's this tiny sliver of hope, and every turn feels like it will be your last. When victory finally comes, you will know it's because you tore it from the the maw of defeat with your bare hands.

At least, that's how I felt. Hopefully, I'm not just bad. :P I'm sure I could have leveled up more, but the pacing of the game made it feel like this was where I was supposed to be, and that feeling persists through the entire game. Grinding is minimal, and I only did it when I just felt like bashing some heads in for fun.

Get it. Get it, now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019154898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3642, 'last_played': 1526337235}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107794373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1595464658}

author: {'steamid': '76561198159841414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1443228796}
review:
I found myself craving a good game with classic RPG elements.

This game not only satified that, but left me with so many easter eggs that my entire gaming history has been relived before my eyes! :D Yes.

10/10 would click on natalie again ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009386651', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2057, 'last_played': 1458674970}
review:
A definição mais exata de "RPG" que eu achei na minha vida é esse jogo.

Epic Battle Fantasy é uma série de jogos vinda originalmente do Newgrounds/Kongregate, criada por Matt Roszak (também conhecido como kupo101 se não me engano), se baseando em vários jogos RPG porém especialmente em Final Fantasy pelo seu estilo de gameplay. Eu acompanho a "série" desde o EBF2 e agora já estamos no quarto título da franquia, além de existirem spin-offs como Bullet Heaven (aka EBF3.5). A série toda continua no NG/Kong, inclusive o EBF4 que está aqui, ou seja, você pode ir jogar esse jogo de graça se quiser, a versão da Steam existe mais pra apoiar o dev mesmo, sem falar que ela vem com uma expansão que não vem originalmente na versão Web (e que é paga, sim, a ligação aqui é bem simples), porém é relativamente barato então vale a pena comprar logo de cara o jogo.

A história da franquia é sobre uma equipe de heróis, bem estilão Final Fantasy mesmo, que saí por aí salvando o mundo das garras do mal e etc, só que eu considero esse jogo em específico algo mais envolvente por causa da personalidade dos personagens que são até resumidas na intro: Matt, o "escudo humano" do time e aficionado por espadas, Lance, o soldado "louco das armas", Natalie, a "sacerdotisa gostosa" e (até antes do EBF4) a única garota do time (sim, é ela que tem aqueles peitos gigantes se vc estiver curioso ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)), e por último, só aparecendo no EBF4, Anna, a garota arqueira que basicamente seria a "personagem principal" da história. Depois de salvar o mundo de Akron, o Deus da Destruição no EBF3, o time sai por ae fazendo coisas randômicas como sempre e um dia uma jóia preciosa da vila de Anna é roubada, então ela sai pela floresta o suposto ladrão e acaba encontrando os outros três aventureiros, e tudo culmina mais tarde em impedir a volta da temível "Deusgato". (sim, é "ela" apesar de não parecer)

O gameplay é puro RPG a la Final Fantasy, com magias, ataques, etc, nada fora do padrão exceto a criatividade dos inimigos (apesar de serem quase todos repetidos desde o primeiro). Os gráficos são aqueles gráficos de jogos em Flash (obviamente porque o jogo foi feito em Flash) e na minha opinião são muito lindos, especialmente os backgrounds. As músicas são muito boas também, creio que são todas compostas pelo próprio Matt ou então o Danny B, não tenho certeza, mas dá pra ter certeza que é algo vindo dos veteranos do Newgrounds. Aliás, a soundtrack vem de graça nos arquivos do jogo, com capa de álbum e tudo mais.

O fator replay não deixa a desejar por ter um tipo de "New Game+" que só tem na versão da Steam (ou pra quem comprou a extensão pra versão Web) que deixa você rejogar a história mais uma duas vezes depois de zerar, além de uma área extra denominada "Montanha de Batalha" ou algo assim que é como um "Boss Rush" com chefes mais aprimorados. O jogo todo em si é muito bom, inclusive alguns diálogos que tem um humor leve e algumas referências à Internet escondidas por aí.

Trocando em miúdos, EBF4 respira o termo RPG do começo ao fim, se você curte muito esse estilo não pense duas vezes em tentar, ou então comprar o jogo pra apoiar o dev.


-PRÓS
+Jogabilidade pura e simples
+História forte e hilária em vários pontos
+Fator replay bom para um jogo RPG
+É de graça na Web mas também é barato caso queira comprar
+Boobs everywhere ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

-MAIS OU MENOS
~Se você não curte jogos muito longos então esse jogo via ficar parado aí na sua Library por um bom tempo

-CONTRAS
-Como o jogo foi feito em Flash podem ocorrer slowdowns, como no Binding of Isaac original
-Inimigos repetidos desde o começo da série, poucas variâncias exceto nos bosses

NOTA FINAL: 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025334646', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1497849256}
review:
TL;DR: A well done JRPG styled game, with a focus on adjusting your gear and tactics for each group and boss to hit weaknesses and exploit status effects. Requires a bit of strategy for optional things, but no too deep if you just want to enjoy it.

I've actually played all the EBF's so far, and you don't need to play the others to play this one. Technically, you can play it for free on the website, minus some features, but the creator has done some amazing work on this title, so he deserves the money if you want to purchase it.

Epic Battle Fantasy has always been about adjusting your tactics to your current enemies, and 4 is no different. The game boils down classic turn based combat into a purely fun formula. Each battle, even bosses, you can run from at will, so if you find new enemies you can scan them, then flee to adjust your gear if you like, or just hammer on through if you can. Most enemies can be beaten by using gear with no downsides and the proper elements, but obviously you will get much better results, especially against bosses and larger enemies, if you adjust your gear to hit their weaknesses. Unlike most JRPGs, status effects actually matter alot in the game, and alot of them work well in conjunction. One of the best combos is the darkness status effect decreases stats over time, and increases weakness to holy...and the holy status effect reduces the other stats over time, and increases weakness to dark. This leads to combos, such as having an accessory that gives the darkness-only debuff to your weapons, and using that against dark enemies so they receive even more holy damage. The game is all about finding those neat combos and useful effects, and using them well.

The story is bare bones, but it doesn't need to be too epic (Despite the name), the summary from 3 to 4 as told in the intro is 'the heroes saved the world, so they thought they were entitled to everyones stuff, so they took it...that made people mad, insert new heroine'. The game makes light of typical JRPG tropes, without being too caustic. It also introduces new elements as you run into them, so it avoids any sort of tutorial. Sidequests are nothing more than gather materials, give to NPC.

The game has many things you can do to improve your characters besides levelling, optional skills that you can only give to one character, upgrading weapons/armor (of which there are plenty), accessories, permanent stat boosting items that can be hoarded through numerous NG+s, etc. While you can go through it on easy, the game does reserve the boss achievements only for beating them on the highest difficulty, which is an effort no matter when you do it. The optional area, Battle Mountain, is even tougher for it, as the enemies level up with you, so you have to rely on strategy (and maybe some stat boosting items) to win. Still, every group of enemies is unique in structure, and the difficulty ramps up well, a very well designed curve for the game. There is some backtracking as you gain new items, to collect old stuff, but you don't feel too put upon to do so.

Overall, I highly reccomend this game if you like a good turn based RPG that requires you to think about how to handle each encounter, without getting into a mindless slog through weak enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983833408', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1467570355}
review:
crazy good game considering it was developed mostly by one guy. has everything that makes indie rpgs good including:

[list]
    [*]rad music straight outta newgrounds
    [*]clever references to games as old as ff1 and as new as minecraft
    [*]really good animation and art everywhere
    [*]gear upgrades from loot
    [*]enemies are very well designed and its easy to tell their strengths and weaknesses just by looking at them
    [*]grind/gear curve is perfect
    [*]very easy to influence game difficulty
[/list]

it does have its problems though, mostly due to being ported from flash. moving the mouse anywhere on screen drops the FPS to 1 (known bug) and the game starts dropping a bunch of frames after playing for a couple of hours (only fix is restarting game). there's also no controller support which is sad but still not a gamebreaker.

if you want a fun indie "by weebs, for weebs" rpg that doesn't require much commitment (and you've already played neptunia), support scottish developers and get this. it's a good deal at the base price and at 50% off you're robbing the poor guy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034604362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2863, 'last_played': 1476669380}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a game that you can easily get pulled into and find yourself awake till 3 in the morning playing, not realizing what time it is.
To put it bluntly, I have beaten this game twice before it was on steam, then found out it was on steam, bought it, and have 45 hours played (As of this review).
Anybody who enjoys rpg style games and has played many of them will easily be able to figure out where this game gets its ideas from, yet they all meld together so well into a fun and enjoyable experience.
EBF4 isn't a game you can't really just try to fire through quickly, because while it is rather simple in terms of an rpg, if you don't approach encounters cautiously you will be heavily punished.  At the end of the day, it is a grand experience most anyone would enjoy.  With an incredible soundtrack by HalcyonicFalconX that is somehow even better than the previous games in the series it is easy to get sucked in.
Stop reading this and go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079776356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2870, 'last_played': 1535847047}
review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is easily one of my most favorite games I have played. It has over 72 hours worth of game play(which is becoming more rare in newer games) and four difficulties for even further challenge. There are many skills you can learn in the game and some are character specific while some can be learned buy multiple characters to add strategy to the game. In addition to many skills, there are many different types of equipment, each with their own special effect and stats. Aside from the excellent game play, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 has great music that really sets the tone for the game in each area. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is definetely worth the $12 since most games that have 24+ hours gameplay cost 5+ times as much. Very excited that the developer will be making an Epic Battle Fantasy 5. Will definetely buy that when it comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025403989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1437737946}
review:
[B][U]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/U][/B], terminato finalmente.

Il gioco è alla Final Fantasy (anche se con incontri NON casuali) di derivazione Kongregate/Flash (ovvero lo hanno impacchettato per venderlo su Steam) ma merita, soprattutto se trovato a basso prezzo.

In pratica c'è una storia di base, poco emozionante (i gatti sono degli dei e bisogna affrontarne due, ma alla fine...), e si controlla un party di 4 personaggi, di cui solo 3 sul campo di battaglia. Mentre si combatte se TUTTI E TRE sono messi KO, allora entra in campo il quarto, che può, se può, resuscitare i compagni (o meglio, due degli altri) e proseguire la battaglia.

Purtroppo le battaglie sono un pò il punto debole del gioco, imho. Come detto, non sono casuali, ma i mostri sono presenti sulla mappa e si decide se affrontarli o meno. Spesso sono a difesa di bauli, per cui bisogna per forza affrontarli per ottenere il contenuto di questi ultimi. 

Inizialmente gli scontri sono abbastanza divertenti. Sono a turni, con i nostri 3 protagonisti che a turno fanno la loro mossa e poi aspettano con pazienza le mosse della CPU. Fin qui abbastanza ok. 

Il problema sono alcuni scontri che 

-si dilungano su ondate successive di nemici: ovvero, alla prima ondata ne stanno 3, li ammazzi e vi è una successiva ondata con un altro gruppo. A volte le ondate si ripetono anche per 3/4 volte o più. E questo un poco rompe gli zebedei.

-ci sono nemici particolari, come i boss o nemici più forti in un dato gruppo, con DAVVERO TROPPI punti ferita. A volte scarichi il tuo arsenale per 3/4 turni e scalfisci la loro corazza di pochissimo. Bisogna metterci pazienza. Anche se si arriva con armi ed equipaggiamenti/magie giuste. Semplicemente imho hanno calibrato a cazzo alcuni scontri. Il combattimento con l'ultimo boss mi è durato mezz'ora tra sbadigli e solite mosse. Non capisco cosa trovino di divertente gli sviluppatori, se non la loro inutilità di pensiero.

Anche la gestione di equipaggiamenti ed armi e il loro livellamento: ad un certo punto ci saranno così tante cose che non si riuscirà più a capire cosa si sta facendo per upgradare qualcosa. Lo stesso per le magie, una confusione di numeri, finestrelle e simboli runici.

Io sono andato sempre abbastanza a caso, e l'ho finito, per cui è chiaro che anche qui la superficialità è lampante (a che serveperderci ore a migliorare di un millesimo, se poi avanzi lo stesso sbadigliando?)

Vabbè, mi è durato una ventina di ore, con il 60% di achievement trovati, ma a leggere gli altri li lascerei appunti agli stessi sviluppatori, che forse non hanno un cazzo di altro da fare nella vita (finisci il gioco 3 volte? Mavvaffanculo).

Divertente, ottimo a basso prezzo, ma anche abbastanza ingegnuo su scelte di importanza elevata, trattate invece con superficialità.

Pollice su, ma con riserva.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980564223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1464414384}
review:
I've had nothing but a good time playing this game.

It's a JRPG style turn based combat game, with an overworld map exploration aspect to it (secrets to be found, items that open up new areas and paths usually to treasure in old areas).

There are no random encounters, and only optional enemies respawn; once you clear a 'path-blocking' encounter it remains cleared.  Turn-based combat with a focus on using skills/spells that the enemies are weak to, with a party-wide 'summon meter', lots of items and equipment to be had all with varying effects to them such as "randomly summons a wooly mammoth to fall from the sky onto an enemy each round", "randomly blesses the character", "counters attacks with xxxxx skill" things like that.

The humor in the character/NPC dialogs is light hearted if a bit geared towards a younger crowd (not kids though).

Fans of turn based RPGs should give this one a shot, it's very easy to play in short bursts when you feel that RPG itch, or you can get 30+ hours out of it like I have so far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132577701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1475639498}
review:
One of my childhood games, on steam... imagine the excitement felt!

The game is really good if you like crude humor, epic skills, and big twists in battle. It's as much stratagy as it is action. With the multitude of skills available and diffrent weapons and armor, No battle is ever the same. Any battle can go from a walk in a park to the most intense feeling of  "oh we're srewed" you have ever felt, just because one enemy decided to de-buff you.

That being said if you dont like unreasonable amounts of damage, or instakills, or the table turning battle, and prefer a slower paced, reasonable damage, and no doubt what so ever. Try for a diffrent gsame. Otherwise give this a shot.

You should try to play all the other games before this one. Because there is a bit of a story line. 

Rate 10/10




All Hail Godcat

review:
( Review from a guy who usually play in French, sorry if this is hard to read )

Really thought that the 3rd one was the best??? That nothing could have made this game any more perfect???
Well here's the 4th game or this amazing serie.

EBF4 is a classic-styled RPG : Turn by turn combats, Équipments, Magics, Element system, ALL the Items, Aventure!!!
The game's tags already spoil it all, nothing new.

There are only 2 things you find less often in that one game tho' :
- Grinding.... ooooooh the grinding... very glad you didn't corrupt this game.
- Random battles. Yes yes! YOU decide when the action scenes starts!

The musics are amazing, so much i'm currently listening to them from the in-game gallery. Amazing idea to have more than one battle theme too, it prevents them to get repetitive too much.

The game is funny and you might need a second playthough to spot and/or get all the references mentionned in the short but frequent character's lines.

The game difficulty can be changed at will in the game's settings, so it's hard for me to give a negative point by saying that the Epic difficulty mode really can make you remember to save after every fight. Of course you could flee the battle and come back later if they are too strong for you... but really sometime you simply don't see the insta-death attack coming. 

Except for the bosses, the first 10 levels gives you short and enjoyable battles with basic tutorial windows that pop-up so new players aren't too lost. After you get to level 20-22 tho', battles can sometime get long and repetitive, especially with a high difficulty setting. Because the enemy monsters usually matches the current place you are in, it can happen that you just want to see some differant landscape in hope to see the foes also change accordingly... as you will stay in some specific 'biomes' for quite a few battles. 
The generous amount of ready-to-be-opened-gold-trimmed chests usually help you to not get too tired of these long 4-waves battles. 

The playable characters slightly lack some personality and backstory, yes, but i guess it's the perfect occasion for the 5th title to be even better that this one. Those who already played ( and loved ) the 3rd game should not see any problems with that tho'.

The price is fair, and the game deserves every single of the 9 points I can give out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060187747', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 8258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7987, 'last_played': 1710351872}
review:
If I didn't like this game, then I wouldn't have over 100 hours on it, now would I?

A lot of people like to disregard this game as a "glorified flash game" and tell you that that is why you shouldn't pay money for this game, but there are many other games, such as a lot of modern fps shooters that charge you well over $50 for something that is barely any different from any of their prequels, and call it "a new game". 

You can also think of this as a donation, rather than a price. Matt Roszak has done a lot on this game, and there is [i]a lot[/i] of content that many other flash games do not have. He definitely deserves way more than what he is getting. I would gladly donate more, if I had any more money (sadly I am a poor man).

I highly recommend this game to any RPG lovers out there. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198210437740', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1453527951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072897164', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5925, 'last_played': 1672014038}
review:
Look, if you've seen this game's trailer, and seen anything you liked, or even just had the time to look through the screenshots and said "Hey, this game looks like it might be good.", please just go and buy this game. If you love Final Fantasy, or Chrono Trigger, or Golden Sun, or really any rpg ever I almost guarentee that there is something here for you. The story, while geared more toward the 12-25 age range, is still an enjoyable, simple story that lays itself out nicely throughout the story. The gameplay flows very well, and it is very easy to notice that there was time put into making the characters and abilities balanced and scale throughout the game. While the game can be very easy when using the corresponding elemental rock,paper,scissors equipment to fight enemies, the battles can still be very long and challenging, making the title of "Epic Battle" very evident, especially on epic mode. The art is very well done, and the music fits the game incredibly.

It's also important to note that the other three games in the series are FREE online, so if you want a primer to what you will be getting you can go play those aswell, which I would also recommend.

All in all, this game, and this series, was a great effort by Matt Rosak and HalcyonicfalconX. Fantastic job, and can't wait for Bullet Heaven 2!

review:
Pros:

Seamless, fun,  and addictive JRPG style combat
Beautiful animation
You can collect panties
You can click on the hot girl's boobs to make them jiggle (and get an achievement for doing so!)
Great sarcastic sense of humor
Upgradable armor and equipment

Cons:
You can't click on the other girl's boobs to make them jiggle
All of the cats are trying to kill you
Lots of stone sliding puzzles

If you like turn-based, JRPG style games, buy this. This is my first review and I decided to write it because I love this game so much. It's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166410562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2816, 'last_played': 1518903176}
review:
This latest installment in the EBF series does not disappoint. Beautiful animations, great bosses, and fantastic Limit Breaks.

While at first it may seem like a cookie-cutter RPG, this Flash game has things that other RPGs fail to deliver. The characters are - admittedly lecherous - but lovable, the storyline is satirical and fun, and quite obviously, the game doesn't take itself too seriously; all the reason why this game is suited for children and teenagers alike.

If you're like me, and want a challenging experience whilst chuckling at the jokes and smiling at the anime references, then EBF4 is for you. 

NOTE: After playing this game you most certainly will hate cats with a burning passion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153410311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1533830331}
review: A seriously underrated game. It's funny, it's enjoyable, and as many others will point out it doesn't take itself too seriously. You'll find dozens of easter eggs as you guide your four heroes on an adventure across the land, slaying monsters adorable and ferocious alike. If the game is too hard, you can always turn it down to half difficulty at any time, and if it's too easy you can set it to the highest difficulty for an awesome challenge. And that's not even mentioning the soundtrack!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114719635', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 7087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4899, 'last_played': 1636044982}
review:
한 마디로 말하자면 턴제 RPG가 갖출 건 다 갖춘 게임. EBF시리즈 특유의 미쳐날뛰는 난이도와 폭발하는 개드립과 여기저기서 대놓고 등장하는 덕력 표출은 여전. 그나마 전작들에 비하면 쉬운 편이지만 최종보스인 Godcat의 에픽난이도 클리어율은 겨우 3% 남짓이고, 전투의 산 쪽에 가면 더 어려운 보스들이 넘쳐나니 도전적인 플레이를 즐기는 하드코어 게이머라면 해볼 가치는 있을 것이다. (그리고 신캐릭터인 Anna가 귀엽다)

게임 설명란에는 플레이타임이 25시간 정도라고 적혀있는데, 에픽 난이도 기준으로 느긋하게 플레이하다보면 30시간은 물론이고 40시간도 찍을 수 있으며 회차 플레이도 지원하기 때문에 가성비 역시 준수한 편. 다만 단점은 플레이어를 귀찮게 만드는 요소가 많고(백트랙, 고난도 퍼즐 등) 최적화를 발로 해서 시도때도 없이 버벅거린다는 것. 그리고 스팀 단축키(커뮤니티 열기/스크린샷 등)를 지원하지 않는다. 그나저나 언제 업적 다 따냐...

review:
Increíble, hacia mucho que no me divertía tanto con un juego. 

Lo que más me ha llamado la atención es que el sistema de combate es muy divertido. 
Hay una gran cantidad de cameos y parodias entre los enemigos, habilidades y equipamiento que te sacarán algunas risas si sabes de ese mundillo. Además el combate es bastante complejo, consigue que los combates sean mucho más que spamar el ataque más poderoso y curar todos los turnos.

Muy recomendado a todo aquel a quien le gusten los rpg de lucha por turnos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107803309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1435281797}
review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/b][/h1] Read on for the full review!
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]

While there are a couple downsides(and only a couple,) Epic Battle Fantasy 4 features many positive aspects of classic RPG gameplay, while also lightheartedly poking fun at RPG, anime, and video game tropes. It's cheap, too, so you should definitely pick up a copy!

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+ RPG: It's oldschool!
+ Options: All there
+ Graphics: Cute, colorful, and with nice animations.
+ UI: Remembering the last used spells is sooo convenient!
+ Humor: Very much present.
+ Price: Low, especially for playtime.
+ References: EVERYWHERE.
+ Variety: ALSO EVERYWHERE.
+ Combat: It will keep you doing different things.

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
- Not higher resolution!
- KB Mode still requires mouse

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/- You'll have to fight alot of waves of monsters.
+/- You'll also have to backtrack quite a few times. 

[h1]======================================[/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy Four...now that's a name! Like its name, EBF4 seems to be a parody of all things RPG. It sports fairly good writing, self-aware humor, a wealth of items to find, and the equipment all has unique art assets. We're off to a good start! So what's the story like?

It's a bit like this. You're a girl from a small woodland village. Three protagonists from the previous titles in the series have ransacked your village, and its prized jewel is gone! You track them down and force them to join up with you, after realizing they didn't steal the jewel, as repayment for their pillaging. You then go on to the next village to find their jewel is also gone. Okay, you should grab some popcorn for this: The jewels are meant to be seperated, and when brought together could spell doom for humankind. This is because of Catgod. Yes. Catgod. Catgod created the world, and all its creatures. It created cats in its image, but became jealous of their relationship with humans, and decided to take the cats' arm and legs, and destroy their greatest works in the world. Now someone, maybe these cats, wants to even out the punishment! You must take your lovable band of misfits and stop them!

So, we're already in for an interesting ride. What else is there you ask? Read on!

This is the kind of game where the more I play, the more I appreciate it. There is humor in spades, which sometimes falls flat for me, but it's very self-aware, so I still appreciate it. Something also everywhere is references, and I LOVE references! Other things are also everywhere, such as: skills, summons, equipment, upgrades, monsters, quests, hidden treasure, and barriers blocking your path.

The graphics are cute, with much of the stuff in the game sporting decent and equally cute animations. There are plenty of options in the settings menu. There are overworld monsters, so when you feel like skipping battles, you can. The blockades barring your way actually keep things interesting, since your equipment will all remain useful depending on what enemies you are fighting, and everything in this game can be upgraded or scales with your level. This sets a great pace for exploration, and encourages you to find all the hidden unblocked treasures you can get your grubby hands on.

Progression has a good curve. You'll level up, find items, get new weapons, and clear areas at a steady pace. There's also a lot of content to this game, for only 12$ off sale, so you'll get your money's worth, too. The game likes to parody cliches found in anime, games, movies, you name it. The humor will keep you going even if the gameplay gets old, and if it does, a quick break is all it ever took for me to fix that.

For example, I once started a battle with a woolly mammoth to then inadvertantly drop a woolly mammoth on top of it right after my party commented about how tough the fight would be. I was close to taking a break, but instead laughed plentifully and wanted to keep going. There are plenty of other nice things that will keep the game convenient and easy to play like the ability to scan monsters and instantly see their strengths and weaknesses, the ability to leave a battle without having to play a minigame or roll dice, zone teleports, instant healing slimecats, recently used spells list, and more!

Getting around in Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is easy. The UI is simple enough, although slightly clunky. There are keyboard and mouse movement options, but keyboard mode still requires the mouse for battles, unfortunately, and there's no controller support. The game also maxes out at 720p, which is quite low for modern displays. There is also, on the negative end, ocassional lag and stuttering. There are plenty of settings to mess with so you can likely find a setting that fixes that for you.

All in all you'll want to experience this game for the story, humor, characters, references, varied battles, and sheer number of items, equipment, and potential upgrades.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198122364174', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 628, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1711222786}
review:
EBF 4 is a turn-based RPG inspired by games like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun. It's the first of the series to be on steam, as the others were browser games on websites like Kongregate and Armor Games. I  remember playing one of the EBF games, although I don't remember which one. I don't remember much, so I wasn't sure what to expect.

There are quite a few unique mechanics in EBF 4. First, the backup mechanic requires one of your four people to be in "backup", and therefore not fighing, who can be switched in without using a turn. At first I hated the mechanic, but I grew attached to it and it does make for some interesting situations. Second, when you win a battle, you get AP. This is how you obtain and upgrade skills, as not a single skill is learned through leveling. Skills in the "special" catagory can be learned by two or more different party members, but only one can actually learn it. For example, Anna and Natalie can both learn heal, but if Natalie knows it, then Anna can't. Which, I recommend you do just that, but that's just what I do.
There is also "waves" system where if a battle has three waves, you have to clear out three screens worth of enemies. This is backed by the fact that all enemies are on the map, and you can engage them at any time and flee at any time, with the only punishment for flee being that the hurt or killed enemies reset.

One of the things I love about this game is that both hardcore RPG fans and newcomers to RPG's can both enjoy the game. There are ten elements and twelve status effects, every enemy has unique resistances and weaknesses to elements, statuses, and debuffs, your party's weapons give them elemental normal attacks and armor give elements and status resists and weaknesses, a complex upgrading system with a large array of crafting materials, and the HUGE amount of skills is insane! We've got buff spells, debuff spells, elemental spells, partially elemental and partially physical, spells that damage and may caused status effects, spells that damage and may debuff enemies, spells that take away enemy buffs, take away your team's debuffs, limit breaks, spells that element changes depending on the weapon you use, spells that power up in certain conditions, spells with lots of power but debuff your character, HOLY CRAP, I'm geeking out! At the same time though, the first time you use a certain spell, or get hit by a certain attack one of your characters says some, whether it be funny (most of the time because the spell speaks for itself and doesn't require explanation), or it be important information like saying the Barrier and Heal More spells are really important (which they are probably the game's two most important spells.)

Graphically, the overworld looks much different than the battle graphics, but both serve their part well. The story isn't impressive, but it certainly gets the job done, especially considering the game is lighthearted and never takes itself too seriously. Until the final boss. That's some dark crap right there. Also, I feel the need to say this. I won't spoil anything, but I had Anna and Natalie at 31, Lance and Matt at 32, and didn't even use Lance. I changed my armor sets according to the different forms for maximum effieciency. The fight took me an hour, no joke. Speaking of the final boss, the music in the game is great. Not Shovel knight is Mega man levels of great, but pretty close in my opinion. Oh yea. The final boss theme is great. The game's lighthearted theme and humor is one of the things that kept me engaged. I loved laughing the hilarious and silly dialogue, as it just added a unique spice to the battles.

If I had to find some complaints I had, they would be few, but the one big issue I had that there is a bunch of optional content, and I wanted to do as much as possible, but it just wasn't as interesting as the main quest. There is a whole bonus area with upgraded versions of the bosses in the main story, but fighting the same enemy with better numbers and a few more tricks just... isn't engaging as fighting them for the first time. But the big kicker that killed my motivation for the bonus area was that you don't get any EXP, AP, or gold from the fight. If I got even a little, I might have gone a bit farther, but I didn't even feel up to getting past the second boss.

Overall though, it's amazing. Definetly in my Top 20 or maybe 15 favorite games I've played. Top 10 would be a bit of a stretch, but it's possible. Get it if you are a hardcore RPG fan or want to start getting into RPG's. I mean, I've played RPGs ever since I was 6, I know a good RPG when I see one. And this is a good RPG.

TL;DR Read the last few sentences.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994399663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1447212891}
review:
The "overwhelmingly positive" review score makes me think of the first Dim-Sum restaurant to recieve a Michelin star. That is to say it's not the most extravagant or artistic game, but an expert execution of some basic JRPG principles. 

I've already played it from start to finish for free online, and felt it was worth actually buying. From a replayability standpoint the humor and plot obviously doesn't hold up well, but the combat is still engrossing, and what more can you ask of something titled "Epic Battle Fantasy"? The soundtrack is shockingly good in a nostalgic synthisizer sort of way, and though the tracks loop fairly heavily after 11 hours and counting I haven't muted it yet. The most impressive part for me is the level design. From start to finish you are never asked to backtrack without being rewarded for it. Exploration is heavily encouraged, and plot based roadblocks flow exceptionally nicely and naturally. Like Morrowind each 'tile' of the map is filled with side-quests and secrets to discover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025140229', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1709032090}
review:
You enter a battle with five generic looking monsters! Suddenly from behind you, a tank fires an armada of bullets at the enemies for no reason, accompanied by a cat with no legs that charges towards them with a wooden sword and shield. Your swordsman jumps in with his sword and then suddenly summons a sword out of thin air due to his sheer love for swords. You click on your mage's chest only to find out that her boobs give you an achievement. Your ranger looses her arrow towards the final enemy, but it doesn't do enough damage, that is until a giant wooly mammoth falls from the sky and crushes it.

This is just a typical battle in Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069943302', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1596612015}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025278011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1444867015}
review: I loved this game when I played it (for free) on Kongregate, so I was happy to pay to play it again (with yummy Steam achievements)! You won't enjoy this game for the deep story or multifaceted characters, but rather the goofy, slap-happy mechanics and dialogue, as well as the excellent treasure hunting and the discovering of secrets. The myriad ways to distribute skills and the beloved New Game Plus allow for plenty of replay value. It is totally unnecessary to be familiar with the previous three titles in the series, so just hurry up and get this gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108162491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3290, 'last_played': 1490067679}
review:
Pros
+ Beautiful animations, from battle scenes to idle animations
+ Hours of gameplay
+ Changing armor/weapons changes the appearance of the character
+ Lots of additional gameplay in the post-game
+ Not just about turned-based combat; many puzzles to solve and secrets to find throughout the game

Cons
- The lack of a serious plot line might bother some

Overall score: 10/10

I can honestly only say good things about this game. If you don't believe me, you can always play the free version on Kongregate to see if you'd like it. Some of you might be wondering, "Why should I pay for a game I can play for free online?" Here are my two reasons: First, there is a lot of additional gameplay when you buy the version on Steam. It's the same version as the paid version on Kongregate, but this version comes with Steam Trading Cards, which obviously makes it superior. Second, I've been a longtime fan of the series. (My personal favorite is EBF3.) in some ways, I feel like buying this game was thanks to Kupo for all of the hours of fun I spent in all of his games. But seriously, play this game.

If you like turn based RPGs, this game will be perfect for you. The animations are beautiful, and the gameplay draws a lot from the Final Fantasy series. I also love how armor, weapons, and accessories called flairs affect the appearance of characters. It's a personal pet peeve of mine when RPGs have armor, but changing the equipped armor doesn't change what the character is wearing. You can see that a lot of effort went into this game.

The game doesn't take itself too seriously, so don't expect to be blown away by the plot. There are some immature jokes as well. Neither of these bothered me, but in fairness to the other games I reviewed, I felt obligated to list a con.

Regardless, EBF4 is a wonderful game and you should definitely buy it if you like turn-based RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097629112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1484399826}
review: hallo

author: {'steamid': '76561198144266936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 195, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1711506932}
review:
You'll notice that I'm here on Steam. That's because of this gem! I got a steam account strictly to get this game! This game is the classic RPG that people like Square seem to have forgotten how to make. It has a twisted humor, great gameplay, greater replayability, battles that can range from laughable to.. well.. EPIC, and lets not forget that downright awe-inspiring soundtrack! Phyrnna (HalcyonicFalcon's work on Youtube, look her up, she does the music for all the EBF games) did an outstanding job. If your not dreading the final battle just by ear alone.. well..

The art is beautiful, the array of skills, customization, equipment, treasure hunting, and overall exploration is vast. If yer a hardcore collector in games, this is your thing! Honestly, I can't say anything terrible about it. It is just a great darn game.
I'd easily rate it 12/10 if I could!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117355769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1642, 'last_played': 1650937622}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105171300', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1435091590}
review:
As someone who pretty much grew up with the EBF series I would highly recommend this, along with Matt's 3rd game if you're interested in why everyone loves this game to bits. Not to say the first two are bad imo, since they still have their special place in my flash gaming days, way back 8 years ago.

EBF is ultimately a tribute to the classic 16-bit Final Fantasy games, but it has its own unique style with its art and its cheesy yet delightful humor. The game has come a long way since its times without an overworld, NoLegs spam and trying to defeat final boss Goku. But I believe EBF 4 really shows the peak of Matt's RPG making skills. 

It's well balanced with addictive gameplay that's simple and features likeable characters, adorable enemies, cool bosses and a fun, quirky story. This is definitely my favorite indie game and i recommend you at least check it out if you're interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997751620', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1434499365}
review:
8/10

Wow so good! Inspired by some of the best JRPG games such as Golden Sun and Final Fantasy, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a modern hit and success! I have enjoyed my time fully and have found the content and gameplay to be satisfying. The only cons I can think of is no Steam overlay and sometimes a little choppiness. Thankfully the game's playstyle doesn't require more optimization but it would be nice. All around a pretty smooth game and definitely fun!

I do wish more games would come out like Golden Sun...so underappreciated and poorly treated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047702782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1434414720}
review: This game is an awesome value.  I have 8 hours or so in it so far, around halfway through with the first playthrough (I think).  It's everything I've always loved about old school turn based JRPG, but without annoying things like random battles or save points.  The storyline is very entertaining, as are the charactars.  The ability customization system is very fun, as is the charactar equiptment system.  I haven't had this much fun playing a turn based RPG since chrono trigger came out for SNES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080793406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1629139398}
review:
元々はFlashのゲームで無料だった。
Steam版では、Flash版では無い追加要素が存在する様子。
スキル、装備などのアップグレードで自分好みのカスタマイズが出来るのと、
装備を変更すると全て外見に反映されるのが素晴らしい。
ゲームの操作性やBGMなども良好で、サウンドトラックも付属しています。
前作等は勿論ありますが、プレイしなくても（多少英語が読めれば）十分楽しめます。
前作も無料でプレイ可能。

author: {'steamid': '76561198080585804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2523, 'last_played': 1479957213}
review:
Going at the oft repeated "Dollar an hour" mantra and the normal full price, $11.99 AUD, then this game is so very worth your money.

This game follows a similar vein to the older turn based Final Fantasy games, but much more forgiving to casual gamers or those who just want to crash and find something fun to play.

Not sure if you'll enjoy it or if the artowrk will prove to be too annoying? Go give this game a shot on the many sites that freely (legally!) host this game online. Paying for this game adds many more hours (I estimate 10+ hours) of challenging gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092238625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1410744134}
review: From flash-game websites to steam, Matt Roszak's Epic Battle Fantasy is truly a masterpiece: Fun plot, nice anime-style artwork, tons of items and equipments to collect, hours and hours of epic boss battles... this game has it all. For hardcore RPG fans and also for newcomers to the genre, EBF4 delivers the very best in turn-based strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049166905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1404663121}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049002521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1559006511}
review:
I have been playing this game since the free version first came out. In fact, I have been playing this developer's games since the first Epic Battle Fantasy came out. I love each and every one of them, and I feel as though I cannot recommend this game enough.

First of all, the developer of this game is great. All of his work has proven to be incredibly entertaining and it just gets better and better with each game. The main reason I wanted to buy this game in the first place was to support him, and I am very happy with that decision.
This is one of the best RPGs I've played when it comes to the mechanics and gameplay. It is very entertaining and fun, and it is simple to learn. I love how the elements system works in the game and watching the animation for your new moves is always a reward too.
This version adds quite a bit to what I had originally played, and I love all of the added content. The new area and puzzles are fun, with the new fights being really well-done as well. The new skills and weapons are a nice bonus as well.

This game has so much to offer, and I am very glad I purchased it. Between all the customization options with characters moves and equipment, the battle system that can just be fun to watch, and all the new content, it would be hard for me to not recommend this to everyone. I love it that much, I really do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128338558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2920, 'last_played': 1507911199}
review: I've been following the Epic Battle Fantasy series for a few years now. I can safely say that each game is better than the preceding one and that Matt Roszak always delivers. The game is a turn based rpg reminiscent of a particular fantasy series. There are multiple skills, limits, summons, armor, and weapons to acquire throughout the game for the four classes(Swordsman, mage, gunner, and archer). The game features significant replay value(There are achievements for beating it multiple times after all). If you are a fan of rpg games, I'd highly recommend this to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085967983', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1524, 'last_played': 1662718014}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142123851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1844, 'last_played': 1432477090}
review:
Con una historia más típica que la jugabilidad de un Call of Duty, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 consigue contarla de una manera divertida y atractiva. La banda sonora es maravillosa y gráficamente es muy bonito y alegre, con una estética que mezcla cómic y anime el cuál coincide a la perfección con el estilo del juego y los diálogos, donde sobresale el humor. Si os gusta el género de rol este juego os va a enamorar.

Eso sí, no recomiendo para nada jugarlo desde Steam, mejor jugadlo por una página de navegador (Kongregate, Armor Games...), donde lo encontraréis de forma gratuita (sin DLCs) y sin bugs ni problemas de rendimiento (salvo que borréis la caché del navegador, en cuyo caso perderéis las partidas guardadas).
Es extraño, pero la conversión a Steam hace que este juego con las animaciones activadas y a la calidad más alta hace que mi ordenador (2,5 gHz y una tarjeta de nvidia 860) se ralentice e incluso llegue a congelarse la imagen, sin embargo, con las mismas opciones, abierto desde Kongregate (por ejemplo) me funciona perfectamente.
Además, acabo de guardar partida en el último espacio (en total hay 7 más uno de guardado automático) y se ha abierto una pestaña para darle permiso a Adobe Flash Player para guardar mayor cantidad de información en el almacenamiento local, igual que si fuese por una página de navegador; pero, Steam bloquea la pantalla y no permite hacer uso del ratón para aceptar o cancelar este permiso así que literalmente, ya no puedo jugar más :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042413199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3426, 'last_played': 1710108201}
review: Lighthearted, thrilling, and fun all the way to the end. I played it on Kongregate first, but having it here to play whenever is worth paying for. A wonderful game with a fantastic soundtrack to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196421725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1512240147}
review: I fell in love with Matt Roszark's work since the day I played Epic Battle Fantasy 2. So in a way, I suppose part of the main reason I bought this game was to support Matt. I love everything about this game: The customization, enemy designs, the world concepts (big fan of blended level themes), the music, the challenge factor, literally everything about this game is perfect. So I have no quarrel towards buying the steam version to support the developer. I will agree with another that the game has a very "flash" feel to it though, and may not appeal to some. So try the free version on Kongregate before you decide to make the purchase. This game gets a 9/10 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113084737', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 12361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6730, 'last_played': 1709534849}
review:
Although I consider Epic Battle Fantasy 3 to be my favourite (and free), I still think this game is very good. You're able to choose from a wide variety of equips and skills, and able to even choose certain Limit Breaks on certain characters. Epic difficulty is certainly no joke now, especially on 2nd playthroughs and beyond. 

The music is also amazing as always, and Phyrnna stands to remain one of my favourite composers. 

The only downside I can see is the game lagging on my computer at max graphics, even though I have a fairly powerful computer - it doesn't really matter so much as it's turn based and the lag isn't so bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037253336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2940, 'last_played': 1563272711}
review:
I honestly have a feeling that all the negative reviews are from people who've never even bothered playing the other 3 games and know nothing about the engine that was used for this or even gave it an actual chance. It wasn't RPGMaker so you obviously fail for trying to compare Kupo to a "reddit RPG Maker /b/tard". If anything since you know reddit so well that you used categories and seen for yourself how people are on there then you must be one of said "/b/tards.". 

This game is literally an indie RPG masterpiece referencing all types of games and genres and heavily Final Fantasy referenced. I played this mostly on Kongregate and the moment it was on Steam I bought it. The OST is AMAZING. I listen to it all the time at work. Halcyonic Falcon X aka Phyrnna <3 I love you <3. You can get all the EBF4 music on her YouTube or Spotify channels. Maybe Pandora, I don't know because I don't use Pandora. You can also get the soundtrack from the Steamapps folder of this game too.

 I've been a long time fan since EBF1 and Bulletheaven. 

I can't stress how awesome this game is for what it is. There's actually A LOT to do in it and you can easily upgrade EVERYTHING. However I'm missing like 1 piece of armor I think, I can't remember but I read something about it only being available at a certain time? I forgot the full details of it. It's a well known question a lot of people have been asking about in the game because they can't 100% the armor collection. Still haven't figured it out yet. 

The thing about this game is, if you want to speed through the game, you can change the games difficulty to easy. The only difference the game makes is the damage you receive from enemies and how much health they have. Basically just a stat difference. There isn't anything too significant unless you're trying to get all the achievements in-game. The game doesn't seem to give you extra rewards after battles, just the overall challenge of the fights. I usually find it easier when I'm trying to rush through the game to just set the game on easy until I get to a boss fight because a lot of the enemy fights tend to get pretty tedious over time the I crank up the difficulty to hard or something because I can't do epicyet and I'm on my second playthrough. This game does have pretty good replayability to it. Especially the fact that you need to clear the game 3 times in order to get the achievement. However that 5m damage achievement is insane. I can't seem to pull that off with the Revenge skill when everybody but Matt is dead and Matts near dead while atk buffed. I guess I just need to farm for atk stat boost items.

I honestly give it a 9/10 for me only, because some of the non-boss battles can get really tedious and it does lose entertainment value after awhile. It's good to play this game for a few hours a day unless you decide to play on easy  the entire time until boss fights show up and crank up the difficulty.

But in general I give this game a 10/10 just because of how well made it was by 1 man and how well the music is for the game by 1 woman. It's definitely a masterpiece indie RPG. 

I can't really find anything wrong with it in general. Just a few personal afflictions I had that shouldn't affect a lot of other people as much as me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066745288', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3999, 'last_played': 1534897917}
review:
Warning, Shit review trying to be funny incoming:
Holy fuck this game is amazing. If you are a fan of oldschool turnbased JRPGs, you will love this, the games light heartedness & humour really does it for me. It still has the cliche "Oh no the world is going to end unless we kill a god or something" storyline but it has a slight twist, while the game doesnt take itself even the slightest bit serious.

 Unlike Final fantasy where its like "You MUST defeat the main villian because he WILL destroy the world and ONLY YOU, a 15 year old kid or something, can defeat him! Along with your companions of, a dog, another member, a machine gun armed guy, and Bewwwbs (Come on you must know who I'm referencing there). 
While this game is like "Oh no the world will be destroyed by an evil god, who is a cat. Who has other cats which will kill you... Yeah. Oh and also you can get an achievment for poking a woman with large breats enough. Have fun!"

But yeah, I fell in love with the series after finding it from EBF 3. The game has been massively improved from that one & many more things have been added. Usually, I find it crappy where games have a crafting system where its not needed, *COUGH* (Alien: Isolation) *COUGH*, but this game does it perfectly, it is an optional thing to do, all it does is make your equipment better & you can easily buy most of the materials needed from the shops. This game also has quite a few references to other games too, like the Tr*force badge (as in Triforce in case you couldnt tell :p). 

This is droning on, I'll shut up now. Over all review, buy it.

EDIT: No I am not correcting horribly spelt words & poor grammar. I'm lazy :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198108223735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4109, 'last_played': 1429033901}
review:
Best jiggle physics in recent games ever.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 used to be a browser game. I used to play games from Miniclip and other websites that provide flash games, but for some reason I didn't came across this one. Boy did I missed out. In case you couldn't tell, its a turn-based RPG. It has funny jokes, fourth-wall breaking and references to other games all over the place.

Like every RPG, you go around killing enemies to get materials to upgrade equipment, doing quest and side-quest and buy stuff from shops, you know the usual stuff. And thats what makes this game great. Its a very nostalgic feeling of how a RPG should feel, but they removed one key mechanic that made this game even better.

NO. GRINDING.

Item drops from enemies for upgrades can be bought from shops so you can grind or if u have gold u can just buy it from the shops. This made me so happy to see because so many games rely on grinding to extend the gameplay which is extremely tedious. 

The characters are great, the music can be better (tho i usually play the game with the music and sfx muted cuz i can play while doing something else) and the achievements are challenging and fun.

RPGs lovers have no reason to not get this. This game is great. Cant wait for EBF5 whenever thats gonna be.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198117265477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1549825486}
review:
Okay, so, theres three senarios on why you'd want this game:

1. You completed the [url=http://armorgames.com/play/14799/epic-battle-fantasy-4]Free Flash Version [/url]And Wanted To Find Some More Adventure In The Same Game! And, Yes, This Is Extended - But Not Exactly How You'd Think.. (You May Not Have Completed It.)

2. You Are An Epic Battle Fantasy Fan And Find It On Sale Here, Ready To Buy. You Didn't Play No.4, Yet Alone Know It Was On Steam, Or You Didn't Even Know No.4 Was Out!

3. You Are Looking For A Decent RPG Game, Or A Friend Recommended It, And You Come Across This. You Would Have Purchased It Already If You Didn't Notice The Big Fat [h1]"4"[/h1] Tag On It, Emplying Its A Further Installment In The Series And Had Such High Pricing, So You Look At Reviews.

Well, I say [b] ALL [/b] of the above is why you should get this game! To support the maker, To play a new game, and to have fun with a fresh game to you. The story is a continue from [url=http://armorgames.com/play/6897/epic-battle-fantasy-3]Epic Battle Fantasy Three,[/url] so I recommend playing that first. Maybe the characters will be a little knew even in that game, but you should get used to it. Even in number one the characters werent explained! Once you play that, get this game for:

It has cute characters like kitten gods as your main foes, loot that you wouldnt find anywhere else, epic storyline, challenging puzzles, imagination behind the idea, RPG adventure, weapons of extroadinary looks, cutsences with emense artisrty, extended fights, major fun, enchanting music and more! I recommend this game for all of that. 

The exclusive content to the full PC release on steam are:

• Includes Kongregate’s Premium Pack, which adds:

•    8 new bosses, 27 new equips, 8 new skills.

•    Huge new area to explore.

•    Survival mode and boss rush challenges.

•    Newgame+ feature, with higher level monsters.

• Support for different window sizes and fullscreen resolutions.

• Uncompressed audio and various visual improvements; the game looks and sounds better than ever.

• Integration with Steam’s achievements, trading cards, and most importantly, cloud saving.

• Includes the soundtrack. (26 tracks!)
Added Awesomeness: 100%

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

And.

The Cute Ones Deserve It!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098591583', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1448477577}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049015550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2056, 'last_played': 1513567263}
review:
I freakin' love this game.  Before I get into the controversial stuff that I like... let me just say that the battle system in this game is amazing.  You can decide which characters get which special moves, you can level skills up that you want while leaving others in the dust if you choose, you have to level up your equipment (especially in later battles) to ensure you have a nice diverse set of resist gear to survive the challenging boss fights (depending on the difficulty you set it on).

Did I mention that there are tons of hidden chests, quests for npcs (that aren't necessary for progression, just a bonus), an extra difficult bonus location for those of us that bought the game, and an amazing sound track?

I personally really got a kick out of some of the commentary between the characters.  The story is obviously very light-hearted and the gimmicky chats between the heroes is usually comical - not to mention you can click on Natalie for a chuckle now and then.  

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 for me was a breath of fresh air in a market that no longer caters to those of us who liked the traditional jrpg such as the early FF games/nes/snes rpgs of the past.  I like Skyrim and all of the clones of that new genre of rpg that are out, but I REALLY like the old style.  As someone who grew up in the 80s and 90s playing the rpgs of that time, and if you did too, you will like this game.  

Thank you so much Kupo for putting this together, I just wish EBF5 was out...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034772380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1446060926}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a upbeat, funny and lovable game. It has great humour, interesting and well thought out characters and a fun storyline. The battles have lots of different factors to consider e.g. enemy types, weapon types, atacks, equips, etc. and you really get engrossed in figuring out what skills and types you need and where. Each character Anna, Matt, Natalie and Lance all have unique personalities and styles and you can customise the abilities they have to a certain degree which really lets you feel involved with the team.

All in all you will spend hours playing and forget how long you are at your pc until an annoyed relative comes and tells you to try talking to people instead of sitting around all day, to which you reply 'Never!' and carry on playing this amazing game!

Also as an added bonus Matt Roszak (the Developer, Publisher and Creator) has included wallpapers and the soundtrack in the local files of the game! Which is awesome as the soundtrack is one of my favourites!

P.S. I have more hours than it is displaying for a odd reason... oh well!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976081787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2623, 'last_played': 1547967016}
review:
Old school turn based RPG combat.

You play a girl from a village that had their idol statue stolen. 3 Heroes from the prior games (Not on PC all tablet) figured since they saved the world they are entitled to everything so they are on a mass pilfering spree. The villager finds them and beats them up only to find out that they did not steal the statue. The surrounding villages have also had their statues stolen. So now the 4 go out to try to find the theif.

For its simplistic look it is really a very good looking game. You can tell that this is a port from a tablet. The music is outstanding and is even available as a soundtrack. There is no voice dialog but the storyline and text dialog a great. The game makes fun of the whole RPG and Anime environment.  The characters are often making fun of each other and making jokes. Each character has a specialty and can learn most the others.

You have the main girl who does Earth damage, the second girl (the "pretty one") who uses advanced magic and anime style heals, a techno guy who uses guns and has a tank, and the last guy who does mostly direct damage "meat shield".

The game looks simplistic and will quickly ramp up in difficulty. Definitely a great turn based RPG game to have with lots of comedy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202757876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1546372301}
review:
If you want a fun, light rpg that can also be soul-wrenchingly challenging, then this game is for you! This isn't a short game, and alot of work has been put into it. This version is definetly worth it. The addition of Batlle Mountain is very worth it, and I reccomend it. If you want to help support the developer, buy this game!

+wonderful soundtrack
+long yet not too long 
+great storyline and funny moments

author: {'steamid': '76561198093625214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1439947718}
review:
A must-buy, must-play game.

I highly suggest playing the first Epic Battle Fantasy games (you can find those online) for the sake of the storyline and getting to know some of the characters.

This game made me laugh out loud more than once with its fourth-wall breaking and really bad jokes. 
The gameplay itself is absolutely fantastic in every conceivable way. It's smooth, engaging, and there are a lot of challenges that'll keep you on your seat for a long, long time (from puzzles to bosses on Epic difficulty). The artwork is cute, and so is the plot. And finally, the characters are absolutely lovable and memorable, with each one having a unique (and sometimes unusual) personality.

One of the best games I've ever played, and though it will probably not come out, I do hope that Matt creates an Epic Battle Fantasy 5. I really wanna get to know Anna more as a character, and I kinda wanna see some possibility of some relationships blooming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153609705', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1453012956}
review: Very fun game, with an amazing art style, a great storyline and an fantastic soundtrack. However you can just play this game for free on Kongregate.com, but this game is definitely worth paying for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067317930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1632002441}
review:
Some people may complain that you can play the flash version for free, and this costs $12.99, but think of this:

It's less laggy. It comes by default with the premium DLC. You can play without internet access!

The graphics are appealing, the writing is witty, and the story is great, and has plenty of callbacks to previous games (which, for reference, can be played for free on Kongregate and other flash game websites.) I love this and I think it's worth every penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030767212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1429563495}
review:
Was machen Helden nachdem sie die Welt gerettet haben? Sie plündern Dörfer und Städte weil ihnen ja eigentlich danach eh alles gehört!
Und warum haben Katzen keine Pfoten? Na weil sie ihre Katzengötter beleidigt haben und von ihnen verflucht wurden!
Und warum können sie dann trotzdem Waffen und Schilde halten? Aus dem selben Grund aus dem du Blitze mit deinem Schwert verschießen kannst!

Epic Battle 4 ist kein Rollenspiel, es ist eine Satire auf Rollenspiele. Es ist kurzweilig, einfach zu händeln und nimmt sich selbst nicht sonderlich ernst. Motiviert es zum durchspielen? Mich zumindest nicht, aber Preis und Äktschn sind okay, auch wenns nur mal für zwischendurch ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022554058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1426743720}
review:
Almost to the end of the story, I think. I love jrpgs and there aren't that many good ones on Steam or the PC for that matter. But then there is EBF4. The story isn't much to write home about but it's still cute and the writing is pretty humorous with tons of references to other classic games.  The world is pretty big and each area is unique and has plenty of different types of monsters. Crafting is simple and straightforward but satisfying and there are tons of skills to choose from.

I have two very big complaints however. There is no controller support. Which is a shame because I wanted to sit back and relax whilst playing. The other complaint is the UI is a little cluttered. Even after hundreds of battles I can't remember which menu a specific skill is in but that's probably just because I'm dumb. 

Either way the game is well worth the money and I'm will be playing it any time I need to satisfy my jrpg urges.
