author: {'steamid': '76561198010395257', 'num_games_owned': 3313, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1571518159}
review: Initially the plot and writing comes off as derivative, stupid, and fairly juvenile.  This doesn't change throughout the course of the game, but it doesn't seem to hurt it either.  The battle system is fast, fun, and addictive.  The puzzles range from simple to mind-bending.  The amount of quests you get as well as bonus upgradeables is fairly extensive as well.  If you can get through the first initial groanings of the plot, you will find an incredibly fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030986771', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1543616706}
review:
Ok, so, once upon a time there was this guy named Matt, and he decided "I'll make an RPG cause why not."
So then Epic Battle Fantasy was made, and it was cool.
A few months later, Matt talked to this girl who went by Phyrnna, and was like "You wanna help me out with this?" and she was like "k"
So then EBF 2 was made, and it was great.
So the, Matt was on his throne of loot, and he was like "this isn't working" and so he gave EBF open world mechanics, side quests, and loads of other shit.
And so, EBF 3 was made, and it was AWESOME.
2 spinoffs later, Matt decided to then just go "eh screw it" and made another, this time with more length, sidequests, enemies, equipment, skills, strategy, and of course, amazing goddamn music.
And so EBF 4 was made.
And it was concluded that the game was fucking amazing.

Ok, so, actual review:
STORYTIME
The story isn't much to ride home about, but it's enough to keep the game moving along, so it sorta works. It is still moderately engaging, and doesn't just devolve to "go here because we aren't gonna say". At least I can still remember what happened in the game.
6/10? 6/10.

The Graphics
Very colorful, slightly animu style graphics that are all in all nice to look at. Also, goddamn, some of those abilities are amazing visually (mostly the limit breaks).
8/10 m8

The Gameplay
My first runthrough was on normal mode, cause I'm a pussy. But I'm currently trying to get through the game on Hard and later on Epic, so yeah.
Basically, this game doesn't fall into the common RPG problem of being able to just spam normal attack to win except on bosses or something, and actually requires a large amount of strategy to get through it. You actually need to be able to adapt to situations, and exploit certain weaknesses to be able to defeat certain enemies (ex. That Goddamn Cosmic Monolith) 
Exploration is also awarded well in this game too. There are several points in the game where backtracking and exploration can be very useful to you, mostly after you get key items. As well, this game has two optional areas, one small and pretty easy, with the other being basically a super dungeon where the enemies scale to your level and you fight some really powerful bosses. (Again, fuck cosmic monoliths.)
Also, there are a metric ton of deifferent pieces of equipment to customize your character with, allowing you to find a way to fit almost any situation by the time you begin the New Game+ runthroughs.
Also, the two NG+ runthroughs cause the enemies to level up with you. That's pretty damn awesome.
10/10 Am playing again

Music
You ever heard of Phyrnna? No? well you should listen to her songs. The EBF 4 soundtrack, along with the soundtrakcs for EBF 3 and 2 provide some of the best songs I have heard in a video game ever. Weshdoor Concert? Amazing. Derelict Factory of Twisted Metal? Amazing. Outside the Battlements? Amazing. The Rim of Battle Mountain? Amazing. Fallen Blood? Best final boss theme ever. Every single track here is amazing, and you should listen to all of it.
10/10 would listen to Fallen Blood for the fiftieth time

srsly, get this game, also is pretty funny.

9/10 am playing several times again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037721844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2286, 'last_played': 1426239911}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 - The first thing that popped into my head when I heard of this game was, "what kind of name is that?" Going by the title alone, you almost expect this to be the most cliche RPG ever, and it is - in a good way.

EBF4 is a bit of a parody of RPGs. You have turn based combat, level ups, and gear, just like in all your normal RPGs. You've also got characters that crack jokes at their own game, and much like the little indie game EvoLand, it likes to make reference to other games fairly often as you bash enemies over the head with oversized weapons.

At first glance, this game looks like the kind of flash game you'd play in your internet browser when you were little - the art is colorful but looks primitive and the controls aren't complex. Yet this is the kind of 'flash game' that someone poured hours and hours into, and it shows; the art style may very well be simple, but that's before considering how much you can customize your characters. Each and every helm in the game gives the characters a different hairstyle, for one - heck, I spent more time than I'd like to admit mixing and matching outfits to see what was both stylish and combat practical.

The game is very lax in terms of its rules. It could almost be said that it got rid of all the little bits that make RPGs frustrating - encounters are not random, running away is penalty free, all gear is useable once upgraded, grinding is not necessary (except maybe for Epic mode) and upgrade ingredients are plentiful. The game doesn't have you trecking an hour to get a single ingredient - everything progresses at a quick and painless pace.

Make no mistake, the game is challenging on Hard and Epic modes. One's ability to arm characters with the right attacks and gear is mandatory for taking on the game's big bosses, even if said big bosses look too comical to take seriously.

Overall, a very pleasant game, and there's no way I can't recommend it. It's not the kind of gripping story about trust and betrayal that will move you to tears, but it's a fun little title that does everything right, and should be recognized for it.

review:
This game is amazing, The steam version is totally worth it. If you are as big a fan of turn based RPGS as I am, This is pretty much going to be your holy grail.

The characters are quirky and the game doesn't take itself to seriously.
The amount of bonus content is staggering, i'm over 70 hours in, and I still havent beaten everything yet.
Some parts of the game can drag on though, and to getting to the best part of the game (the third quest.) can be a bit tedious, buts its really worth it.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083104600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1426027394}
review:
Es un juego con un argumento tremendamente simple y la trama no despierta mucho interes. Solo teneis que buscar 4 piedras,  pero eso no es todo el juego...
Es un juego que mezcla las cosas buenas de muchos RPG, y aunque al principio puede parecer muy infantil (que ojo, lo es) puedes mejorar armas encontrando objetos, tanto en el mapa, como los que te dan los enemigos. Tiene algunos puzles divertidos, muchos secretos, y aunque el mapa es relativamente pequeño, está construido de una manera que se nos hará largo y no nos dejará acabar el juego almenos que juguemos mas de 15-20 horas.
Algunas magias y armas os harán soltar alguna carcajada. 
El nivel normal al principio es muy facil, pero como luego no mejores armas y aprendas habilidades los jefes y submisiones que hay repartidas en el juego os seran imposibles.
Para acabar, los dialogos son sosos, pero adaptados a la actualidad.
Una cosa que tiene el juego es que podemos huir del combate, cambiar dificultad, grabar, quitar habilidades una vez aprendidas y otras cosas cuando queramos. Eso le resta dificultad.
Conclusión: Si nunca has jugado a un RPG o no te van mucho, este es tu juego. Y si te gustan los RPG tambien es tu juego. Recomendable al 95%. No te aburriras y seran unas horas bien invertidas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108908550', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 8194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6202, 'last_played': 1708204106}
review: First played EBF2 on Newgrounds, loved it, but wished it was more complex, EBF3 comes out, can't get any better than this. see EBF4 on steam, stop what I'm doing, drive to the store, get a steam card, play for 4 hours straight, get up next saterday, play 7 hours straight, got 54 hours out of 1.5 plays of the main story mode, and this game has a VERY high replay  value, useing new setups, putting skills on diffirent units, and explaoring all the new crap in the extra zone, my only flack with this game is that one, I never needed to use Lance on my first play. Two, wish there were more and more varied skills. Three, would love a challange system where you have to do extra stuff in combat to earn rewards, such as "Kill at least five foes with one attack" or "Use the same attack on the same unit that was weakness to that element 4 times in a row without killing it" Just a few thing that I think would add to its size. Still overall, worth MORE then you are paying for it, oh and try the third game too. Still kicks ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972997740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1425787547}
review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 looks like a shallow game you would find on a smartphone at first glance. While it isn't that complex once you actually dig beneath the surface and start playing you quickly find a well crafted turn based RPG with a lot of good mechanics and customization. A lot of the character's abilities are as comedic and far fetched as the story and it turns out to be a lot of fun. Advised for any Turn Based RPG Fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007870547', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1514642000}
review:
I honestly could not stress how much I recommend this game to RPG enthusiasts. I played the Epic Battle Fantasy series when it was just an evolving flash series (with a really fun bullet hell offshoot) on Kongregate. I loved each and every iteration, and I loved EBF4 to the point I sat down and went full nerd-out on it with writing things down, calculating, minmaxing, the whole nerd-works. I loved it enough I actually put money towards the microtransaction it had. When I heard it was coming to Steam, I was super hype for it, but I never was able to get around to snatching it. Now that I have it, i've revisited it and am having just as much fun - if not more! - than I was on Kongregate. 

The game itself is what I would call a tribute parody. The entire thing is self-aware of its genre, but also faithful to what it's parodying. Classic turn based combat with a rock-paper-scissors elemental / buff / debuff system, many items to equip to this end, a buttload of spells and abilities both natural to each character AND others that can be passed between each. Saving on the fly, resuming on the fly, overworld monster encounters instead of the random encounters we all are used to from classic RPGs, and those monsters tend to disappear permanently if they areb locking your main path. The scanbot allows you quick reference mid-battle to what an enemy is capable of, while also giving you a permanent bestiary entry for later reference. There are plenty of other features that really speak that an RPG enthusiast is behind the development, who has gone through the caveats and annoying nuances that many RPGs over the years have tossed at us that plenty a gamer have thrown their hands up at in rage. There is an abundance of humor, including puns, references, tropes and similar things that make fun of itself and its genre, and also referring to other games, series, memes, etc. without being overbearing and causing you to roll your eyes. 

tl;dr: This is an RPG made by, and for, RPG lovers, and I could honestly say you're missing out if you pass this up and are an avid player of RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983531060', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1425604977}
review: Bought the game to show support for the dev after a twitter statement he made, didn't expect to like the game at all since I generally dislike jrpg style games but after testing it I ended up playing it for a few hours and then some more.  This game is a pleasant surprise. Good characters, funny jokes, bunch of 4th wall breaks, nonsensical conversations (in a good way) and the combat makes me want to reevaluate my stance on jrpg's.  If you like games that don't take themselves seriously then this is a good one to try out.

This game is really reminiscent of the old classics with an added touch of fun and humor. The BGM's were also amazing and is included in your steam folder so you can chill with it if you want to.

Verdict: A great fun game, I would buy it even if it is twice the price.

I strongly recommend this to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983291252', 'num_games_owned': 4279, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 3648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3637, 'last_played': 1425003990}
review:
This game is an awesome bundle of fun.

It has a lot of the charming qualities that old turn-based RPGs had and it also has some decent writing to boot. There's a large equipment pool and a good variety of enemies. It's technical enough to be fun without dubming too much down. Proper preparation prior to battle can mean the difference between a 20-second battle and a 1-minute battle.

As far as difficulty goes, the game is not very hard. The endless battles, monster marathons, and boss rush modes can provide a mild challenge if you play on Epic difficulty.

Achievement-wise, there are some very simple achievements along with your standard beat-the-game achievements. There's also ones designed for hilarity (click on Natz' bewbs and touch the chicken)! You can tell the person who designed the game has a good sense of humor. The only thing I didn't like is how tedious the game felt while going through the 3rd playthrough. Since I am an achievement hunter, I felt compelled to 100% the game and trek on through playthrough #3 in order to get one of my last few achievements. One thing that I felt could have been done better is some variety when it comes to consequent playthroughs. I found myself picking up chests which served no purpose because it gave equipment I already had. If anything, those chests you've opened on older playthroughs should have something else.

I recommend this game to turn-based RPG fans. It's a good deal and provides 10-15 hours of fun on each playthrough if you casually go through the content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068471336', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1531349207}
review:
A pop-culter-referencing Indie RPG? Sure, I'm game.

The Good-

BRILLIANT dialogue
Simplistic, yet tricky-to-master combat
Quite creative in terms of enemies and other characters
KICKASS soundtrack
Animated boobs (Suck it, Mirror's Edge)
BRILLIANT comedy, balancing pop-culture referencing with 4th wall breaks

The Bad-

Graphics are kinda "Meh"
Not much in terms of endgame content
INCREDIBLY frustrating at times (Looking at you, Godcat)
Aforementioned 4th wall breaks MAY get a tad repetitive

The Ugly-
Pikachu murder. (In Greenwood Village, I believe)

review:
EBF4 is a fantastic JRPG with very nice aesthetics, fun & strategic turn-based gameplay, and lots of references to make you smirk even a bit. The entire series is pretty good, but EBF4 takes the same elements from the previous games and improves on them in every way. You can play it for free on Kong, but the paid version has some extra content and it supports the devs. If you like turn-based combat with a side of cats, jigges ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°), and gr8 banter, you'll truly enjoy this gem.

EBF5 pls :D

Edit: Btw, the game's soundtrack is quite phenomenal. You'll enjoy that too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119370615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6827, 'last_played': 1710089900}
review:
This is not your ordinary game. This game is fun. This game is indeed an epic fantasy of battles.

This is a tale of three cities: Greenleaf, Whitefall and Goldenbrick. One day, a ranger from Greenleaf - a girl named Anna - woke up to the most horrible sight: the sacred jewel was missing. For about a year, a team made up of a pirate-samurai, his red mage female partner, an ex-Nazish gun aficando and their limbless cat had wandered the land, pilfering their way through. To be honest, this sort of unscrupulous behavior was mainly because they had defeated an elder demon the previous year, and most of the world owed them a few favors - begrudgingly, perhaps - and really didn't mind. Anna's mind instantly wandered over to this group of heroes, and set out in search of them...

author: {'steamid': '76561198055585763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2477, 'last_played': 1442802061}
review:
10/10 stars

I love this entire game series more than I like most triple A titles. If I had to make one suggestion, it would be that with each continued playthrough as you obtain the same equipmet item, you should get a +1 added on to its level 1-5 for each time you find it. I am trying to get the "beat the game three times acheivement", but it seems useless to collect the same items over and over again with no real insentive to do so. For example if I find the ice sword for the second time after getting it to level 5, it would be level 5 still just with a +2 modifier beside it adding to its overall stats and effects. just a suggestion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960269409', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1527354916}
review:
Very tight combat mechanics with a lot of interacting skills, status effects, and equipment.  The depth of customization here is stupendous.  It keeps the combat fresh and only becomes tedious near the end if you need to power-level your way up to handle the extremely formidable bosses.  Interesting characters, tons of loot, and the diverse combat mechanics keep the game engaging all the way to the end.

Graphics are anime-style rendered in a flash engine.  Not exactly crysis, but it doesn't want to be, and it fits the feel of the game perfectly.

The dialogue is humorous - adolescent and boob-focused, but again, this game doesn't care about that and neither should you.  It knows what it wants to be and does it great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992752428', 'num_games_owned': 2155, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1436099198}
review:
À la base il semble que ce soit un jeu gratuit développé avec un outil du style RPG Maker et autre. 
Voulant être un hommage aux anciens JRPG qui ont bercé la jeunesse de certains d'entre nous, le jeu se révèle assez plaisiant avec un humour douteux et de nombreuses références. 
La version disponible sur Steam propose du contenu supplémentaire évidemment, mais ne justife pas forcément le prix.
De plus l'overlay Steam n'est pas intégré, donc le jeu en fenêtre est conseillé, impossible de faire des captures d'écrans. 
Si vous n'arrivez pas à lancer le jeu, pensez à lancer Steam en mode admin et de même pour le jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198119642351', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1498688840}
review: What can I say about EBF4 that hasn't already been said? The gameplay is fun, the mechanics are great, the graphics look very nice, the humor has 4th wall breaking and overall great writing, and the game doesn't have many problems. There are 100+ achivements, and you feel obligated to collect all of them as a personal challenge. This game is amazing 9.9999999999999999999999/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035447278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2724, 'last_played': 1518088208}
review:
I've been playing these games since the very beginning, and played 4 when I was testing it on deviantart. This is by far the best one yet, even if I do miss some of the sweet equipment from 3.

Very funny game, charming with a sweet array of enemies and abilities for each character, plus a fourth character that isn't in any previous game. (Not-So) Subtle references abound to various other games and anime, and the steam version adds features that even earlier versions of the same game did not have. 

Quite similar to the classic 90's RPG games, you'll think final fantasy primarily. And like any good Turn Based RPG, it's a thinker's game, great for those who love attention to tactics. 

I'd reccomend any of these games, any day, play the earlier ones for free, and drop a little cash for this one. Thumbs up~

author: {'steamid': '76561198118895501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1421171200}
review:

Рекомендую всем, кто любит весёлые, динамичные JRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127974273', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4240, 'last_played': 1653099497}
review: This is quite easily my favorite game.  It has a great sense of humor and pokes fun at other RPGs/anime in a lighthearted and endearing way.  There is enough to do in order to beat the game (and then again on NG + and then again on NG ++), unlock all achievements/gear, and complete the optional areas, that you will get far more than $12.00 value out of this game.  I'm more than 70 hours in, probably around 100 if you include the first time I played this game on Kongregate, and I still haven't experienced and completed everything the game has to offer.  I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys RPGs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009840353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1420677261}
review:
I feel like this game is exactly what happens when a two-year-old Redditer or /b/-tard gets a hold of RPGMaker. The game tries to pass itself off as funny, witty, and clever, but "meme-based" humor and party members with half of their entire dialogue written in "l33t-sp3@k" simply is not funny. Or enjoyable. Or entertaining. Or anything other than "annoying." It all feels painfully forced, tedious, and failed to get even so much as a giggle out of me. Then the game introduced the Black-Mage-type/offensive spellcaster, Ms. Fanservice, whose special ability is a "sexy wink" and I gave up on this atrocity altogether.

The only good thing I have to say about it is it's turn-based battle-system is kinda fun and it was really the only time when I enjoyed myself in the game. However that does absolutely nothing to set it apart from all the other RPGs out there and in the end this game is not something I would recommend to anyone. Ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169214416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2526, 'last_played': 1595063717}
review:
To put this simply, THE GAME IS SO FUCKING AMAZING! Whilst i havent played it in a while, the soundtrack is too good to pass up.the game is powerful. it gets right in your face, supplying you with amazing humor, music and art. the style is anime-esc and the series was (obviously) inspired by the final fanatsy series. i certaily can give a decent ranking just on that. Now the fun part is for people who like collecting EVERYTHING. you can complete the game 3 times over on the same save, with all your equipment, after you beat the game. the gameplay is something like an ideal game to relax with. I rated this game a 7.5 out of 10 before. i can, without doubt change this to an 8.5 because of how much i have spent playing this game. (including my hours on kongregate before i bought it, i have around 84 hours total)
Matt, you are a beast. keep doing what you do best. (keep making these amazing games!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986553417', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1527378431}
review:
I can't say enough good things about this game.  If you like turn-based, final fantasy style combat and RPG's that don't take themselves too seriously, then you'll really enjoy Epic Battle Fantasy 4.  The battles are fun, there's lots of loot to help you customize your characters. and there are a ridiculous amount of achievements.  The music by HalcyonicFalconX is guaranteed to get stuck in your head too.

There's a free Flash demo you can try on your favorite webgames site. I put many hours into it before I discovered the complete version was available on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010608587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1422534216}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062386601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4436, 'last_played': 1450032908}
review: This game, while a pretty traditional story-driven turn-based rpg, really stands out for it's art and attitude to the conventions of the genre.  The constant lampshading of rpg and video game tropes and humerous dialog keep it going strong when interest in the story fails (as it inevitably does) and the combat gets repetetive.  This isn't a game to binge-play, but more of something to do when you don't want anything too exciting or gritty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105080516', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1519051036}
review:
EBF4 et le dernier et meilleur épisode de la série,c'est une série de jeu qu'on peut trouver gratuitement sur internet et qui allie fun et stratégie (oui j'ai dit stratégie) On peut voir d'opus en opus que le jeu c'est grandement améliorer passant de simples combats enchainé a un vrai RPG tour par tour avec un monde plutot grand et joli,le jeux est très inspiré des vieux RPG a l'ancienne en vu du dessus mais en alliant un monde au en couleurs composé de créatures plus ou moins attachantes avec une dose d'humour et d'easter eggs a un systeme de combat composer de competences d'attaques et d'items/armes/armures en tout genre

Bref je recommande grandement EBF en général meme si je trouve le jeu cher alors qu'on peut le trouver gratuitement sur internet

author: {'steamid': '76561198052579977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2465, 'last_played': 1420364568}
review: First old school type JRPG i've played in a VERY long time, and it made me remember why I liked them so much.  Lots of options and depth to the game in terms of elements/stats/effects/gear, and the fact that you can make the 4 characters into almost any type of class you wants negates the fact that there's no real character variety.  The one real downside I will say is that the storyline and comedy really wasn't there for me.  Maybe some spots where it made me smile, but nothing resembling laughter or really funny moments.  Worth the purchase for the one play thru, plus if you like it a lot there's plenty to do after that like endless modes, marathon battles, and epic difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043878087', 'num_games_owned': 998, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2310, 'last_played': 1403732346}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054071991', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4458, 'last_played': 1533788875}
review:
This is the first and probably one of the very few reviews I will bother doing - Because its rare for me to fidn a game I enjoy this much. I have been following Matt (Kupo, the creator)and playing his games for a few years now. Bullet Hell, EBF3, EBF4, and a few other titles. I have to say, this fourth installment of EBF is the best. The game gets better every single time. each game has more equipment, strategies, monster and boss variety, skills, and medals. There is no way to express how much I really enjoy this game. There are tons of light-hearted jokes, and meme references. Also, there are a ton of referneces from old school games and shows - especially pokemon. "Don't thing too hard - you may hit yourself in confusion." "IM NOT THAT DUMB."........" Weak generic bat enemy used wing attack!... It wasn't very effective." Littlle things like that (and there are tons of them) make this game so much more enjoyable. Also, Matt ridicules himself and the game several times through his characters. He doesn't take himself or the game too seriously, yet he makes every aspect of it near flawless. Its one of the few games I can actually sit through more than once and do it multiple times. Also, the ability to switch from easy to spic instantly is great. Some might think its cheap, but honestly, you only get achievements on epic... no need to fight 1000s of monsters that mean nothing on epic when on the bosses matter on that difficulty.

Pros
Skill variety
Monster variety
Equipment variety
Strategy (You will get crushed... especially on Epic difficulty... if you don't think before you act)
Humor
Achiements/medals
Endless monsters and challenges
Puzzles
Multiple characters
Tons of secrets and hidden chests
Lots of quests
Graphics (pretty intense for a flash game)
Music (and they say video games don't have real music)
New game+ and several difficulties, along with ability to switch difficulty whenever.
Large map. Seemlessly merges together once you open all pathways. Lots to explore and discover.


Cons
Sometimes choppy on steam. Probably not the game's fault. Plays fine on Kongregate.
A lot of backtracking and memorizing. I personally don't mind this, but some might. There is a walkthrough for this game on kongregate if you cant find something or get stuck on a boss.

10000/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995733340', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1422151984}
review:
This is a standard RPG with its selling point probably being its humor. It's pretty addicting.

The two best things about this game:

- When you get a medal, notifications appear on your steam client, the game itself (satisfying sound effect included), and if you have ASTATS open in your browser in the background, it'll appear there, too.

- What's even better, is when in game, you're fighting an enemy and it barely lived as your turn ended, then it gets struck by lightning and dies, ending the battle. Or even better, it gets crushed by a falling mammoth out of nowhere. Or two of them.

If you feel that's underwhelming, maybe this isn't for you. I recommend you play the free flash games, Epic Battle Fantasy 1~4, to see how you like it before buying it. They're on Kongregate and other flash game sites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121655364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1805, 'last_played': 1575043356}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042183304', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 12452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1729, 'last_played': 1543182817}
review:
Quite enjoyable, and very nostalgic as I had played the previous three installments which were flash games. Reminiscent of the RPGs of old, with unique new twists. Offers an arcadey experience with a plot as intricate as the Mario franchise, so you don't really need to worry about getting caught up or anything since anywhere you start is pretty much all you really need to know.
Like I said, a very arcade experience for those who want good, strategic combat out of their RPGs. Multiple difficulty levels which can be changed outside of combat. Alot of the game will be you having epic combat in a fantasy setting, but I suppose the title could have told you that much.

This game gives plenty of replay value, despite the 28 hours I clocked in at the time of this review, I haven't finished a single playthrough yet. Provided, I did alot of mucking about with sidequesting and took my sweet time, and if I went straight for the final boss things could have been done quicker, but this game features a whole host of battles that aren't part of the main map and further enhances the whole "arcade" view point.
Although, by no means is this game tedious just because you fight things alot; the main focus of the game is RPG combat, as referenced by the title, and it delivers.

People have said there's a free flash version of this game, and there is; but it doesn't include the content this has. Said content is the particuarly large "Battle Mountain" portion which has a HUGE amount of content, and this version supports up to three newgame+ runs, with enemies scaling with player level each NG+. This also runs better than the flash version, which is a given due to being a stand alone client now. The dev also did a good job with the previous three flash installments, so why not show him a little love? Alternatively, you could purchase the "full verison" on kongregate and play it there, but I feel that's less optimal. It's cheaper, but it's still going to be in flash there and ultimately not as 

Despite not having a indepth story, which isn't a bad thing mind you, the characters were still interesting to me. Graphics are pleasantly cartoony and colorful, with lots of detail and style.

Also, unlike the flash version, this has cloud saving, so temporary internet file shenanigans won't muck anything up.

Also features comedy and good times!

Ultimately, this was a good buy. I forget whether I got this on sale or not, but looking at the price I'd call it worthy of twelve dollars. On the other hand, I am a real scrooge, so I prefer to save as much money as possible when I buy things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052559091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3258, 'last_played': 1443646998}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is the latest game in the series of flash driven, turn based RPGs by Kupo Games. Its tiny development team, headed by Matt Roszak (Whom is credited for design, art, story and programming).

This is a game which should be praised, for the amount of effort put in. The result is a well realised and full RPG experience full of character and heart.

The game retains enough nostalgia from old school RPGs but still manages to feel fresh and new. If you’ve ever played any Final Fantasy title pre FFXI you’ll be familiar with this format. 
It gives a master class in how a turn based system should play along with all the usual elements you’d expect, being able to cast magic, summon other creatures, use items and attack and it does this as well as any JRPG does. Its appeal for me was that this is a finely tuned machine of a game. Usually with turn-based RPGs you eventually become so powerful that nothing is really a challenge, except maybe some bosses but with a combination of a difficulty slider that makes a difference and some well paced scaling of foes, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 keeps you on your toes and makes you think a little bit.

I’ve always loved turn based RPGs when done well and RPGs in general, but turn based more so than Action. The reason being it brings an element of strategy with out reliance on quick time events [which i hate]. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 makes full use of the strategic element of the genre.

It does this through its use of equipment and skills. The majority of weapons have an elemental effect which will assist you in tearing through enemies that are weak to that element and each piece of equipment has a use, without the collect and discard method used in most games. Weapons can be swapped out in combat also but this will take up a valuable turn to do so. Not only that, you won’t be receiving that free ride through an area.

The skill and specials pool is a very well implemented way of customising your characters and their skillset. Skills can only be learned by that specific character and specials can be learned by all, but only one character may have it at any one time. Once again, brings some difficult decisions forward. You can also equip the characters with items that will provide passive bonuses or abilities within battle, another little customisable option for balancing your team some buffing characters and some casting abilities at dice-rolled intervals. Gone, in this game, is any idea of an “Ultimate” weapon. For me, that’s refreshing. Each weapon can be upgraded as you collect items from combat or treasure.

The characters are well written and interact nicely. The personalities feel genuine and It seems like they are inspired by or based in some way on friends of the developer. At times they do act like close friends who have a lot of fun in each other’s company. This game is no doubt a labour of love and the small team at Kupo Games must have poured a lot of time into this game. It is increasingly rare to see triple-A games give this creative warmth, probably due to the size of the teams but Steam lets this flourish.

There are a lot of small gestures and references that experienced RPG fans will appreciate showing a good dose of humour. From the snow covered Djinn from Golden Sun in Whitefall Town to the name of some of the achievements you can gain for using new items they flow through the whole game well.

Epic Battle Fantasy’s achievement/medal system is well implemented. Some are very difficult to obtain, some pretty much laughing in the face at how ridiculous achievement systems are. When combined with the bestiary gives you that feeling of collection that a lot of games look past. It makes you want to collect them, this is important. 

A game by a turn-based RPG fan, for turn-based RPG fans, this will likely not appeal to those who only play Shooters or Wii Fit games but give it a chance and it may well draw you in. 

To wrap up, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an absolutely fantastic game, made even more impressive by the huge contribution by Matt Roszak. 
It is a game i’ve played over the Christmas holidays and will likely play again soon. With a Newgame+ option it is set up well for this. The art is soft and friendly, the enemies range from menacing to adorable. The mechanics are solid, the story is well written, the characters engaging and the experience is enjoyable. 


It can also be bought for next to nothing because ‘Steam’.

4 Ferrets out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198071042705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1429959331}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1426049198}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is by far the best parody games I have ever played.  It pokes fun at a lot of classic console RPGs, but the real heat of the game is the way they combined what made so many other games so memorable.

The game is a simplistic true turn based RPG on the outside, but stesses a depth of strategy with a wide variety of equipment and monsters that have elemental strengths and weaknesses.  There isn't a single weapon or piece of armor in the game that is optimal for each and every battle (there are some that come close to defying this though).  You strenthen your weapons and armor through a basic crafting system that requires a hunt of scarce materials, but offers an item shop near the end of the game where you can buy the materials you might need at a hefty cash price.  There is even a achievement for poking...  Uh...  Nevermind.  The storyline and plot is pretty flimsy, but on the flip side, there isn't a need to grind to complete the game.

I strongly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys console RPGs of the 90s, even if they didn't grow up in the 90s.  There isn't any need to play the earlier iterations of the games to keep up with the jokes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048451386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1445104181}
review:
There's an achievement for clicking Natalie's breasts and making them jiggle, stealing underwear, and leaving a character dead at the end of the battle. 

So, basically, you are rewarded for teasing a busty girl, running away with her intimate clothing and leaving her dead in the end. Just like real life. 10/10





But here's the real review.

Originating from a browser game, the fourth installment of Epic Battle Fantasy is on Steam, and for a very good reason. I haven't seen a lot of turn-based fighting RPGs like this one, but it really hits the spot.

It has excellent humor, and I often find myself laughing uncontrollably as I press space to advance through the chatting/cutscenes, seeing hilarious lines being announced by the characters, either in the arguing present everywhere in the game (because Natalie's boobs/Matt being a disgrace/Anna living in a tree/Lance having microcameras stored in his armor to "look" at Natalie's boobs), or in the battling of hundreds of enemies (because they are too weak/strong/disgusting/cool/tasty/scary, or because they resemble Pok*mon too much).

The characters are beautifully designed, and their personalities are constantly clashing with each other due to their differences, creating a constantly interesting atmosphere to get your mind off the battling and strategy if you're playing on Epic. There's things to like in all of them (and if you look at my profile you MIGHT find out which one is my favourite), and the soundtrack is amazing as well.

All in all, it sounds like I'm reviewing a GOTY title. And I can't say I don't love Epic Battle Fantasy the Fourth. Thank you Matt Roszak for making this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972391438', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 5139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1458758621}
review: I've been playing EBF on the web for some years now and I never thought to buy it on Steam until today. I love everything about this series and this particular installment. It has everything the first three game had and more! You have an extra amount of everything in this Steam version of EBF4 and that makes it worth it's $12.99 price tag. You have at least 3 playthroughs for increase replay value and you've also got EPIC mode which delivers an intense challenge for the daring and grizzled veterans of the series. This game boasts a lot of content, witty writing and that trademark turn-based RPG goodness we all know and love. I recommend this game at it's full price and if you see it discounted I would double recommend you to buy this, it's a wonderful RPG!

review:
사실 웹에서 나온 2부터 시작했는데... 확실히 3는 웹보나는 난이도가  좀 상승했다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032453239', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2483, 'last_played': 1515027526}
review:
J'en suis à 30 heures de jeu, et ceci est mon premier avis " concret " sur la communauté Steam!

Je recommande fortement ce jeu, c'est un petit bijoux!!

Si vous aussi, vous avez adoré le final Fantasy X ( ou même les autres! ) , si vous aussi vous aimez les sorts qui ont des effets supers stylés, une vraie évolution de la puissance ( vous tapez à 50 au début pour ensuite... un succès à 30 Millions de dégats en un coup, WHAT?!! ), si vous aimez les combats tour par tour stratégiques ( un gluant d'eau vulnérable à l'electricité, un golem d'ombre qui absorbe les sorts de ténèbres mais est vulnérable aux sorts sacrés!! ), CE JEU EST FAIT POUR VOUS!

Il est d'ailleurs très long, 30H et je n'ai toujours pas fini une seule fois le jeu! et dire qu'on peut faire des new game + !!!

Il y a ENORMEMENT DE SORTS, beaucoup beaucoup d'armes à d'effets divers ( contre attaque avec un sort très puissant etc ) !

Des énigmes à résoudre sont aussi au rendez vous, mais vous serez bien récompensés en items et en stuff!
Des équipements d'ailleurs très interessants, augmentant diverses stats, des résistances jusqu'a 200% ( par exemple, 150% > vous absorbez 50% des dégats d'un element! ) et certains iront même jusqu'a lancer parfois entre les tours des SORTS tous plus variés les uns que les autres! ( oui oui, une rafale de balles de tank en début de tour qui va vous amocher salement le groupe ennemi! )

Conclusion: amateurs de RPG tour par tour, d'humour gentillet et un peu gras, d'optimisation, d'effets visuels, FONCEZZZZZZZZ, ce jeu est génial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015500019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2824, 'last_played': 1620181150}
review:
元はフラッシュ版なので、やりたい方はまずフラッシュ版からやるとよい
面白いと思ったらDL版を買おう
DL版はプレミアムパックが最初から付いてるので追加課金はフラッシュ版と違って必要ない

ゲームシステムはよくあるターン制でJRPG好きな人ならお勧め
また戦闘もよくできており、弱点を突かないとダメージが殆ど効かず耐性を付けないと手ごわい一撃を貰ったり一筋では行かなくなってる
難易度は四種類あり（Easy 50% Nomal 100% Hard 150% Epic 200%*)、いつでも変更可なのでお気軽にプレイできます
（*敵ステータス補正）
クリア後は2週目もあり、やりこみ要素は高い。敵も一週目と比べて強くなっている為、やりごたえがある。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045442671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2573, 'last_played': 1408576633}
review:
This game is undoubtedly one of the best flash games I played. The amount of work done to this game is phenomenal. I remember playing this on Kongregate and enjoying the hell out of it. Once I heard that the full version of the game was selling on steam, I told myself that I had to buy this. AND I played through the whole thing, including through all of the additional contents with Battle Mountain! Here's why this game is worth a look!

POSITIVES:
- HOURS of content
- Not so serious story with humorous elements of characters
- Four characters to play as (Each with unique skills)
- Many ways to customize characters (Skills, Costumes, Badges)
- Several areas to explore and tons of foes to face!
- Game presents a challenge and difficulty scales gradually
- Many RPG elements that people who are familiar OR new to them will love
- Many rewards, many prizes!
- Don't need to grind this game in order to beat it. From what I remember correctly, enemies scale to your level.
- SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING!
- Art design of world and characters are attractive
- Can save your game anytime
- ACHIEVEMENTS!

NEGATIVES:
- No gripping or remarkable story
- For people who do not like casual RPGs, this is not your cup of tea

Overall, I enjoyed playing through this game again and experiencing the challenge of Battle Mountain! Hope this review helps make a clear picture of Epic Battle Fantasy 4!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086395513', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4046, 'last_played': 1709478711}
review:
There is an achievement for stealing panties.
10/10

Edit: In all seriousness the humour isn't the only thing great about this game. Epic difficulty is very difficult and rewarding at the same time. There are some difficult puzzles. Late game (on epic) has some 30 minute+ fights which are all or nothing - very tense, and very rewarding. Because of the way skills work there are some which you have to choose which character to take them on - i.e. revive which is only way besides using an item to actually revive a dead ally (which is pretty important since most attacks in the second half of the game are one shots).

The only bad part of this game is the first boss where you have limited options because you have no skills yet :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198043935082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1699258972}
review:
So Captain, what's your opinion on this game?
...
Huh? Sorry, I was too busy playing EBF4.
Anywho, EBF4 is an RPG where you control 4 characters but you only have 3 at once. That 4th character is your backup, so you're thinking "Oh I have to take a turn to switch out and now it's going to get mulched by the enemy, great." but nope! Totally free, just take that action and you can still attack! (You can do this multiple times as well...for fun I suppose?) That's the thing with this game, it leaves out all the bull**** (Pardon my French) and leaves all the fun, such as no random encounters. But doesn't that make the game too easy? Ha ha, no. If the game is too easy, you can easily take on the upgraded bosses in the bonus stages but the normal bosses are hard enough. Considering that I always make sure to be two levels above the current boss's level, it's easy for me but I figure if I didn't do that, it'd be a challenge. A fair challenge, but a challenge nonetheless. The game is exciting and fun to play, there's always things to look out for such as hidden items, enjoyable character banter (Your mileage may vary, obviously), and so much more. It's only 5 bucks due to the sale but if it was priced on merit, I'd say it be 40-50$, 60$ would be stretching it but for a game like this, I sure won't mind coughing up the dosh for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072174860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1457291324}
review: A unique, well-thought-out RPG featuring a classic battle systesm. With 4 difficulty options that can be swapped at any time, the game has appeal to all fans of the genre, whether you're a hardcore power leveler or just rushing through the mandatory battles, the combat is simple and with many skills to level at your command, battles become more reliant on your own decisions. The dialog both in combat and in the field is witty and surprisingly well written, though some dialogues can be misplaced if missed in an earlier fight. The art in the game is fantastic - the character and enemy models are well-drawn and all have a distinct EBF artstyle. Each piece of equipment modifies the character models enabling the player to decide what their character stats will be and cool or cute they look. The story mode is fairly lengthy, taking anywhere from 15-25 hours on a normal difficulty run depending on completion and grind and features several optional challenges, with massive replayability including New Game + and Battle Island. Last but not least the music, by HalcyonicFalconX is not only great, but each piece fits amazingly with the nature of the battle or field, making the entire RPG experience phenomenal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060302913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1610678079}
review: Epic Battle Fantast 4 is what most RPG's today lack. a focus on battle, skills, gear and just plain fun, exploring a vast land with as many side quests as you want without gunking up the main plot of the game. unlike other games where finishing side quests and gridning for level seams more a chore then anything EBF4 makes it all worth it by showing a clear advantage against lower level enemys as well as making the items from side quests worth the effort and back tracking some require. over all if your looking for a fun respin on clasic RPG's i highly recommend this game to anyone looking for some quick pick up and go fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198034635154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5311, 'last_played': 1449778934}
review:
Alright, to begin with let's get the tricky stuff out of the way. 

First of all, this game is cheeky and doesn't shy away from cracking jokes at everything, itself included. If you're easily offended, you might want to keep that in mind when making your decision, but ultimately it's all light-hearted and carefree. So don't make it a political thing, it's not. 

Secondly, while it's true you can play this for free on Kongregate, the Steam version (like Kong premium version) adds extra features (including new game plus), an entire new zone with bosses on illegal stimulants, supports more resolutions and you get the entire soundtrack, which is, might I say, really, really good.

Now with the disclaimers done and over with, let's get to the actual game.

It looks old school and cartoony, with turn based combat in which you slash, hack, blast and nuke your way through loads upon loads of critters, ranging from cute bushes (never thought I'd use that phrase seriously) to intimidating elementals. Elemental strength/weaknes system is in play, and there's plenty of elements and status effects to play around with. There's a lot of room for experimentation with gear and skills, and even bosses can be beaten through different approaches.

The soundtrack, as I said already, is AWESOME. No really. Just listen to it and appreciate it. It does a lot to round up the game experience. HFX has done an awesome job yet again (the only kind of job she ever does it seems).

It's not a hardcore RPG, even if it offers its challenges, but that makes it no less fun. Just a word of warning: If you decide to play this, better wear a helmet, because those shards of the fourth wall are going to be a-flyin' all over the place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030902796', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1805, 'last_played': 1404614705}
review: Опыт и вещички - вот что нужно настоящему манчкину. И здесь всё это имеется в изобилии. Каждый экипированный предмет, будь то огромный меч, пиратская шляпа, кошачьи ушки или малюсенький талисман, тут же отражается на внешнем виде персонажа. Вместительный инвентарь готов принять в себя всё награбленное, ой, простите... завоёванное добро. Процесс выемки добычи из супостатов реализован достаточно интересно. Каждого мобика бьём оружием подходящего элемента: огненного заливаем водой, мертвяков упокаиваем светом. Весь процесс сопровождается забавными комментариями героев и приятной, запоминающеся музыкой. Есть, правда, одна мелочь - нужно спасти мир, но она, естественно, второстепенна. Ведь главное это опыт и вещички!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045056189', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1477305939}
review:
I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.

I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.

While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040621452', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1416850975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000694192', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1596312280}
review: While it's true that there IS a free version of this game over on Kongregate, the Steam version has more content (More skills, Equipment, a new dungeon plus other things I'm sure), plus you get the soundtrack with the purchase and you support Matts development of more games. This game is a LOT of fun, looks really nice, and can be funny from time to time with the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023335443', 'num_games_owned': 7856, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1558750190}
review:
这个游戏最早我是在Flash游戏的网站上玩的，当时一口气通关了，没想到竟然打包做成了独立游戏发售了，游戏系统也有不少改变。
因为相隔太久，游戏的故事又较为平凡，我是想不起来游戏情节是什么了，总之就是主角一行人从最开始出发，一路探索下去，聚集同伴、发现道路、击败怪物、完成任务、加强装备，最后打败邪恶的敌人，非常传统的日式RPG路线。
游戏的是一种绚丽又清新的卡通画面风格，这个幻想系列有多部作品，除了这个RPG之外，还有纯战斗的游戏，还有射击游戏，都采取了同样的美术和人物风格，怪物更是萌得不行。游戏的战斗风格是采用可见敌人，切换战斗，半即时制，战斗系统简化，节奏非常快和流畅，战斗过程很华丽，辅以战斗的是丰富的技能、装备系统、合成及物品升级系统。
游戏包含了许许多多的隐藏要素，最开始就能看到整个地图，分成一块块被黑雾覆盖，如同《英雄无敌》系列，探索过的场景，地图就得以显现，这些看似不大的地块上，密布着无数隐藏通路、宝箱和谜题机关，其中是各种各样宝物和装备，要找到他们，有的需要仔细观察和尝试，有的需要解除谜题，有的需要获得特殊物品破除障碍，有的需要击败Boss，完全收集这些隐藏内容是游戏的主要玩点，不过总体需要时间并不长，4-5小时就差不多，关键的是不需要像很多游戏那样反复刷。
这游戏是强迫症患者和刮地三尺流玩家喜爱的类型。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020789829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3268, 'last_played': 1416010015}
review: Amazing game. Light hearted-humor, tons of breaking-the-fourth-wall moments. Great combat system with good item and skill level ups. Story is decent, no surprises but keeps you entertained. Fantastic music both when walking and while in combat. If you are a fan of turn-based RPG games, definitely get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1415964010}
review: Was ist Epic Battle Fantasy 4? Ein RPG das versucht aus Pokemon, Final Fantasy, Zelda und anderen RPG Meilensteinen das beste aus all diesen Welten in einem Spiel zu vereinen. Gelingt es diesem Spiel das zu schaffen was Sie sich auf die Fahnen geschrieben haben? Ja auf jedenfall, man erwartet es bei der Optik und dem Namen auf keinen Fall aber dieses Spiel ist gut, verdammt gut. Ich habe dieses Spiel jetzt 6 Stunden gespielt und habe wie es aussieht nichtmal die hälfte geschafft.Unglaublich ist auch das Ihr ausser den Charakteren auch alle Waffen, Ausrüstung, Spezialfähigkeiten, Items, etc. Leveln könnnt. Es besitzt zudem noch verdammt viele Anspielungen auf andere Spiele und hat trotz des billigen looks auch ein gutes Kampfsystem welches ähnlich wie bei Pokemon ( Wasser ist gut gegen Feuer etc. ). Zum Abschluss kann ich nur sagen das Epic Battle Fantasy 4, obwohl ich keinen anderen Teil kenne, ein verdammt gutes Spiel ist welches man auf jedenfall mal gespielt haben muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105967365', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2873, 'last_played': 1544448851}
review:
Весёлая флэш-игра жанра рпг,правда можно легко найти бесплатную версию,но в стимовской есть дополнительный бонус в виде дополнительных локаций.Не смотря на то,что это флэш-игра,в ней огромное разнообразие оружия,брони,магии,талимсанов,врагов и естественно локаций.Сюжет в игре достаточно банальный-спасти мир.Саундрек хорошо вписывается(особенно в битве).Ну про геймплей сказать нечего(просто кликаешь мышкой куда хочешь и всё).Теперь минусы: 1)игра,как я раньше намекал,платная(могли бы и занизить цену). 2) если вы любитель собирать все ачивки,то игра вам начнёт наскучивать на втором кругу.Но не смотря на минусы,Epic Battle Fantasy 4 всё же заслуживает внимания,особенно советую пройти предыдущие части.
Оценка: 8,5 Логвиновых из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066708114', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1421573056}
review:
턴 방식 전투를 좋아한다면 한번 쯤 시도해 봐도 좋은 게임.

캐릭터 만을 보면 작화는 약간 떨어지는 느낌을 받을 수 있으나 몬스터 같은 경우에는 다양하고 생각보다 섬세했다.

속성은 불, 번개, 물, 땅, 독, 폭발, 바람, 얼음, 성, 암흑 으로 10가지가 있고 
상태이상 또한 화상, 기절, 빙결, 탈진, 중독, 스킬봉인, 젖음, 약화, 저주 등 10가지가 있다.

여타 rpg와 같이 물리/마법공격력, 물리/마법방어력, 회피율, 적중률이 타격/피격 데미지 기여한다.

특이한 점으로는 소환 이 있는데, 기본적으로 적의 정보를 얻을 수 있는 스캔봇과 더불어 적을 공격하거나 아군을 버프/치유 해 주는 소환수들이 있다.

bgm 역시 이 게임을 좋아하게 된 이유 중 하나인데. 지역마다 다른 배경음악을 들을 수 있다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057696107', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3054, 'last_played': 1531178902}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043988207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1458831596}
review:
It's a great game. I've played all of the Epic Battle Fantasy games, and this one is my favorite. Despite my dislike of uncouth humor (and there is quite a bit of uncouth humor), I find this game to be quite enjoyable. And there is also humor that I do like, so there's that. There's more content here than you can get play in any short period of time.

It's a FInal Fantasy-esque game, so if you are familiar with that, it is easy enough to figure out. Click on this, click on that, enemies get exploded/shot/sliced/arrow'd/. Level up skills with skill points. Use items. 

If I were to make one complaint, it would be that it doesn't have a Mac version. The dev said that it won't be happening for a while, so if you don't have a Windows computer, you might be out of luck.

Matt does, in fact, like swords. Even if they aren't actually swords.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057389750', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 2743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1463318008}
review:
Геймплей довольно простенький...Сюжет? Хм, ну не знаю, жиденький. Да и игра во флеше сделана... Вроде ничего особенного, а играть довольно интересно) Отдельные музыкальные композиции заслуживают внимания. Часть мелодий местами напоминает музыка "финалки". Это в плюс) Приличное количество различный менюшек : Параметры персонажей, снаряжение, крафты и т.д. и т.п. Что и должно быть в играх подобного жанра...Я это к чему, поиграл в Final Fantasy 13, интересно, красиво. Но уж как-то порезали составляющую jrpg. Дико раздражает, что в современных jrpg в каждой битве мы начинаем с полными хп и т.д.  И банки хп как-то теряют смысл. А то ходишь с десятком хп, в инвентаре пару банок и ты думаешь: "А хватит ли? Пить или успею апнуться (если при апах параметры востанавливают)? А вдруг прибьют?"  Тьфу, понесло вообще) Оказуаливают игры, не только jrpg...Минимум действий и раздумий, а жаль...
Вернемся к данной игре... Ей бы движок какой-никакой и сюжет продуманее и было бы шикарно)  Хотя и придераться смысла не вижу, все-таки это не jrpg (проект-то не японский...). Понравилось и ладно)) Просто попутно понесло к схожим проектам)

P.S. Прошел игру... От слов не отказываюсь, игре бы движок какой и сюжет "помощнее" , квесты с историями - была бы идеальная игра) Запустил финалку 13 и через день эту игру) Все следующее время был в этой игре. Просто потрясающая кастомизация персонажей, мира... Как персонажи/монстры ведут себя во время боя, множество бафов, эффектов, поведение персонажей при каком-то действии и прочее-прочее-прочее. И все это приправлено "каваем" )))
Когда в первый раз запустил игру, подумалось : " Как это могло вызвать столь положительные отзывы?". А потом залип) Ни капли не жалею потраченного )  9 из 10. Чуть разыграйтесь  и игра затянет)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029939961', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1706080550}
review: This game is a funny joking, breaking the forth wall, RPG. It's all good fun in the world of EBF4, with jokes coming left and right, and all being masterfully crafted so that none fall flat you won't stop laughing. Enough about how funny the game is, let's talk about gameplay, the game focuses on the goal of collection and completion rather than harsh and numerous battles, the creator has also made it so that character's not battling will also gain experience so that you won't have to grind for any other character at a later time. The collection will included things such as: chest locations, random drops for armor and weapon upgrades, those weapons and armor  themselves, certain creatures to fill that damn bestiary, ect. All battles are fair and equal as long as you do a little side searching here and there to gain a little extra exp. Jokes, fair battles, and no grinding sounds like a good game to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079777264', 'num_games_owned': 2802, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1524395408}
review:
Randomly found this game and seeing that it had JRPG elements, i investigated further. I Watched a few gameplay video's, read the full description, but i found myself still not convinced that it was of worth. I Thought to myself, " just go for it".. i did not regret it one bit. I Am so addicted.

How this game was created, was so thoughtful to details in the terms of gameplay. From witty dialog that pops up but does not get in your face, the excellent setup of the battle system, puzzles, loads of achievements to keep a player occupied, to even the collectable elements. The game is just so thoughfully pieced together.

I Would recommend this game to anyone who loves the JRPG genre, and everyone else alike.

review:
This Game series to me atleast has been the best on newgrounds its always brought me back for more.
This one is no different ive put 320 hours into the newgrounds version and 221 hours in the Kongregate version and bought the prem on there, so when I heard it was on steam it was a no brainer to get I havent actually had time to play it much since I bought it buy it was well worth it and I look forward to seeing if there will be a EB 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079351998', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1419528086}
review:
I liked the part with the bouncing boobs.

But seriously, I've been playing this series since it's 1st release and maaaaan! This is one of the best old school RPGs i've ever played. The game may not take itself that seriously, but there's a lot of strategy in almost every single aspect: weapons, armor, accesories, crafting, buffs, resistances and weaknesses... thare's a lot going on in a single fight, so you can either plan your moves acording to every situation or just don't give a shit and start using finishing moves all over the place. Solid gameplay, solid experience, pretty darn funny!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198058018411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1527980516}
review:
First and foremost, this is essentially an upgraded flash game. If you dont want to pay full price (which is understandable for some people) then wait for a sale.

This game brings back the classic feel of a turn based rpg system in a warm, fun filled cartoony format. It is not a childish kind of fun, but is still best left to those who like games that are not even close to serious and are meant to just screw around with. That being said, it is possible to either breeze through the storyline or sit and grind for god knows how long on achievements. Either one works.

If anyone were to ask me if this game is worth getting, I'd respond with "Do you like cheesy, fun games that arent at all serious? If so then yes."

author: {'steamid': '76561197997505096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1527451135}
review:
When you first look at this game you might judge it too quickly and believe that it is not worth it and you will be doing the biggest mistake in your whole life... okay I am exagerating here, but trust me. I have played this game when it only had the flash version and I played most of the previous versions too. It has a fun and cool story, the artwork is pretty cool and the soundtrack is amazing, I get the feels just by listening to the soundtrack while not playing the game at all.

Another thing is, you might expect it to be just another simple RPG game, but this game has a complex system with many stats and elements and you might find a great challenge while playing in the EPIC difficult, but you can also just go for the casual or normal difficult.

You might find yourself enjoying playing this game much more than many AAA games out there.

I would like to thank Matt Roszak, Halcyonic Falcon X and everyone else who helped to make this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104514925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1527372656}
review:
Excellent game. Best indy rpg I've played, and definitly one of the best jrpgs I've tried(up there with Golden Sun and Dragonquest)
It has remarkably detailed combat, and usign weaknesses and resistances is about the only way to take down some of the tougher foes.
It also has a lot of hidden items ^w^ And many easter eggs.
It also uses an unusual system for encoutners, with most battles only happening if you target the foe and start it yourself, with most batles having preset compositions(a nice change from the usual random encoutners of jrpgs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198051488426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1513198571}
review:
This game has boobs. 10/10.

But seriously, if you've ever wanted a freaking awesome classic-style RPG this is the thing. The soundtrack is SO GODDAMN EPIC. Like seriously, Epic Battle Fantasy 3 and 4 have my two favorite soundtracks among video games I've played.

The mechanics are standard fare, but there's nothing wrong with that. Character designes are very memorable, especially things like the slimes, NoLegs and GodCat. 

If you're looking for a short RPG to play, this should be your first choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063336245', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1557176360}
review:
Well first let me tell you that I have followed the series on Kongregate while it had only released Epic Battle Fantasy 1 and to be honest the first and second game wasn't that great but then the third instalment came to the series and it changed everything becouse it had absolutely everything an JRPG could offer for a flash game.

I played Epic Battle Fantasy 3 about 5 to 10 times and when beating the game it gets a bit repetative so I usually came back for it every other month or so. Even when I had played it 9 times it was still as fun as it was the first time I started the game. But years passed and one day in 2013 just before I was about to turn off my computer I just wanted to check my Kongregate and there it was, Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

I played the game 2 times or so on Kongregate but never really took the time to beat it but then a half year later when it got to steam I instantly bought it and played it through. I'm currently at my second playthrough and it has been some time since I bought it now.

Lets get into the game shall we

Art and Graphics: (10/10 absoultely love the art style)

I personally love the cute anime based art style that the game has and the effects are well animated aswell as the world and items and don't forget all the monsters and characters all have high detail. You may wonder why I say that they are detailed while their not having that mush details like shadows and particles but that is becouse it has a perfect balance between being cartoonish and detailed so i would say that this is a kind of masterpiece.

Sound and Music: (11/10 its my favorite game music and I listen to it all the time)

I think that the sound effects in this game fits perfectly with only some few improvements coming into my mind sometimes but thats just if I'm picky.
The music which is written by HalcyonicFalconX is absolutely stunning and as it changes from every region you visit it also changes the games atmosphere. From relaxing in the forest to intense in the factory aswell as epic while in the volcano. All I can say is that without the music the game wouldn't have such an impact on me as it had.

Gameplay (combat): (8/10 the combat is great but can sometimes get a bit repetative)

The combat system is that of any JRPG just that it is simple, highly detailed and fun but it does get repetative when going through an older region or before you unlock multi target skills. Anyhow the combat can make you quite impressed sometimes as some skills/attacks is simply epic.

Gameplay (exploration): (9/10 the world and exploration is so relaxing)

With a bunch of puzzles, easter eggs and a large variety of biomes to explore the exploration gets quite relaxing and at the same time interesting as you never know what you will find before uncovering the map.

Content: (8/10 very mush content for having one developer)

There is a large variety of quests, skills, items and monster but its not as mush content as you will find in an AAA game but thats obviouse that it would not have as mush content. I'm not saying that the game is low on content of items etc. but when you reach high levels for example you might have acctually leveled all skills to max and uppgraded every piece of equipment to the max. There is still enough of content to satisfy any player but I'm just saying that you might end up with nothing more to level up other than the characters levels but you wont reach the "no more upgrades" untill your in New Game+ or New Game++.

Story: (7/10 even without any focus on the story I still like it)

The game focuses on exploration, upgrading and combat but still offers a small story and its quite lighthearted and ammusing but still every time the game reveales a new part of the story you really feel like you are there in that offten wierd situation.

Final Score: (9.8/10 this game is a must buy)

Why such a high score well here is some ups and downs:
+++ : The music is absolutely amazing
++ : The sound fits very well with almost everything within the game
++ : Exploration and puzzleing is very fun and can get you obsessed to clear everything to a 100%
++ : The combat system is very strategic and interesting but its still simple enough to be played by a child
++ : The sudden notices from the characters can get quite hilleriouse
++ : The games easter eggs makes the game quite fun if you try to notice them all that is
+ : The game offers New Game+ aswell as a large variety of items to use
+ : Some skills/attacks can only be described with one word only: EPIC

- : There is a large variety of Skills and Equipment but after starting New Game+ it feels like you found everything
- : Going back to an older region does not provide with any supported combat untill you reach the next New Game+

This is a must buy for all RPG fans aswell as to all Fantasy and Comedy fans so I hope this review helped and that you might buy this game.
