author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1451766530}
review:
Eh.

I liked EBF3 better.

I've been following this game series for a long time now, so when EBF3 came out it 'wowed' me in a way that EBF4 simply cannot - being that it's exactly the same game, but with a new character (who doesn't add to the max count of players on the field). It feels like a new game. But, at the same time, I suppose instead of innovating, it's simply... more content. Coupled with a map that's of a decent size, yet feels surprisingly small. That, and of all the swords that we've got still in the game even from EBF1, no Soul Eater. My absolute favourite sword is not here. That makes me a very sad cookie. Soul Eater, featured in every game up until but excepting this one. Very fun because of the drastic reduction in survivability stats, but a huge increase in damage.

I'm only 17 hours in, at the final boss, and I expect to be here for a while longer, simply because I'm gonna need to grind up a whole bunch more XP off... something, and a whole bunch more money, off... something, since I expect I am going to need a pile of it to upgrade every piece of equipment I need so I can finally beat the boss.

Now let's get something straight. I don't mind grinding. I play Disgaea 1. Yeah, play. Not played. I'm still going.

But in EBF4... for some reason, I'm not really enjoying the grinding. I'm not really certain why. I spent hours upon hours finishing up EBF3, and it was incredibly satisfying to finally tick every box, but with EBF4, I'm struggling to work up the effort to beat the final boss.

Why do I recommend this game?

I recommend it because it's a good game. It really is. It's a $12 JRPG-type game, it's great fun, and it's terribly, wonderfully simple in scope. It's exactly what it looks like, a turn-based JRPG. If you like turn-based JRPGs, you will like this one.

If your finger is hovering over that 'Add To Cart' button, and you're just not sure, then give Epic Battle Fantasy 3 a go. It's free, and a good representation of what you're going to find if you purchase EBF4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066219042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1427727165}
review:
If you like the first three Final Fantasy games, you'll like this. It is originally a Flash game, but evolved to become what I think a great classic. It's combat in particular is what I think a high point in the game, the graphics and especially those auto cast skills that appear at random to bombard your enemies will always make you smile. You can have a hat that randomly calls in a tank to blast an enemy with its cannon, or a shirt that calls another tank to rain down machine gun fire to enemies. There's even an attachment that randomly calls a cat to charge at enemies, or radio in airdrop to give a medpack to someone, or cast some random element skills like poison gas, or even an airstrike that drops random stuffs, like a nuclear bomb.

Of course, many boss units have some OP skills as well, like an orbital particle cannon, or some insane defensive skill that switch profile whenever hit by a skill. It is much more variable and over the top than the early FF games, yet maintains the same light heart atmosphere. Your characters will even chatter whenever something interesting or over the top happens. What's more, nobody will disapprove of the ability to summon a blackhole that can suck everyone, good or bad, in.

Light hearted RPG doesn't get much better than this. If you like this type of game, this is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041160665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1515201661}
review: A lovely parody of classic RPGs like Final Fantasy, done in a memorable way. The dialogue is hilarious, and the art is wonderfully cartoony. I'm constantly discovering new things to do. And the story is surprisingly long for a flash game. I'm 10 hours in, and I haven't completed the game yet, having only just reached the final area. I highly recommend this game for any fans of RPGs, as well as anyone who loves a good laugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043729104', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1683678639}
review:
8/10

This game is fantastic, with clever humor and engaging gameplay that puts an interesting, unique twist on turn-based combat. Many times I find myself yearning for this game solely because of it's amazing soundtrack and humor that continually evolves into.... Far more interesting things. Let's just say the giant squids need to be left to sushi, and not as a small area-boss. 

Definitely recommend, spent a little over 20 hours on it (half of it is just my game left running though) and I can't say it ever bored me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025552313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1410722788}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 7125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1553968909}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 has the best turn-based combat system I have ever played. That, by itself, is enough to warrant playing it. That it contains copious secrets, varied dungeons, good music and a great sense of humor is a bonus.

There's a wide variety of skills and items for every party member, including skills you can only give one person and permanent percentage stat boosts to help "customize" your team. Your equipment and skill selection have a profound impact in battle, but they're all balanced against each other. Every one is useful in different situations, so you'll still be using some stuff from the beginning of the game by the end. Status effects are powerful and varied, and vital to many fights. The "swap in the fourth party member at any time" mechanic is odd at first but actually comes off really well. And if you crank up the difficulty to Epic, the game provides a mighty challenge indeed--even by the end of the first level.

As for whether you should play the free version or the paid one? Well, aside from rewarding creativity, the bonus area is everything you could hope for. You unlock it piece by piece as you progress, and it offers lots of brutal fights and unique items and skills (including rematches against alternate versions of each boss, some entirely new bosses and waves of tough enemies). But best of all, it scales to your level so you can tackle each part whenever you want to and cannot beat it by grinding.

Either way, free version or paid: If you've ever had fun playing any RPG at any point in your life, you should play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105680429', 'num_games_owned': 5132, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1562267903}
review:
游戏可玩度很高，装备和技能以及服装繁多，贴合了过场纸片CG场景显得非常新颖，虽然有点日式RPG风格，但是整体还是欧美特色，音乐风格也是一样，而且还有集换式卡牌，不过有点坑爹卡牌张数繁多加上卡牌偏贵呢~
网上没有汉化补丁非常可惜，如果英语不好的话玩这个游戏就要吃苦头了。
这款RPG游戏非常有特色，游戏文件夹里自带了音乐和游戏壁纸，作者很良心呢，很适合大家值得一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032155951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1565621379}
review:
Step 1: Stop reading this.
Step 2: Scroll upwards.
Step 3: Buy the game.

In all seriousness, this is a great game.
The graphics are not lacking in any way.
The sound is probably the best of any game here on steam, courtesy of musical genius HFX.
It has smooth gameplay that doesn't require grinding even on the hardest difficulty (Unless you suck).
It features a lot of humor such as: "I call upon mother nature to destroy my enemies! I always recycle so I think I deserve this favor."
The story continues from where the third game left off, and it is as good as you would expect from a fantasy RPG.
Nothing is too easy or hard, the difficulties can be changed at will mid-game.
All in all, a great game worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070664972', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1677848453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008880527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1452570648}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy as a series is, in my opinion, the one of (if not) the best indie RPGs that I've played in... quite possibly ever.

The game is well done and there are countless different ways to build your characters early on, though this drops off a bit due to being able to get everything later (bar a few spells/abilities that are 1-person only). The combat system, while basic, works great with very little errors outside ones made by the player.The maps are also well designed and often have more secrets in them than meets the eye, in many cases either requiring a return trip or waiting for something to flash upon the screen (though block puzzles, in my eyes, are unforgivable!).

The 'many ways to build a character' is even more evident because of the inclusion of the 4th character (fitting that you get the 4th member in the 4th game), meaning that someone is back in the sidelines ready for action should you need to swap one of your (three) party members out.

Cleverness and hilarity is also abundant in EBF with countless (sometimes censored due to copyright) references and/or memes.

As I write the review, I have not actually gotten to any of the 'Premium' (Read: Pay for) part of the game, as I'm doing an Epic difficulty playthrough and have not started the Battle Mountain or Survival battles.

If you're looking to try the game, go to some place like Kongregate and play it there to see if it's to your liking.
If you're looking to get the game (and support the amazing developer), buy it.

Don't anger the cats by the way; they tend to bring about the apocalypse in the form of elder gods when you do so.

November 2015 Edit: Still amazing, though I forgot to mention (long ago in the original review) that this takes an obscene amount of comp usage for no real reason, so don't be surprised with large amounts of slowdown!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065037140', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1413087306}
review:
This is Just a Fun game.
If you like Turn based RPGs, You will LOVE this.
And it has a new mechanic I've never seen in an RPG before:
There is no super Sword. Ultra guns don't exist. No peice of equipment is best. They are all equaly upgrade-able. Every Peice of equitment has ups and downs. Every one has it's use. NONE are useless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059166065', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2862, 'last_played': 1535384812}
review: In a world where FF dominates any rpg players hopes of a new series they had better relize there is a better series on the internet. The whole point of this game other than fun is to point fingers and make fun of all the obvious and not so obvious things in todays rpg. There are pros like good characters, fun and unique gameplay, interesting concepts, good graphics, and a soundtrack that could sell millions if real. The cons too hard sometimes (i.e almost every battle mountain fight on epic), fights might take awhile and so much GOD FORESAKEN POINTLESS ITEMS (and backtracking). Above all i give it a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999963540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1521689747}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy has always been one of my favorite parody series, which is itself one of my favorite genres. But unlike your average "take that, Final Fantasy!" mimicry affair, EBF stands on its own in every regard:
Colorful art design, imaginative enemies, and I can't think of an adjective for the writing that quite encapsulates the unique blend of self-depriciative humor. The protagonists have a "band of idiots" shtick that in any other parody would just come off as mean, but EBF manages to convey a genuine sense of chemistry, that these idiots have been working with and through each others' eccentricities. The humor really comes alive when EBF satirizes not just the genre but also its players, with Anna playing straight man to a trio of 4th-wall-breaking powergamers.

It wouldn't be a Japanese-style RPG without a story, and where the first three EBF games went for the "here is a villain go fight him" excuse to skip to the action, the fourth instalment has tried its hand at some actual worldbuilding this time, though at the cost of assuming players are familiar with the events of the third game. Returning party members Matt, Natz, and Lance are quickly discovering that the various save-the-world plots aren't as standalone and isolated as they assumed, and larger forces have been resetting their little pawns whie they were busy level grinding the Pickpocket skill.

As for gameplay, EBF is quickly recognizable to anyone who has ever touched a Square Enix RPG, and at the same time found its own way to keep the turn-based combat fresh. Not content with just elemental rock-paper-scisors, EBF ensures stats buffs and status effects/ailments are incredibly critical during the late game, but thankfully the player is slowly eased into it all. There's a great deal of customization, especially if you want to eek out every precious damage point from your foes, but if you feel that you're stopping too often to fiddle with menus the game leaves open the possibility of overleveling yourself (to a point). If you know what you're doing the game will be happy to throw you enough curveballs to keep yourself from feeling overpowered but never tries to make you entirely helpless either.

The only real thing to watch out for is possible slowdown. Might wanna check how your computer handles Flash, since that's what this game was originally built in, and large numbers of vector images, since that's what the original Flash engine rendered in. My other main complaint is that late-game bosses can be a bit of a slog if you aren't an absolute min-maxer, but in a way that's sort of the point.

Overall, EBF4 is a happy, charming little affair from start to finish. Matt Roszak has stated that he made the series so he can see a game with everything he likes in it, and the level of love put into the product from start to finish really shows through. If you like swords, sorcery, slimes, and squishing the latter with the former, I recommend giving Epic Battle Fantasy a look; chances are there will be a lot you will like as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051835022', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1417053439}
review: Absolutely amazing jrpg style game. Turn based FF style with excellent creative customization options with a well balanced element based battle style. Difficulty is changable on the fly and higher difficulties also features unique enemy behaviour instead of just a flat number boost. Story isn't very deep, but rather fun and charming. So many great little details and some game and anime references. Menus are easy to navigate and the game is animated extremely well. There's much more praise I could give the game but I don't wanna potentially spoil anything. Definitely a must buy with it's price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046268101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 6207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2087, 'last_played': 1440683887}
review:
三人前衛 + 一人バックアップ + 猫の構成でお届けするターン制 RPG。
Flashゲームの移植でとにかく動く。これで音楽以外はほぼ一人で作ったというのが脅威。開発会社・パブリッシャー名が個人名なのも脅威。
大まかにはムービーゲーになる前のJRPGの現代版といった印象。戦闘もテンポよく雑魚戦でも状態に応じた小ネタが入って飽きない。日本のサブカルネタが多い。
かなりの属性ゲーなのでレベルを上げて物理で殴っても効果はいまいち。というか無属性攻撃が殆ど無いし弱い。武器・スキル・ステータスのビルドがうまくはまると圧倒的火力で敵を薙ぎ払って進めるのが楽しい。ボス戦も装備を間違えると全滅する。全体を通してゲームバランスが安定していて好印象。
マップもコンパクトにまとまっていてゼルダ的。宝箱を開ける瞬間が好きな人におすすめ。


なお、Flash版との違いは以下のとおり。
・追加マップ
・追加ボス
・追加アイテム
・サントラ付属
・画質・音質向上
・フルスクリーンモード（解像度制限あり）
・Flashのデータを初期化してもセーブデータが消えない

author: {'steamid': '76561197991040330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3872, 'last_played': 1462440126}
review:
Un jeu qui ne paie pas de mine au départ... Un concept simple, du rpg au tour par tour , mais pour un jeu aussi peu cher, il y a une réelle profondeur et difficulté progressive au fur et à mesure du jeu. Les derniers combats en épique pourront vous donner des sueurs froides, excepté si vous avez bien levelé. Car une fois le level 50 atteint et tous les équipements débloqués, vous rencontrerez très peu de difficulté dans les combats.

Néanmoins , je recommande le jeu, qui m'aura pris une bonne soixantaine d'heures pour le finir à 100%. C'est un excellent rpg, n'hésitez pas à le prendre :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113002890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1408093999}
review:
Por donde empiezo.

He jugado a esta saga desde que empezaron siendo un juego flash. 
Sus puntos fuertes siempre fueron su sentido del humor estilo manga una jugabilidad simple pero muy divertida con una dificultad que te permite disfrutar del juego sin tener que agobiarte con tener que entrenar para seguir... pero tienes que currarte los convates.

 Si te gustan los rpg este viene a ser uno simplificado pero con mucho más sentido del humor. 

Comenzó siendo un juego que usaba para descansar de otros pero rápidamente se convirtió en el "único" con el que jugaba.

Me encanta, esperando el próximo.

PD: 35 horas de juego he tardado en pasarlo. Te deja volver a empezarlo con más dificultad y alguna sorpresa y tiene zona de combates ilimitados para picarse un poco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050589707', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1535950371}
review:
First off, Yes, you can play this game on Kongregate or Newgrounds (or possibly Matt's DA), however the version you play will not be this one. 

In other words, No, this isn't the same game you can play on the sites I previously mentioned.

What you'll play is indeed an RPG akin to the old days of Final Fantasy, when Combat wasn't real-time combat with before-use cooldowns.

To those unfamiliar with the Epic Battle Fantasy series (namely the ones with actual story elements) This is an RPG game with tons of funny things here and there, self-referencing humor, and things that reference alot of other things.

So basically the story so far is there's 3 heroes.
One is Matt, who jsut wants food, like swords and piracy... He's also a pirate.. Did I mention he has a guitar and likes Death Metal? I jsut did, you're welcome, reason 1 to buy this game.
There's Natalie, whose powers are in her awe-inspiring magical powers, witty remarks, different mindset of the others, and her boobs. No seriously she's kinda the "Big boobed girl cliche" of the series, though she's hilariously not jsut eye candy,  dishing out the sage advice and owning remarks. But even more seriously she's literally the only one who can decently heal and revive party members. She's kinda the most important character combat-wise.
There's Lance who is a military guy.
In a world filled with big demons (like the last villain you kill in #3), sapient cats with no limbs able to wield weapons via unexplained telepathy powers, elementals, magic, Lance is the one who kills things with overwhelming firepower. Seriously though, he melts those who are weak to bomb-type attacks and even has decent fire and electric attacks.

There's a 4th character, a huntress druid girl for Natalie to relate to.

This game also has achievements alongside the medals of the game, giving you elevated bragging rights.

Your progress on this version won't be wiped by clearing your cache or cookies.

There's what I call a Shamievement, an achievement that's more or less a badge of shame like Duke Nukem Forever's Turd Burglar. You'll be rewarded for being a perv by this, though it really could be worse, so in terms of them, it's really not bad.

Here's the part you care about though... The exclusive content.

This version has more weapons, and more items in general, save for crafting materials (i think) and this game has an entire area called Challenge Mountain. This area is literally filled with enemy encounters which all have 8 enemy encounters each and stronger versions of the bosses in the game which are WAY harder to kill.
Every enemy in thise area scales with level, which means you can get past all enemies at level 1, though you do need quest items like the axe or battery to get past some bits.

How does this game fare? Well for someone who played the first half 3 times on Kongregate, I can say the game fares really awesomely. I mean... never did I once say "Oh god not this part again" or the infamous "Why can't I just skip this" and I'm one of many who found Diablo 2 monotonous after Normal difficulty.

This game is very fun, has some funny elements and even gets challenging properly without feeling unfair. This game doesn't have any difficulty spikes... until the final area, but around then you're ready for it. This game is simply a blast, the only thing stopping me from playing it is just the simple fact I'm feeling a bit bored of RPGs in general.

Alongside such big titles like Final Fantasy, Diablo, Torchlight, and even anything else you could really think of, this game holds it's own ground. The game is honestly fairly unique in my opinion.

This game in my books gets a 7/10. It's pretty good honestly, and I'd easily recommend it to anyone who likes Turn-Based games and RPGs, Despite the fact you can play the game on Kongregate with 30% less content for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040270911', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2336, 'last_played': 1659175655}
review:
EBF4 is a solidly built RPG with turn based combat reminiscent of Final Fantasy with a dash of self referencial/ 4th wall breaking humor thrown in for good measure.

The story is simple enough that you don't need to play the previous three installments. But if you wish to they're easily found online for free.

The combat largely revolves around equipping your characters with the proper equipment prior to the fight so as to exploit the enemies weaknesses and bolster your own defenses against their attacks.

It's not overly long, and maybe not worth the full $11.99 price tag, but it's definitely worth picking up when it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146785902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1500639014}
review:
If you love old school Japanese RPGs I strongly recommend that you play this game. If the price tag isn't wroth it you can find the free to play version of the game on Newgrounds and Kongregate. The steam version to my knowledge has a few extra features like more equipment and the new optional area. All in all it's an okay game to at least play through once if you're not into the idea of paying for extra features then I suggest you play the free to play version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096087801', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1408204830}
review:
Gierka to dla mnie wielkie zaskoczenie, głównie dlatego, że kompletnie niczego się po niej nie spodziewałem. Prosta graficznie, ale mimo to ładna i na swój sposób słodka (chyba, że ktoś nie trawi mangi). Muzycznie - niestety tutaj mocno niedomaga. Brak głosów postaci, wkurzająca poprzez ciągłą powtarzalność muzyczka i zaledwie poprawne dźwięki towarzyszące walce. Fabularnie też nie mamy nic specjalnego, ale gra na szczęście nawet tego nie ukrywa, wszystko traktując z mocnym przymrużeniem oka. Wystarczy wspomnieć, że postaci często puszczają zabawne teksty odnoszące się do tego, co trzeba zrobić, albo komentujące aktualne wydarzenia. Sam core gry, to tradycyjny jRPG, na szczęście bez niewidzialnych na mapie gry potworków, więc jak nie mamy ochoty, to nie walczymy z większością mobków. Za to pochwalić muszę system walki. Niby nic specjalnego, bo prościzna ubrana w system turowy, ale mamy ogromne pole do popisu przy rozwijaniu poszczególnych zdolności, które na bieżąco dopasowujemy do napotykanych przeciwników, opisywanych sporą ilością statystyk (odporności i słabości).
Póki co gram i nie mogę przestać.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062574511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3065, 'last_played': 1491762202}
review: Zereiei e estou tentando fechar todas as conquistas. Comprei na promoção junto com outros RPGs e só joguei por que fiquei sem internet. Mas valeu muitooo a pena. Jogo altamente divertido e viciante pra quem curte estilo clássico de RPG de turno. Recomendo ogar no modo épico fica com uma dificuldade bem interessante mas nada impossível. Jogo tem vários atrativos além de estar totalmente em PT-BR. Super recomendo pra quem gosta de RPG de turno, primeiro que conseguiu me prender de verdade após anos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114563643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4871, 'last_played': 1708918823}
review:
How have I not reviewed EBF4 yet? Whatever, I guess I'm doing it now.

[h1]Game was recieved for free because I did a fancy Let's Play of it when the Flash version came out in 2013.[/h1]

Yes, this is (almost) the same thing as the game you can play for free on your favorite Flash hub (assuming Flash hubs still exist as of your reading this :( ). So why should you pay money for a game you can play for free? Because it's a damn good game in the first place that's better than half the paid stuff on the Steam store.

*goes through my notes to see what I've written about the other EBF games*

[h1]Good[/h1]

Like EBF3, it's a silly Flash game, it looks like a silly Flash game, it sounds like a silly Flash game, it's written like a silly Flash game  and it has boob jokes like a silly Flash game. But like EBF3, it's all put together extremely well. If you looked at the graphics alone you could probably guess what the gameplay looked like, and if you read a text file containing the game's plot you could probably guess what the graphics looked like, and if you looked at both you probably couldn't guess what the music sounded like because the music is freaking amazing. The plot is silly, but not stupid or forced [spoiler]cats are the villains because Kupo has a vendetta against cats[/spoiler] and the fourth wall breaks are only used where appropriate.

To boot, the world art, character art, UI art and pretty much all of the rest of the art have been seriously refined and no longer look like recycled assets from a high school animation class.

The battle system is pretty much exactly the same as the battle system in EBF3.

[quote=me]The battles themselves are a turn-based system where you get to attack first every turn, there is no "speed" or "agility" stat, so I guess it doesn't toe the JRPG line [i]perfectly.[/i] Anyway, there isn't too much to say about the battles except that they can easily fall into the "Fire attack, heal and repeat" pattern and you can probably beat Easy and Normal modes that way, but if you want to strategize a little more there is a bit more you can do with playing with status effects and changing equips mid-battle.[/quote]

Also, in this game you can change difficulty anywhere on the overworld, not just at the start of the game, so if you don't want to spend eleven hours on grunt enemies you can dial it down to Normal and then back up to Epic for the bosses (and the achievements that go with them).

[h1]Bad[/h1]

If anything this game suffers from the "there's too much" syndrome that, honestly, afflicts a lot of RPGs. There's realistically way too many equips, consumables and (depending on the way you play) spells and not enough time in the game where they're all useful. Consumables that aren't Revives (coffee) or Full Heals (garlic) and maybe the Super Rares get outclassed by everything else in the game pretty quickly, and even on Epic you're probably going to pick a favorite five or six equipment sets that cover pretty much all in-battle circumstances and never change them.

Also MP is useless because there's so much of it that it's highly unlikely that you'll ever run out, even against the enemies that drain your MP, unless you're doing something seriously wrong. (This will be fixed in EBF5!)

[h1]Stuff that isn't in the free Flash game[/h1]

An optional dungeon where you get some god-tier loot for winning preposterously difficult fights, some new equipment, some new summons, Steam achievements, Steam trading cards, the knowledge that you're helping a highly skilled game designer pay the bills.

There's a full list of features somewhere but I can't find it =/

[h1]tl;dr[/h1]

If you remotely enjoy JRPGS or even just games where numbers go up in a satisfying manner, buy this one. If you don't want to spend money, look up the online version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093384367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1489462340}
review: Se você gosta de RPG's estilo Pokemon, vai gostar desse jogo. O cenário me lembra o Goof Troop, do Snes, com puzzles parecidos, e o humor do jogo é realmente muito bom. Se seu inglês é bom, melhor jogar nesse idioma pela originalidade, mas joguei na tradução também e achei bem fiel. Tem achievements bacanas para se buscar, sendo que não consegui nem metade ainda, e já zerei o jogo uma vez. Por ser uma replayability de simples re-execução de missões, com os mesmos diálogos, vou demorar um pouco a voltar nele, por isso eu daria nota 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030931997', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1671, 'last_played': 1407605811}
review: I have loved this game series since I first discovered it at 3. While I find 1 and 2 to be vastly inferior, I loved 3 to death. When I heard of a 4, I nearly freaked out. All in all, I think it improves on the 3rd, in the humor, gameplay, and story. I would recommend this to anyone who likes RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981417366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1407372140}
review:
Très bon jeu (surtout pour son bas prix)! Je l'ai acheté pendant les soldes d'été sans trop d'attentes. Les graphismes avait l'air jolies et je me suis laissé tenté. Je ne regrette pas.

Le jeu se finit en une dizaine d'heure (si on prend le temps de tout faire), les combats sont assez riches en possibilité (buff, debuff, types d'attaques, attaque electrique/glace plus efficace si le perso est mouillé, points forts/faibles, ...). Le style graphique m'a bien plus avec mention honorable à certaines attaques et certains monstres. Les "casses tête" sont plutôt facile mais secondaire donc temps mieux (pas besoin de se prendre la tête dans l'ensemble). 
Mention honorable à la BO. J'ai vraiment apprécié plusieurs des musiques.

On peut toujours dire que certains aspects aurait pu être plus poussés mais franchement vu la richesse du jeu pour ce prix, j'ai pas à me plaindre. 

Donc bonne surprise que je recommande (je me répète!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198086986071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5642, 'last_played': 1590093074}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059745819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1534810624}
review:
Honestly one of the best games I've ever played. The items are great, the gameplay is easy to understand, and the character interaction is hilarious.

Each weapon/attack/item has it's pluses and minuses. What may be great for one battle may be awful for another. This is nice because you actually need to pay attention to equips, not just get "the one armor set." You actually have to use your brain a little bit to play, but not so much that it's exahausting (for example, you wouldn't go into a battle with light creatures wearing only darkness armor, you'd be screwed).

In terms of gameplay, you can switch between using your mouse or your keyboard, an option that other games lack. Also, in terms of battles, you have plenty of time to think and do what you need. While some may like time-constraints, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 provides for a more stress-free type gameplay. All your abilities and options are easy to navigate to, and thus far I have not run into a single glitch.

The characters are great. That's something that could be said about this entire franchise, but especially this and EBF3. There is so much interaction between the characters, enemies, and the environment. Battle after battle can get boring, but the witty dialogue balances this out nicely.

All-in-all, this game is perfect for those looking for a relaxed RPG experience: no time-constraints or reflex-speed battles, vibrant colors that don't strain your eyes, and lots of easter eggs from Minecraft, Pokémon, and more just in case the fantastic characters didn't already have you hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034199687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1407255565}
review:
Great fun->
I usually skip over all types of round-bases-battle-RPGs but I'm glad I made an exception here. EBF4 is a tongue-in-cheek RPG with hilarious characters who dress as stereotypical pirates, rangers or red mages. On the over-world map you collect hidden goodies, explore branching ways and follow the farce of a storyline. If you choose to bump into an enemy the fighting starts, no tedious random encounters after any x steps. Also heroes slowly heal after battle for convenience and most creatures respawn.

The battle system isn't boring but really fun with lots of different skills, weapons, equipment, usable items. 
Skills are unlocked and upgraded with skill points. Levels are gained by experience. Weapons and Armor are found or bought in shops and upgraded with items. There are also summons usable by anyone, limit breaks and "specials" which are skills you can assign to complement a characters skill set like a fire attack or a heal spell.

You may try out the EBF game series on some websites for free to understand how the game works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081821094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1407079430}
review: I loved this game! Epic Battle Fantasy 4 (or ebf4) is a Strategy RPG similar to Final Fantasy 6 and below. There are Four main characters, Matt the theiving, high attack high defense tank, Natalie, the good natured mage, Lance, the phsycotic, perverted gun freak, and Anna, the tree hugging goody two shoes with a bow. the game starts off with you in the overworld, and when you enter a hostile area, you'll notice the enemy sprites. Yes, the creator got rid of random battles. Thank Christ. when you enter battle, you control three of the four hero's attacks and strategies along with equips. for strategies there is "benching" a character for another, there is switching turns for a character, surrender, and block for the most part. equips follow the rules of, you can change wepons, outfits, flair mid battle, but it costs you a turn, same with consumables. attacks are the highlights of the game. each character can learn their own special set of "skills" for them only, but you ccan find "specials" out in the feild usually after boss fights or quests. theses "specials" can be used by any character provided they meet the parameters. overall, the game is fun, some very small tech bugs, good design and a wacky story. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057424551', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1619325474}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an incredibly fun adventure roughly based off of games such as the early Final Fantasy games. As its title implies, there are also three entries before it... there are also two spin-offs. EBF4 has a flash version that's free to play, but you will have to pay for the Battle Mountain zone regardless, and the flash version tends to be rather laggy at times. Unfortunately, due to the earlier three games containing things that would bring its developer, Matt Roszak, into legal trouble (most notably the first game having a few pokemon for summons, and the final boss of the first game being Goku), they will not be appearing on Steam.

[*]Plot
In between the events of the third game and this one, the heroes, Matt, Natalie (Natz for short), and Lance, turn to a life of crime, since they lack the funds to buy food. They think that this is justified due to them saving the world before, although this is a rather flimsy excuse. They finally go too far when they steal an important jewel from Greenwood Village, causing her to seek them and finally deliver justice to them... only to learn that they did not steal the jewel. Anna must team up with the heroes, and track down the thief before he/she/it/they can steal the other two jewels and summon forth Godcat, who will destroy the world.

...It's rather bare-bones, and can rather easily be ignored in the favor of picking fights with wild animals. Aside from a few rather minor references to the third game, you can easily jump into the game's plot without playing any other games in the EBF series. Interestingly enough, the entire series runs on the plot structure of "Stop this thing by beating it to a pulp," although this game diverges itself from this plot a little more.

[*]Gameplay
Gameplay is split up into two areas: The overworld and combat.

In the overworld, you can walk around, accepting quests to get items for complete strangers with the promise of some stuff in return, harrasing the wildlife, stealing items from treasure boxes, and buying items to prepare for combat. When one wishes to enter the combat phase of gameplay, one simply clicks on an enemy on the map. If one goes to the options tab, one can switch between using the keyboard and the mouse to travel on the map.

In combat, you have a myriad of standard JRPG skills, including several that are based off of elements. As one of the game's tips says, attack enemies until they die. If red numbers appear, that means the element of that attack is pretacualy effective against that foe. If grey numbers appear, that means the foe is either immune or resists the attack. One can also use the Scanbot summon to reveal the weaknesses of these enemies, revealing their weaknesses and stat totals for all enemies of that type. Battles may be split into multiple waves, too. In one of the lower points of the game, your party's turns are not refreshed at the start of each wave, which can result in up to five enemies getting free attacks if you use your last action to kill an enemy. This is especially bothersome with the final boss, who will "kill" itself after a few turns on the waves where it's invulnerable, giving its next phase free, powerful attacks.

After winning a battle, one is rewarded with Gold, EXP, and AP, all used outside of combat. Gold is used to buy new equipment, items to upgrade your equipment with, things that hurt enemies, and items to heal your party members. EXP will make your characters stronger. AP can be spent under the "Skills" screen to unlock new skills, or upgrade ones you've already learned. Any skills under the "special" tab can only be learned by a single character and have to be forgotten if you wish to teach them to another character, adding a layer of strategy as to who gets what skill.

[*]Difficulty
EBF4 is divided into four difficulties. In order from easiest to hardest, they are: Easy, Normal, Hard, and Epic. The difficulty can be changed on the fly, so unless one is having trouble on Easy, the difficulty can be lowered with ease. By default, the game is set on Normal. If one were to select Hard or Epic, enemies will also recieve bonuses that aren't directly stated, such as some enemies that absorb fire damage entering battle with a status that deals fire damage every turn, or fire-weak enemies starting with a status that lets them resist fire. Bosses that are defeated on Epic difficulty also give medals, which directly corrolate to Steam Achievements.

In short, do I recommend this game? Yes. I am aware this type of game isn't for everyone, especially considering the rather cluttered interface, but it's a damn fine one. Also, to those who ask where the other party members are at the start of the game, you'll find them as you progress through Ashwood Forest, before finally finding Lance after defeating the Mighty Oak and entering the Crystal Caverns. Each party member also has a different role, which should be relatively obvious looking at their stats and personal skills they can learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023105909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1405676728}
review:
I love RPGs. Jrpgs, western rpgs, they're both awesome.

I saw the trailer for this game, read some reviews, and I was sold.

Unfortunately, my first (and last) impression of the game was so bad, that I regret having paid for this title.

The interface is terribly cluttered, difficult to use and understand.

There is NO tutorial in the beginning. None. There are some vague hints here and there about minor aspects of the game, but that's it.

How to fight? How to find your way? How to manage your inventory and skills?

Not explained in any way. Hell, I even had a hard time figuring out where the hell I was supposed to go to begin with!

I'm all for games that don't hold your hand (God bless Dark Souls), but this game, despite being a Jrpg, seemed to make it obscenely hard for me to even start going somewhere.

Unless you have the patience of a saint and the willingness to figure where the hell you're supposed to go to, and how to do ANYTHING, I recommend staying away from this title.

I regret buying it.

review: Mistura de zelda 1(movimentação no mapa) e as batalhas são estilo dos jrpgs. Joga-se só como mouse, bem prático a jogabilidade. Efeitos de ambiente e magias, etc bonitos. Boa música e efeitos sonoros. Comentários humorísticos dos personagens sobre as magias, skills e inimigos tornam o jogo mais divertido. joguei com bastante calma e tentando ver os secrets e ainda faltou armas e acessórios para pegar. Dessa primeira vez joguei no modo normal de dificuldade. Recomendo a primeira vez que jogarem, coloquem no nivel dificil. Quando virar pela segunda vez vou tentar o nivel epico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053360349', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2985, 'last_played': 1409862359}
review:
Voilà un jeu qui mérite d'être plus connus qu'il ne l'est.

On a là tous les éléments de gameplay d'un RPG au tour par tour classique, mais où les faiblessse élémentaires et la gestion des altérations d'états ont été sublimé comme jamais.
Je n'ai pas jouer aux épisode précédent je ne parlerais donc que de cet opus.

Histoire & ambiance : On ne va pas se mentir l'histoire est on ne peu plus simple, cependant le véritable mot qui va marquer l'ambiance et le récit c'est le fun. Les dialogues sont drole et bien éparpillés afin de ne pas casser le rythme du jeu. De plus l'univers fourmillent de références au monde du jeu vidéo en général, qu'il est très agréable de retrouver. Pour n'en cité que quelques uns, on aura l'occasion d'affronter un raflésia, on rencontre un bonhomme de neige ayant la forme d'un djinn de Golden sun et lorsqu'un personnage meurt il est parfois écris "brb" sur sa tombe.

Gameplay : simple et éfficace on va gérer un groupe 4 personnages, trois à l'écran et un remplaçant, qui peuvent avoir des compétences et équiper des objets, quelques invocations caché au fur et à mesure de l'histoire et les "limite break".

Là où cela devient génial c'est la gestion des éléments et altération d'états, pour cela trois points importants : 

 - TOUS les énnemis on des forces et des faiblesses par rapport aux éléments et altérations d'état, y compris les boss. Vous vous souvenez de ce sort "Cyanure" qui ne sert à rien car tuer des énnemis au poison est trop long et les bosses y sont immunisés, et bien là ce ne seras pas le cas et pour certains boss c'est même particulièrement conseillé. De plus tous les ennemis sont analysable et un fois fait vous aurez toutes les informations permettants d'élaboré une stratégie.
 - TOUTES les attaques (ou presque, on va dire 95%) sont élémentaires et bon nombre d'attaque on un élément qui dépends de l'arme équipée.
 - TOUTES les pièces d'équipements sont plus ou moins aussi bonnes lorsque l'on prend leurs caractéristiques en compte, elle deviennent donc toutes occasionnelles (sauf le chapeau qui multiplie par deux les soins lancés, celui là j'ai du mal à m'en passé tellement c'est bien). On choisira donc souvent une pièce d'équipement pour son/ses élément(s) que ce soit en attaque ou en défense.

Ces trois points font que pour réussir à avancer (je conseille de jouer en mode difficile dès le début, ce qui représente un challenge correct sans être franchement difficile), il va falloir préparer son matériel judicieusement en fonction des énnemis qui arrivent, voir fuir le combat une fois le boss analyser pour revenir après une mise à jour.

Durée de vie : En prenant mon temps (j'aime bien farfouiller partout) et sans finir à 100%, il m'a fallut plus de 50h pour finir une première fois le jeu. Le jeu propose des modes new game plus, mais je ne suis pas fan, je relancerais plutôt ma sauvegarde juste avant la fin, pour faire les challenges et bonus qu'il me manque.

Conclusion : Un bon RPG qui certe n'est pas très ambitieux au niveau graphisme et profondeur, mais dont le fun de l'univers et des dialogues ainsi le gameplays très centré sur les éléments et altération d'états rendent l'expérience très agréable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128451425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2162, 'last_played': 1405011419}
review:
Ce jeu aurait été plus sympa s'il n'avait pas, concrètement, été fait pour des Reddit Bros. L'univers est sympa et les petites références à d'autres jeux font sourire, mais les piques anti-féministes et autres éléments sexistes censés passer parce que ha ha c'est parodique mettons les filles en tenue de soubrette et rendons-en une jalouse de la poitrine de l'autre LOL finissent par lasser. Aussi, tout le monde est blanc, sauf Kenshin qui tient une boutique d'armes au début, mais c'est juste parce qu'on sait qu'il devrait être japonais. 
Tout le reste n'étant pas révolutionnaire, au bout de 40 heures de jeu relativement plat, j'ai arrêté de m'obstiner à y trouver de l'amusement - étant donné que son point "fort" est censé être l'aspect nostalgi-comique et que clairement, il est destiné à faire rire une catégorie très précise de personnes, je préfère encore recommencer FF3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062367878', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1488988199}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964009814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 1840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1840, 'last_played': 1404991557}
review:
30 Hours later - I beat it and completed the side mission battles (which were harder than the last boss.)

The first 15 hours of this game was really good - a classic turn based RPG combat with some internet humor thrown in.  You have three people in battle and one back up.  You buff, cast magic, and attack - what you would expect.

The core of the combat is fun, but in the later stages of the game: it becomes a little bit of a chore at times.  I didn't find the game to be hard - infact it was easy for an RPG, even the bonus areas.  It was very easy to stay alive and slowly reduce a big boss over time.... however that being said - I have years & years of classic RPG experience and most of the "close calls" I bounced back quickly.  I actually died once just to see what happened.

Anyway - this is a fun, classic, RPG style game with a lot of spells, summons, and monsters to fight.  Not a lot outside of the combat but enough to keep you entertained for awhile.

I would recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067562550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1404986237}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy is a story set in a fantasy land that encapsulates total humour. It's powerful role playing essentials prove that an RPG does not have to be made with great graphics or new complicated battle mechanics - it just needs a firm storyline such as this.

The story unfolds with four heroes that find each other along the journey, fight monsters, and as usual, attempt to claim world peace from this unseemingly harmless boss - the Godcat. Throughout the way, dry R16 humour develops throughout the story, and even when you are engaging in difficult battles, somewhat the characters randomly crack jokes in a light hearted manner. Hmm...

The system is brilliant. Brilliant in the sense that the forging and money systems go hand-in-hand nicely unlike many other games that introduce poverty into the heroes. Summons actually help a lot, and battle statuses are not just those nice symbols floating on your heads - they actually kill you. Simple but effective.

Music is fine, although the tunes are reminiscent of popular music. Canon in D - main theme. Enjoyable but I didn't love it as much and it somewhat did not match the situations.

Overall, a must try for fantasy fans. Also has a very high replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009472225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1404981586}
review:
Really enjoyable game, would absolutely recommend.

It's fun, quirky and let's you take it at your own pace. 
If you're a m3g4 l33t MLG H4rdc0r3 gamer then you may find it a bit easy, I boosted it up to hard for a bit more of a challange and I usually freaking suck at games. But I'd suggest hard mode when you get your bearings.
But really it's a lovely game to play, it's not stressful at all (Except maybe mid-boss fight) but even then you can drop in and out of battles with no penalty. It also gives you the option to come up with battle strategies that rely on your team working together to take down your foes, or you can just wale on them until death happens.  

Anyway if you're thinking about buying this game enough that you're reading this then I'd say get it. Unless you're a scaredy sisspot that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070893821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2191, 'last_played': 1404861964}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058695291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 4459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3176, 'last_played': 1527393909}
review:
I've been playing this game for the past 2 weeks and absolutely love it. At first I thought it might be one of those parody/homage to old RPGs but while this game doesn't do anything revolutionary with the turn based formula it does present an interesting challenge without any of the annoyances of past well known games. 

First thing you should know that it does contain a lot of references from old school games like Final Fantasy to Pokemon to some less obvious. That doesn't mean this game isn't original. It's got a light hearted story and a charming cast of characters. There are a few references of previous Epic Battle Fantasy games that might be lost on you but they happen more so for comedic effect and doesn't hinder understanding the story whatsoever.

I think what really makes this game enjoyable is the battle system. There's a few notable improvements on the old turn based formula that make fighting more strategic and less of a chore:

1. You are able to change equipment and characters on the fly - In the middle of a battle you aren't bound to the 3 characters and if you're not quite properly equipped to handle the foes you're battling you can easily swap out equipment during your turn. Characters in reserve also recover HP/MP each turn so it makes things slightly easier. 

2. Elements and status effects play a prominent role in fights - This adds a bit of challenge. Generally there's 10 elemental resistances and another dozen status effects. Instead of always equipping the stronger weapon / armor you'll find yourself adjusting to weapons of different elements for maximum damage and defense. I find this particularly nice and adds a bit of strategy because depending on the foes you're going to be changing equipment a lot. 

3. Limits / Summons - Will do wonders if you know when to use them. You could opt for a blind challenge in which you don't know any of your enemies' weaknesses but, if you're not into blindly hitting anything that moves you'll end up scanning foes a lot to learn what makes them tick. Unlike most RPGs the scan feature in this game is super useful. It also helps that the scanned information is readily available after you scan each foe. It doesn't just disappear for it to be forgotten and spam attacks anyway. 

4. Upgrades - You keep all your equipment so it helps that you can use various items to improve weapon resistance and deal added damage. 

While I do enjoy playing most games with a controller I found using my mouse extremely simple to move, access menus  and fight. Also the environments are vibrant and fresh so you don't get bored too quickly. The side quest Battle Mountain and varying difficulty levels are available for those who love a challenge. There's also 100+ achievements for the would be hunters to come back and 100% this game. I've only been on my first playthrough but I don't think replayability is high but for the price you have a decent 20hr minimum game on your hands. I would suggest if you're a fan of RPGs to get this. It's a bit light on story but it's done a couple of fun things with the battle system that will keep you entertained for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987456392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1404942751}
review: Easy to play. Some nice puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982317917', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1454733708}
review:
If you like Final Fantasy and silly humour this game is pure win.

EDIT:  After finishing the whole game on normal, I'm still very impressed and have penciled in a second playthrough on hard difficulty at some point.  Here's a more in depth analysis.

First up, I love the inventory.  You can hold every item in the game but there is no problems with clutter.  You never have to worry about a full inventory or wonder if you should sell an item you may need later on.  Huge time saver, I hate managing inventory.

Abilities are chosen with experience points.  There are skills and specials.  Skills are character specific, like the fighter gets sword skills, the ranger gets bow skills.  Specials can potentially be learned by 2-4 characters but only one of them can actually learn it.  For example the skill "power metal" can be learned by either of the guys but not both of the guys.  Limit breaks (yes there are limit breaks) fall into one of these two categories as well.  So there's some careful balancing to make sure your party functions well.

Equipment is easy to manage and you will be needing to switch weapons/armor/trinkets from time to time to deal with various types of enemies.  Your mage wont be needing that fire damage staff against fire elementals, for example.  Equipment can be changed during combat at the cost of a turn in case you get caught by something unexpected.  Certain fights you'll be changing gear more then once as different enemies appear.

Equipment can all be upgraded through crafting.  Not the sort of annoying crafting where you have to sort through tons of crap and figure out just how much rough stone you need to make enough widgets to make 20 springs.  Basically you open the upgrade menu, things that can be upgraded with your current mats are highlighted, things that can't are not.  It cuts the crap and simply boils it down to the desicion of, is this where you'd like to spend these materials?  Most of the items I was using were maxed by the end of the game with no particular effort to farm or buy materials.  2-3 weapons per char, 1-2 armors, 1-2 helmets, and a whole whack of trinkets.  

The real meat of the combat boils down to resistances and damage types.  8 types of elemental damage and 8 debuffs, all with their own counterpart resist stat.  Fortunatley you don't have to memorize 16 stats for every enemy type.  When an enemy typs is scanned with your scanbot, you can hover over them to check their stats at any time for the rest of the game.

There are also summons, as you'd expect from a final fantasy game, however they are not spammable in this.  You get summoning points for each kill depending on monster strength and use the summoning points to ... summon.

One thing that always bothered me about Final fantasy and Chrono Trigger was how end game tended to revolve around spamming your biggest AoE, a lot.  It looked like this game was heading that direction in the mid game, but toward the end that was just not possible.  Mixed immunities ensures you aren't just spamming a single AoE forever.  This game really took all the good out of final fantasy and boiled away a lot of the crap.  8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198051559418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1480532515}
review:
+ Множество оружия, брони, заклинаний, при этом каждое заклинание и снаряжение можно улучшать.
+ Разнообразные враги и боссы, каждый со своими сильными и слабыми сторонами.
+ Отличный юмор, забавные реплики персонажей.
+ Большое количество ачивок (для любителей).
+ Уровни сложности: от легкого, где можно профейсролить всю игру, до эпического, где нужно неплохо так напрягаться.
+ Огромная дополнительная локация, которой нету в бесплатной версии игры, а также при покупке прилагается саундтрек (который очень даже хорош).

- Флеш.
- Нету возможности делать скриншоты с помощью стима.
- Последняя локация может показаться немного затянутой.
- После убийства последнего босса  и финального ролика игра сразу без предупреждения переходит в New Game+, поэтому, если нужно куда-то вернуться, лучше это делать предварительно.

Купил на распродаже, ни разу не пожалел о покупке, учитывая то, что в предыдущие три я не играл. Любителям РПГ с пошаговыми боями - рекомендуется.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984322112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3443, 'last_played': 1425863023}
review:
This would be the first turn-based RPG where (when playing on epic) you have to take time to set up equipment for the battle. You have 4 character and play 3 at a time, they all have a weakness and strength (of attacks) so you have a good reason to use all 4. A game worth the time and price. If you like turn based RPG, you will not be disapointed.

Edit: Game gets quite challanging when going for all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036279582', 'num_games_owned': 2196, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1404527607}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an interesting game.  It's an "old-school inspired", JRPG-esque game but it's also heavily Western in styling...I know that's a strange sentance but this is a strange game.  The characters and dialogue are cheeky, fun, and likable, and the animations are well done and seem powerful.  The music is pretty good (although repetitive) and there are almost too many collectable and upgradable weapons, skills, and summons to digest at once.

Even with all that said, while playing this game I strangely felt like there wasn't all that much compelling me to keep going.  I got a few hours enjoyment out of it so I don't necessarily regret the purchase but it just wasn't a gripping title by any means.  It's really a glorified web/flash game with a few perks that it picked up when it moved to Steam.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 isn't bad per se, but I don't think I would recommend it to other gamers.  That said, if it looks interesting, I'd recommend playing it for free in its original medium - a web flash game:

http://www.kongregate.com/games/kupo707/epic-battle-fantasy-4

If you like it and/or want to purchase it to support the developer please go ahead, the game works flawlessly as a desktop title and the port from web to client went very smoothly.

All in all I'd give it a 6/10 - and I would recommend once again that interested parties check out the web version before purchasing.  The game shows potential, but really it seems to be trying to pull off what Cthulhu Saves the World and Breath of Death VII achieve much more gracefully.  However, the production value and syling of Epic Battle Fantasy seems of higher quality than the other two titles I listed, so if the author can make a few tweaks I see bright things for the future of this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047957600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1458656612}

The Soundtrack is easily great. I'm often sitting around in towns or fields just to enjoy the tunes.
The battle and customization has improved again since the last installment. Gotta grind for the goods, ya know?
Dialog and gameplay are simple and humorous, but get suprisingly difficult if your not prepared.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086458681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1427493120}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997467243', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1404316625}
review:
Excellent.
Pour avoir joué au premier et au deuxième et pour avoir négliger le trois à l'époque à cause de mes lacunes en anglais, je ne regrette pas d'avoir pris ce quatrième épisode.
Un énorme concentré de cliché à la con de tout les rpgs existants, il y a pas un seul passage où on ne relèvera pas un clin d'oeil a une série ou autre. Entre le cliché de la fille aux gros seins, celui du perso qui meurt et revit toutes les deux secondes, on est fournis. Et pourtant les personnages ne manquent pas d'originalité : Matt le samuraï voleur d'épées (et il s'en cache pas), Natt' la magotte multi-fonction qui est la seule à avoir un brin de conscience, Lance l'ancien ennemi du 2, qui dispose de putains de support terrestre et aérien mais dont le point faible est... bah Natt. Et Anna la ranger écolo mais pas trop.
Le gameplay est du tour par tour classique, avec des notions bien appuyés sur les faiblesses élémentales des mobs, d'où la dose massive d'armes à votre disposition, ainsi que d'armures et de "flairs" : il arrive très vite qu'on prenne un tour entier pour ses persos et modifier l'équipement en conséquence. Chaque perso' a sa spécialité, de base, mais avec les skills spéciaux, ils peuvent être beaucoup plus polyvalents ou bien être encore plus cantonnés à ce qu'ils savent faire le mieux. Les limits breaks sont assez spectaculaires, ça envoie du bois et le tout est vachement bien dessiné.
Côté musique, on attends pas quelque chose de lourd mais globalement tout colle à chaque ambiance, les musiques de combats restent épiques.
Seul bémol chez moi : le jeu ram à partir de 2heures de jeu approximativement et il faut le relancer.
La quête principale est très conne, mais dans le sens délirante. Il a une bonne durée de vie, on peut recommencer 3 fois, mais on a aussi le mont bataille avec ses boss améliorés et ses rush de mobs, en plus des quêtes à la con des pnjs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114547725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1404333669}
review: This installment of the EBF series is by far the best. The humor was fantastic and definitely angled in a way most gamers would understand, The story is fun and imaginative, The combat is fun and has a fair amount of challenge to it, The treasures and secrets are fun to hunt for, The soundtrack is great and fun to listen to, And the sprites for both players and enemies are very well put together. Its absolutely worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008062777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2197, 'last_played': 1425856574}
review:
I'm always a fan of Final Fantasy style games, the ones where you take turns doing damage to your enemies, and them to you. What I especially like about the Epic Battle Fantasy games however, is the differences it has that make it stand out as a game. For instance, at the highest levels, your weapons that you've had since the beginning are still options to use for battle, instead of other games where your starter weapon was probably sold at the first shop for some extra cash. For the final bosses as well, unlike the FF games, where simple grinding could make anything easy, this game relies on intelligent strategy to beat a boss. 

You can't simply use brute force to take down an enemy here, it requires actual thinking. You have to consider:

-What weapons do I use?
-What's their weakness?
-What armour do I wear to compensate for their skills and mine?
-What skills do I use, and which special abilities (Only one person gets it, but you choose) gets which skills. 

All of this, a decent storyline, great music, good characters with unique personalities, and a vast world are all reasons why Epic Battle Fantasy 4 should be considered a great buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016751832', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1669133325}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092326788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1504218616}
review: Love this game. I played it on Kongregate, and when I heard that it was greenlighted, I had to get it. 10/10 would play over and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042876171', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1501664192}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4...truly a wonderful nod to the RPG's of old, and filled to the brim with personality, humor, and references everywhere. The game plays like a traditional RPG, where you walk around the world, find items in chests, complete a few quests for NPC's (and by 'quest', I mean go and find them some junk and bring it back), and fight enemies.

Of course, there is a deeper play to it. Anyone who has played the prior Epic Battle Fantasy games on Flash game sites such as Armorgames or Kongregate will know that equipping the right stuff is key to the game, and even armor and items you find early on may play key roles later on, especially if you upgrade them. No weapon or armor is useless in this game, and it allows for a good amount of customization. Plus, the proper armor and weapons show up on the character as you switch them, which is a fine little bonus~

And for those who are skeptical of buying this knowing that there is indeed a Free-to-Play version out there, the money is well worth the spending, because you're not only supporting the creator of this fine series (kudos to you, Matt Rozak), but you get some extra content in the form of new weapons/armor, new summons, and a tough optional area that will test your skills in more ways than one. Plus you get the soundtrack to boot~

Overall, it's a very good game, especially for one made in Flash. If you're looking for a light-hearted RPG, this may just be the one for you.~

author: {'steamid': '76561198006142323', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1405443056}
review:
Bought this game on Steam sale, always wanted but I'm cheap. Oh boy, this game is worth every single dollar (even at full price) I started it and what I thought was going to be just 2 hours of playing, ended up on 12 straight hours playing it non stop, the game is hilarious with all the jokes, anime references and how the players talk about it to be a game on occasions.

The battle system is like the good old days of RPG games and turn based one (god I miss those kind of games), epic skills, epic animation, a lot of moe from nats, epic music, this is why this game title is epic Battle Fantasy :3

Truly recommend buying it

20/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198120738823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1451604262}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119985051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1449297527}
review:
[h1][b]ネコのネコによるネコ世界での4人の冒険録[/b][/h1]

懐かしさを感じるターン制シンボルエンカウント式RPG
フィールド上を歩き回り、敵を倒して経験値を貯めて
世界各地を冒険するというシンプルな内容
どこかで見たことがあるキャラ、雰囲気、BGMなど日本向けの内容だが
今のところ日本語訳がないのが残念。

移動はマウスかキーボードで選べるが、戦闘は基本マウスで選択するため
自分はマウスで移動している。
フィールドが広がるにつれ前のエリアに戻るのが億劫か？と思ったが
エリア毎にしっかりワープが設置されていたので
新しいエリアに来た際にはしっかり確認しておこう
（エリアのイメージに沿ったネコがそれである）

使用できる仲間は４人（男女２：２）おり、戦闘は３人参加
いつでも戦闘中に仲間を取っ替え引っ替えする事ができる
キャラ専用スキル、兼用スキルと分かれており
デバッファーとバッファーと分けたり、魔法攻撃役と物理攻撃役…
このようにキャラをしっかり役割分担出来るのが
個人的に良い点だと思った。
ただ、属性ゲーなので敵の弱点の属性を突ける武器が
揃っていないと不利かもしれない

装備品も素材さえあればいつでも強化でき、絵柄も可愛いこともあって
自分は女性メンバーの装備はどうしても見た目重視になってしまう
[h1][b]おっぱいがぷるんぷるんします[/b][/h1]

難易度も自分で選択出来るので、じっくり考えて
敵を倒すRPGをやってみたい、という人にはオススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023906188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1853, 'last_played': 1521387997}
review: Very well done turn based RPG, funny, and amazing music.  Recommended to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048191133', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2776, 'last_played': 1506637275}
review:
This is the game, that brings back memories of all the great Animes, games, stories, memes and jokes. The Epic graphics and music will have you just.. "Wooow" and "EPIC!". The battles are glorious, leveling system the most balanced i have ever seen, no need for grinding ever.

The game features cats as the main antagonists, how much more epic can it be? Well, it can! When you face your first opponent that can kill all four of your paty members in a single round, even with Auto-Revive buff! Or the fact that some of your enemies can hack your Ultimate Limit Attacks and use them against yourself! It is so glorious i must cry!

And then you will laugh upon the jokes and awesome attack animations. Cry when you die from a boss you just spendt two hours trying to kill without a single death until now. 
This my dear friends, is probably one of the reasons why JRPG games are still popular.

I highly recomend this to anyone who likes Menu Combat RPG games, filled with jokes, good references, awesome music and amazing graphics. Worth all the bucks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136690893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3206, 'last_played': 1486998777}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031905307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1506848678}
review:
I picked this up as an impulse buy, and am glad I did so. 

If you like turn-based battle systems where smart play is rewarded (ie, check the bestiary, choose the right equipment for a given battle, build your characters so each can cover a few different attack types), I can easily recommend this game. The combats are things you initiate, but the monsters are varied enough that equipment selection isn't as simple as "take ice weapons in fire place." 

A further point in its favor is that you don't have to waste any time with extended tutorial nonsense- straight to the gameplay with all the systems available pronto! The plot is a genre-aware "save the world" background, but the dialogue pokes enough fun at it that never became obnoxious. 

The game also oozes quality, with no bugs I have run into and the artwork for the battles is detailed and clean.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072503499', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1418959400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969018797', 'num_games_owned': 2044, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2683, 'last_played': 1404068587}
review: I want to start by saying that I have over 400 games in my Steam library, with the dreaded curse of barely beating any. When I get hooked to the point I play through this game to the end, you know it's a damn good game. Thanks to Steam's Summer Sale, I was introduced to this game. It's simplistic in graphics but it's a very well done turn-based RPG. It's not a AAA title, nor does it pretend to be. I hope there's a sequel one day with many improvements and on a larger scale. The random humor thrown in is a plus too.
