author: {'steamid': '76561198009523482', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2057, 'last_played': 1404035695}
review:
Pretty fun. A huge time sink. I took 34.3hrs to do two play throughs, one on normal and one on epic. Second time was to get most of the medals/achievements as well as all the equipment I missed on the first playthrough.

Limit breaks are a little meh. Cbf doing the third playthrough.

I bought it on sale but it's probably worth it's full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085088135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1406337980}
review:
I could write you a long review but honestly, here's what you need to know.

1. JRPG - It's old skool. Turn based. Think Final Fantasy.
2. It's anime. Yup. The art is overall pretty solid.
3. It doesn't take itself seriously. This is the game that really is mostly fan service to all of us diehards who love this crap.
4. You will save the world from an evil Godcat. I can't make this shit up.

Is it best game you'll ever play? Probably not. It's fun and the price is right. If you hate any of the items above, pass on it, otherwise it's a good buy. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025370779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1601, 'last_played': 1404638121}
review:
Do you like turn-based RPGs? Do you like silly dialogue? Do you like stupid yet lovable protagonists who steal everything not bolted to the ground? Do you like clicking on women's chests? Do you like silly/cool outfits? Do you like references to cool stuff? Do you like cats?

If the answer to any of those is yes, you're gonna like this game.

But if you're still not sure, then maybe head on over to Kongregate and try the flash version. It's basically the same game, but without a bonus area that you have to pay for on the flash version. And then maybe buy it if you like it. I think it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055311780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 8500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8493, 'last_played': 1404514841}
review:
Wow this game is good.
It is probably my favorite RPG of 2014.
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8257320/]Be sure to leave a like, comment and join Grumpy Reviews[/url][/quote]
[quote][url=https://www.patreon.com/GrumpyReviews]Liked the review? Leave me a tip on Patreon[/url][/quote]
It's deep, it's solid and it is as easy or hard as you want it to be. Like Bravely Default you can switch difficulty at any time with no consequence. You can run from any battle everytime including boss battles, when you scan an enemy it stays scanned in future battles, items are clearly sorted based on type and effect, in-fact if you were to describe everything you hated about RPG's in the past 5 years, this game takes all of those things and removes them replacing them with something better. 

If I had one wish, it would be that the game was on a better engine with better presentation and that more people heard of this game because it is truly an underrated classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041323839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1397, 'last_played': 1450933276}
review:
Enjoyable RPG that has a good sense of humor and doesn't require previous knowledge of the series to enjoy.  The music is well done and the environments are well detailed with lots of little references around.

Supporting a good artist as well.  You can check out the previous entries, and even play it for free on Newgrounds, but if you like it there, I would encourage supporting the creator by picking it up here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010012124', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1404617674}
review: If you love the RPGs of old, laughing, and a killing adorable creatures (And some not so adorable ones) THIS GAME IS FOR YOU! Turn based combat perfected after three previous games, its easily the best of the serires. I know that some of you may be asking, "Do I have to play the other three in order to understand whats going on?" THE ANSWE IS NO. Some references to previous entries are in the game but they don't matter. Just pick it up for the cheap price and enjoy the fun that comes with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034956596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1404630144}
review: Dabbled in one of the earlier games years ago and I pretty much enjoyed it. The gameplay is simple at a first glance, but then makes you think about how you want the characters to grown. The humor is down right good and honest. It isn't anything forced like in some games. This is one of those games that you can sink so much time in and still enjoy it after wards. It's defintely one of those, I will finish this eventually, but I'm not going to rush it because it's good at what it does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004285730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1565986578}
review: This game is realy well done. Turn based fights a la Final Fantasy and much equipment and skills you can upgrade. Bought it for 2,50 € and I enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024949177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5516, 'last_played': 1434326785}
review: Классическая RPG с отличным графическим стилем и неплохом балансом. Много удачного стеба над условностями жанра (катсцена с первым использованием ботинок для хождения по водяным лилиям великолепна). Несколько напрягает только система атрибутов, подразумевающая постоянное жонглирование арсеналом, но можно просто поставить сложность  пониже и использовать безатрибутное оружие.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024995503', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1559020701}
review:
Vas a pensar, ¿Por que comprarlo?, es un RPG, claro, pero no como los otros donde te pide una brutalidad de pc para correrlo y que todos parecen iguales y ademas no avanzas nada en muchas horas de juego.
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 no es de los tipicos RPG que todo es serio, (bueno, casi todo), donde tenemos a 4, pero bien entrenados guerreros que estan en la busqueda de los 3 objetos magicos que han sido robados.

Puedes ir recorriendo el mundo, haciendo busquedas y llenandote los bolsillos con las monedas que juntas, compras equipo, armas y encuentras a todos los enemigos en el juego

Tiene logros, Cartas de intercambio y puedes jugarlo en mayores dificultades cada vez que termines el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089724515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1498065331}
review: The game's pretty awesome. You have to learn a bit on your own but once you get it done the games awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976755967', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1603, 'last_played': 1464623588}
review: Yeah, this game is totally worth tossing a few bucks to the devs.  There's great attention to detail and tons of variety.  Game length is around what I used to get out of a 16-bit console RPG.  And of course the humor and style is quite enjoyable.  Overall, great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017838344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1403675295}
review:
The game is fun, reminds me of older JRPGs. I find the cartoony faces entertaining, too. 
The music is very catchy as well. 
Storywise, I like it so far, it has a fun feel to it.
And you won't hurt your wallet buying it, so I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049066090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1447333974}
review:
Gioco questa serie fin dal primo episodio in flash, e adesso vi dico il motivo perchè in particolare il quarto episodio.
Il gioco è godibile per la sua impostazione, leggera e divertente ma intrigante allo stesso tempo, onestissimo nel voler dire "questo è un gioco che si rifà ad altri" ma che allo stesso tempo rimescola le carte del mazzo fornendo alla fine qualcosa di originale, un po' come quando incontri qualcosa che è familiare ma non sai comunque cosa aspettarti davanti a te.
La grafica è disegno 2D e come potete evdere da trailer è molto godibile, specialmente se piace lo stile di disegno.
Le meccaniche sono quelle tipiche dei GDR, spuntando però buona parte dei suoi lati negativi: il gioco non è rigido e permette la creazione di diverse personalizzazioni dei personaggi anche se tutti hanno una loro impostazione e identità ben definita, la crescita e l' allenamento dei personaggi è una componente fondamentale ma il grinding si rivela controproducente e non necessario, dato che ucciderai mostri più che a sufficienza se vuoi ottenere tutti i forzieri e i segreti nascosti, e lo dice una persona che se lo è giocato sia a difficoltà media che epica ( a proposito, niente incontri casuali :D ).
E adesso il combattimento: mettete insieme i turni a la final fantasy, le combinazioni tra i tipo di pokémon e la possibilità di poter cambiare dinamicamente tutto, abusando così delle differenti debolezze dei nemici che siano elementi o status, senza però che questi siano fissati: molte volte vi dovrete decidere se tenere un' arma o cambiarla in un' altra, e stesso vale per altri pezzi d' equipaggiamento, perchè sono apparsi ondate di nemici con affinità diverse o perchè il boss stesso ha cambiato le sue affinità, senza che ci siano così i soliti pezzi di equipaggiamento sile "metti quelli e tiri dritto per tutto il combattimento" e invece invogliandoti a rivedere più volte la tua strategia( anche se magari si nota di meno a difficoltà basse ).
Inoltre grande contenuto endgame che tiene incollato per un pezzo.
La pecca maggiore secondo me però è che il gioco è stato portato in maniera non eccellente per pc, mostrando una fluidità non secondo gli standard di altri giochi e più secondo gli standard di un gioco in flash e con vari problemi di compatibilità e di performance, ma il gioco è solido e ne vale più che la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065805476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 4834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1464590886}
review:
I'm known to HATE turn-based combat, but the Epic Battle Fantasy Series is the exception. I don't know what it is about the games that makes me love them to bits... I guess it's the characters and the wholeheartedness of it all. What I feel: Kupo wants to make these games for the love of making them. Also, you can't say that the characters haven't had any development. I remember how Lance joined the team (not in EBF4) - which was hilarious. Then there's Anna who learned to tolerate Matt's love to ste- err, take "Free Samples" whenever he wants. A love development can really complicate the narrative if mis-handled, so please be careful and don't rush it!
My bit of critic, I.E. the only problem I had: wave transitions are cruel. Q.Q;
Maybe it's intentional, but once all the enemies attack then they all die of poison or whatever, the next enemies come in and they get to go first. Also, if the last (and only) enemy attacks and then die from a counter attack, I start hating my characters' awesomeness since I have to deal with the next wave's attacks before I can heal or something. It'd be great if that were dealt with. :D
That's literally my only complaint, with the first sentence in mind, so YES! Get it and play it! Totally worth it!
Lastly: I love the reference to Golden Sun. >.>

author: {'steamid': '76561198001561633', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1507482024}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998079161', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1527275159}
review:
Jogo despretencioso com um incrível sistema de batalha inspirado nos clássicos jRPG. Seu visual "rascunhado e infantil" infelizmente afasta boa parte dos possíveis jogadores. Porém o jogo não almeja nem de longe a seriedade, muito pelo contrário. Todo seu visual simples tem o propósito intencional de tirar um grande sarro de clássicos como Final Fantasy e seus derivados. As perguntas agora são: O jogo é bom? Vale a pena pegar? Se você fã de RPG com batalhas de turno, sim. Se você se julga sério demais e não tem coragem de dar espaço para um storyline sem pé nem cabeça com personagens loucos, esqueça, você vai engavetá-lo. 

Conclusão: Gosta de comédia, não liga pra gráficos e é fã de jRPG? Vai fundo! Você não vai se arrepender!
Minha nota para ele (considerando ser um jogo indie) é 8/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041358757', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1631130196}
review:
I bought EBF4 a couple of days ago and the Steam Sale, it didn't look too special but apparently many people recommended it. What I got was an quite an suprisingly amazing game, a good looking and fun RPG, not only that but pretty addictive too. I know this is made on Flash, and free to play on some sites on the internet I still feel like it's worth it, for the price and it's estimated play time (about 11-12 Hours in, still not done), definitly if it's on sale. You should really try it if you like a great classic RPG with some good humor, references and fun gameplay.

9.5/10 Definitly worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042802768', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1534152155}
review:
For those of you who are holding off buying this game because it's the 4th in a series or because it's free on Kongregate, Don't hold off anymore!
Despite being the 4th in the series the game has it's own story and simply catches you up to whats happened previously
And for those that say it's not worth buying because it's free on Kongregate, Well your very wrong

The Kongregate version dosn't contain as much content as the steam version and for a game that easily plays for over 12 hours paying $10 for it is easily worth it.

So if you have some spare change in your wallet I would recommend this game anyday, Due to its great humor and fun gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042582452', 'num_games_owned': 929, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1404113863}
review: This game has become one of my guilty pleasures. Although it's a port of a Freemium Flash game, it runs smoothly and is thankfully devoid of a Cash Shop. The graphics are whimsically cute, and the gameplay can be considered JRPG-lite for Westerners...as it has everything you'd expect in a JRPG but without the insane grind (you can make it through the entire game within 12-14 hours as opposed to hundreds of hours in a typical JRPG). The humor and use of standard JRPG tropes is comical to where you can't help but smile and giggle incessently while playing (down to the non-apologetic blatant remix of the victory theme from FFVII).  It may not be a hard-core JRPG, but it is a delightfully fun tip of the hat to classic JRPGs. It's definitely worth the price of admission.

review:

YOUR COCKSUCKING PRODUCT HAS REDUCED ME TO A GIBBERING MAN-APE WHOSE ONLY RESORT TO DEALING WITH THE ALMIGHTY FUCKING GRIEF IT'S BESTOWED UPON ME IS TO SCREAM AND HURT MYSELF.

Swear to god, you should have just added a little door to the disk drive through which a hand pops out and flips me off, because I am insulted that your QA or testers or whatever brainless shitstove three genes short of a monkey FAGNUT signs your games through thought that a person with more than a single fucking digit IQ could enjoy the Rafflesia fight. INSULTED

How in the fuck does a Rafflesia - whose flower is the ugliest and most useless looking piece of wildlife since the fucking Blobfish - suddenly become SO FUCKING GOOD that it can one shot me with some fucking vine whip thing? It's not any fun if I can't win, you cruel, free-game making, tech-supporting, artistic asshole. I want to move on. I want to unlock whatever piece of shit bullshit boss you have hidden away from me so I can start dying and get pissed off with that too. author: {'steamid': '76561198079426323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1548323890}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060462175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1535469221}
review: Un juego RPG de la antigua escuela. Recuerda mucho a los primero FF en estilo de jugabilidad. En lo personal el diseño de equipo, personajes y mapa me parece muy original y divertido, aunque estos ultimos y muchos de los dialogos toman base en cultura popular como puede ser Pokemon, Minecraft entre otros. Me gusto mucho el detalle de que los peronajes sepan que estan en un juego ya que le agrega mucho humor. La cantidad de armas, armaduras, poderes y objetos que hay le dan ese toque que vas a querer conseguirlo todo por simple diversion. La jugabilidad esta bien valanceada y se nota mucho el esfuerzo que se le puso al juego. Para los amantes de los RPG antiguos este juego es muy recomendado y espero con ansias la 5º entraga :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002750569', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5693, 'last_played': 1513897822}
review:
Expect 32-40 hours on 1 first playthrough if you are playing on the hardest difficulty.  
Great amounts of a humor and loads of items to collect and find. Battles are fairly simple and straightforward however on the hardest difficulty preperation is key, indulge in the prospect of experimenting with items and different combinations as the game is far from impossible.  
  
I would highly recommend this game to casual strategy lovers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058644382', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1414627713}
review:
A prendre en promo pour les amateurs de RPG a l'ancienne !

Alors oui, c'est adapté d'un jeu android, mais il est de qualité. De plus il y'a la totalité des zones premium, ou de se qui pourrait être payant sur telephone....

Pour le jeu en lui même, la première chose agréable c est de pouvoir modifier la difficulté du jeu (de facile a epic) a tout moment du jeu (hors combat). ça permet aux joueurs aussi bien casu qu'aux acharnés de se faire plaisir (succes pour les boss en epic, farm rapide d'item ou d'exp en facile). 
On rajoute a ça, de nombreux objets pour s'équiper, tous pouvant être améliorer grace a un systeme de forge simple. Une multitude d'objets habituels pour se qui est des soins, boost stat et objet clefs, la majorité en réference a d'autres rpg cultes.

Les graphismes et détails sont assez soigné pour un style 16bit, et une musique au niveau d'un bon rpg :)

Un monde assez vaste et possédant un bon rythme de progression et d'exploration. Le tout ponctue d'humour et de petites phrases spéciale dédiées a chaque première fois (utilisation d'un skill, mort, resu, attaque ennemis, etc).
Aussi il n'y a pas de combat aléatoire, on peut sauvegarder n'importe où, il y'a un bestiaire a remplir, plein de petites quêtes et des invocations a collectionnées ... Cool

{'steamid': '76561198017056727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1404082719}
review: This, my fine gaming siblings, is what we've all been waiting for. Addicting turn-based classic JRPG gameplay. an amazing soundtrack that gets you in the mood to fight when entering a battle, and let's you jam out as you travel. Funny and interesting characters that you grow to love (and laugh at) instantly. A myriad of spells, skills, weapons, armor, power-ups, enemies, dungeons, landscapes, and slightly... *ahem* "special" (yet hilarious) NPCs. An artstyle with animations that instantly pique your inner otaku and hold you captive. And last, but not least, and interesting and engaging storyline that will have you on the edge of your seat (perhaps exagerated, but i digress). Everything about this game screams that it was carefully and lovingly developed by a AAA team of a godly design. But not so, as it is meticulously crafted by one man who has spent years on these games. Perhaps it is free elsewhere, but i implore that you consider helping out this fellow, by throwing a few dollars his way. It is easily worth the money. Now, go forth my brothers and sisters. Go forth and conquer that which is Epic Battle Fantasy 4. Because if this isn't a 10/10 masterpiece, then nothing is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000974063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1403555401}
review: This game is the best $3 I ever spent. It's fun, and challenging, without being grind-y. A lot of pop culture refs in it, but they're more like inside jokes. Fun if you get them, but not trying to shove them down your throat. I do recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032159884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1673795504}
review:
Rather a silly (fun!) pastiche of JRPGs, this addictive little game has enough basic puzzles and humor to make it your go-to quick fix for a little straightforward play time. The learning curve (at least on Normal) is pretty low, with few moments of true fear for your party, but getting at least one member with Revive is not a bad idea. Just pay attention to skill and item leveling (in my case, focusing on a few general purpose spells at least so far to ensure always doing at least *some* damage). I fully expect the higher levels to be much trickier, but I'm saving those for a later playthrough.

Especially if it is on sale, this is most certainly worth getting if you at all like the genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090280726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1556687253}
review:
nunca se me paso por la cabeza que veria este juego en steam (es un juego de internet), lo empece a jugar desde el battle royale, los bullet heaven, y la saga de epic battle fantasy (incluido el adventure), un juegazo que me encanto y esperaba esta secuela mucho tiempo, a pesar de que lo termine me nacio comprar el juego para que siga con esta saga que hasta el momento no me a dejado gusto a poco en ninguna de sus entregas.

ahora lo punto de vista del juego

en si es un juego de rpg de la vieja escuela en donde tiene que subir de nivel para ser mas fuerte para vencer a los enemigos y los jefes (que a mi juicio son dificiles de ganar si no posees una estrategia.)
lo mejor del juego que a pesar que tenga esa base de los rpg de la vieja escuela, tambien logra mezclar item y habilidades y incluso la resistencia de elementos lo que obliga al jugador no solamente depender de las habilidades normales de los personajes, sino forjar las armas y armaduras y ver su cualidad de que elemento sea mas resistente y conveniente antes de enfrentarte a un enemigo. 
la musica es precisa en cada ocasion y hace que el climax sea unica en cada momento (sobretodo en el desenlace del juego).
la historia es con humor que en ocasiones te puedes reir de las tonteras que hace los protagonista pero a medida que se va avanzando se empieza a teñir un poco mas oscura pero sin dejar de lado la personalidad de sus personajes.
la mecanica del juego se podria ser un poco enredado un principio pero ya sus primeras batallas te acostumbras, es comoda y tiene lo justo y necesario.

en otras palabras si te gusta los juegos rpg, no dudes en probar este juego que sin duda te enganchara en la historia y estaras igual que yo, esperando una posible secuela xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198039470046', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1567396460}

review:
Da ich per zufall auf dieses Spiel gestoßen bin im Summersale bin ich sehr überrascht gewesen wie simpel und schön dieses Spiel ist.
Da ich ein begeisterter RPG Fan bin wollt ich halt mal so 2 Stundne investieren woraus dann doch mehr wurden :P
Es ist sehr fesselnd in der Storyline und man hat viele möglichkeiten alles aus den Charakteren, Skills und Equipment zu holen und dennoch ist ein Kampf nicht wie der andere.
Sehr abwechslungsreich und lustig.
Und einen tipp an den Entwickler, bring die ersten 3 teile auf zu Steam oder am besten ein Komplettpaket :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197960307962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1404915479}
review:
Nice: Graphics, Humor, Sound and Music

Good: Item Variety, Level design

Bad: Very long fights since the jungle level (sorry but 4 enemy waves every time just to get one treasure which has in general not much effect on the gameplay seems not worth the effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009433626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1673935499}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032289007', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1403557855}
review:
Why should you get this game? In short: It is fun, and unique.

Just 10 minutes into the game and you can see everything that has been inspired from games of old. Turn Based battle system, a fun, laid back skill system, and visual cues that darn well give away hints.

If you're looking for an extremely hardcore RPG, you have come to the wrong place, if however - you are looking for a "comfy" JRPG which focuses more on fun, you have come to the right place. Not to say the game is not challenging - far from it. It's just more relaxing to play than other JRPGs on the market. Hence the term "Comfy JRPG"; it's something you can play all night without realizing the time, which is exactly what happened to me last night.

Even-though I have some of the best JRPGs ever created in my library I choose to play this for hours instead. Now, you're probably wondering why? The answer is simple: Fun. Literally pure fun. With some of the classic JRPGs you get ups and downs, and sometimes just can't be bothered to keep playing - but with this, it's just all ups and I never wanted to put the mouse down. - Would be nice to perhaps Controller support in the future though.

The story/plot is very unique, and the game has some nice light humour, which is very nice to see in a JRPG. This is a game that doesn't take itself too serious. It's less about hardcore grinding, and more about fun. The story up to now has been great, but I won't say much as it would ruin surprises for you.

It's quite funny seeing certain thing's in game and you think to yourself "Wait a minute! That looks familiar!) - There are clear references to Final Fantasy, Zelda, Pokemon, etc. It was funny seeing that Pikachu on the fire, and other stuff which I won't mention it as it could spoil the surprise. There are plenty of different foes, and might I add - the art style is very good too. Would be nice to see 1080p support in the future for those who can make use of it.

The battle system is very relaxing. There is no rushing, no stress. You do stuff in your own time. There are a lot of skills and specials to choose from. Items can also give you permanent boosts, as well as your mandatory heal items, etc you would come to expect from a JRPG.

At first the item collecting seemed weird - but after a bit of time I realized it's another great element to the game, and it reminds me of when I used to be a kid and collected rare items in games. It's nice to have something like that again. Although, it would be nice if there was a few less item quests, and perhaps a few more hunt x monsters quests.

So what are the final thoughts for EBF4? It's almost the ultimate comfy JRPG, and that's not a light thing to say. This game is VERY FUN. So if you want to sit on the couch or desk for hours and hours and forget about time and eventually grow a beard and never wash again because you are so damn addicted, then this game is for you. Seriously. BUY IT NOW. Feel free to look at my reviews for other games, I normally score most games low, but this get's an 8/10 from me.

Also; Did I mention you can make bewbs bounce, and play with pussies? :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198067844824', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1433250524}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991391480', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 10465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3090, 'last_played': 1701401780}
review: Don't let its Flash game origins fool you, EBF4 is a polished product with lots of features even the big boys can't be bothered with. The fights are tough, but you can see them coming, the healing is generous, and you can save anytime you're not in battle. There's also auto-mapping, tool tips for status effects, and tons of achievements to earn. Oh, and lots and lots of silly humor.

It scratches that JRPG without the terrible grind. I'm also loving the art / feel of this game. The variety of outfits is nice and they also look great. The creatures are cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030024830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1558811322}
review:
One of the most humorous/best Turned-Based RPG games I've ever played. To be honest, I enjoyed this game from the creativity and the humor that comes along with it. Final Fantasy was way too serious and more dull theme. This game provides many anime funny moments and references. For example, on the clothings that were fire proof based off Yoko's Outfit. 

Overall, this game is recommended for you turn-based fans.
Let's have fun, not be serious and dull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028247229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1434672936}
review:
A turn-based RPG reminiscient of older games like Golden Sun, Sword of Mana, and early Final Fantasy. Aside from a few quirky bits, there isn't really anything here that makes the game stand out - it's standard JRPG fare. The characters and story are decent enough, the combat/leveling seems fine, enemies are reasonable, puzzles are somewhat easy but can have tricky parts here and there, etc. You can adjust the difficulty level at any time if you feel the game is getting too easy.

The art style is questionable, but it looks better in-game than it does in the store page's screenshots. I would prefer a different style but this is acceptable.

Some of the reviews mentioned this game being online, so I checked, and yep you can play for free on Kongregate. The Steam version has additional content and more options though, so it's probably worth a couple of dollars (I picked this up for $3 in the summer sale). I played through about half of the first level online to see if the game was even worth playing, and I'd recommend the same to anyone who might be thinking about buying this.

The first boss is a surprise due to its power level, which is far above anything you've already dealt with. You'd expect that from a boss, but not to this extent. The boss could one-shot the healer, which was slightly annoying. It's still not "hard" to beat the boss, but some grinding will be necessary for a few people (depending on the difficulty mode). The other bosses seem easier in relation to your power level, so it seems the power curve is better-adjusted after this first boss.

Overall this game seems worth some money and time if you like RPGs. It's a bit on the casual side and definitely not perfect, but for $3 there isn't much to complain about. It's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991672799', 'num_games_owned': 1796, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1405202841}
review: Oh my, but this is a fun game! It looks very cartoony, but that's just part of it's charm. It does a good job of making fun of a good number of things in RPGs and actually makes for a fun game while doing so. I I can recommend this game to anyone that likes RPGs from the 16-bit era as it plays very similar to those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018987933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1404067680}
review: Un jeu surprenant . Etant a la base fan de JRPG , je me suis dis : mouais ca a l'air sympa mais ca doit être plutot simple vu les graphisme "so cute" ce jeu doit être destiné aux moins de 12 ans . Bref , ayant quelques menue monnaie sur mon accompte (merci la vente de cartes hehe) et le jeu étant en promo a 2,40 dollars , je l'ai acheté . Et la...bin c'est franchement la big bonne surprise : non seulement le jeu est trufé d'humour potache , et de références aux tenors du genre mais il possede en plus une profondeur énorme , craft , compétences , magie , invocations , upgrade d'items , combats nécéssitant de ne pas faire nawak car tout est basé sur les attaques / défenses élémentaires , bref tous les éléments qui en font un incontournable pour les amateurs de JRPG . De plus les musiques sont vraiment bonnes et pas saoulantes . Surtout ne vous fiez pas a son esthétique enfantine , car c'est juste un parti pris des dev ( c'est un jeu flash a la base ) mais la profondeur et la complexité du jeu n'en patissent absolument pas . Un must have .

author: {'steamid': '76561198041999544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1408124099}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003053704', 'num_games_owned': 4575, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1488408672}
review:
I know what you're thinking. "Meh, it's just a Newsground/Kongregate/Flash kind of game that I can play for free!"

But this game is actually pretty decent and very fun to RPG. If you liked Final Fantasy VII back in the day, this one will be a nice nostalgic trip. One with lots of jokes, so don't expect any serious gritty stuff.

Yes, you can play a free version over the Internet if you search for it, but the paid version has some more content. Actually, a lot of extra content, and it let's you play again with all your previous loot. Kinda nice.

I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034054794', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1444675167}
review: An old school and simple RPG , but also complex despite its casual look . Definetly worth a try .

author: {'steamid': '76561197984060722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1506524488}
review:
Игра прекрасная, много юмора, интересная рисовка, прикольная музыка. Чем то напоминает Ragnarok Batle offline, только здесь стиль jrpg. Если вам нравиться веселая рисовка, юмор и jrpg, то покупать обязательно. Один минус английский язык, но здесь не нужно много знать, сойдет и базовых знаний английского что бы понять про что идет речь.
И игра просто милота, как минимум попробовать стоит, можно найти в инете бесплатную версию без плюшек что есть в этом издании.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084011594', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6501, 'last_played': 1547010039}
review:
You've seen the video, and you're going "This is a Flash game.  This belongs on Newgrounds.  Wait, this IS on Newgrounds.  Why would I pay for this?  Why would anyone even greenlight this??"  I'll tell you why: because this is the RPG your oldschool heart's been waiting for.

You've got your turn-based RPG elements, your enemies rating from the silly to the spooky to the right-out terrifying, your countless tongue-in-cheek Final Fantasy/Pokemon/Zelda/Mana/etc. homages.  But then there's the feeling of being a part of this world: rather than "exploring" a "vast" world of triumphs and tribulations, you just sort of twiddle around and run into packs of monsters just sitting there on the worldmap.  There's the never-ending bickering and bantering among your teammates as you progress.  There's the range of hints both silly and satisfying that play out as you spar with your foes and try new techniques.

The challenge is there too--boy, is it ever.  For a game optimized to be played 30 minutes at a go, you can spend a lot of effort fine-tuning your characters' skills and loadouts for tough fights (and it will *really* pay off if you are playing Epic and going for the achievements).  You'll be able to come back to it over time, too--have the satisfaction of clearing the game, take some time off from it, and come back to it anew in New Game+ (or ++) playing however you feel, without having to collect all those non-key items again but with all the damage numbers exponentially increased for more cheesy epicness.

And of course, the content you won't find on Newgrounds here--the Battle Mountain--escalates the challenge further (though you could still get through it pretty easily in Easy mode if you went that route).  It's a chance to step off the beaten plot-ridden path and just smash up tons of monsters--plus all-new bosses both uncompromising and unsettling.

If you are a child of the 90s or late 80s and don't have time to play RPGs anymore but still admire them from afar, this is your chance to see firsthand what happens when nostalgic thrills meet the present day.  This East-meets-West cultural take just might give you one more fantasy to embrace after all.

review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a game that has seen in my opinion, too little attention. The animations may be a little stiff, but that is only because of the art style itself, and that is still beautiful. To anyone who is having any hesitant thoughts about this game, I suggest going to Newgrounds or Kongragate and trying your hand at the previous three instalments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024851774', 'num_games_owned': 3212, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1401801989}
review:
EBF4 is a very cute RPG. Though it is just a little flash game, but the entire performance presented, in my opinion, has excelled many state-of-the-art RPGs of the same genre obviously. Lots of humorous conversation, elaborately designed combat system and funny character setting make it so different and outstanding. And most importantly, it catches the essence of what each RPG should has, that is, the capability to keep player involved for hours without feeling any bored. It no doubt does its job very well in this aspect. I think the developer is not only just to make a product for money, but to create a vivid dreamworld for the lover of traditional RPG and themselves.
EBF4 is free-to-play on Kongregate website. If you don't have it on Steam, you can find it and its 3 predecessors there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970840876', 'num_games_owned': 1298, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2512, 'last_played': 1400761335}
review:
Hi Everyone,

I have been buing this game in a gamebundle of somesort, I'm about 18 hours ingame, have never played or heared of EBF1-3 and my first thought was: WHAT THE HELL?? What is this 3rd rate Flash game doing on Steam? I'm an achievementhunter (beginner) so I scrolled through the achievements. I saw an achievement about boobs. I was like: "Wait what? They got bewbs in this? Ok. You got my small brain's attention now." So I fired up the game and... what to say. I never saw the bewbies, BUT: I was rewarded with an easy yet intriguing old school battlesystem-RPG. The battle system reminds me of one of those RPG makler games, but the graphics are cute, the humor is excellent and the gameplay is fun. This game is for you if:

-You like Old Scool RPGs
-You like good humor on a family friendly basis... well most of it ;D
-You like to bounce around boobies...
-You like nyan cat
-You like cute stuffs
-You like to hunt desperately for pron where none is to be found because of a boobieachievement.
-You played the pervious titles.
-You play the Game on Kongeate/Newgrounds but despise the Ads.
-You like a nice soundtrack.
-You wanna see an actual GOOD flash-game selling on stem (yes this is flash, deal with it)
-You can like achievementhunting.

Things you might dislike even if one or more of the above points are positive for you:

- Full screen mode only supports a few resolutions, game kinda stays in 4:3, you get a colored border which is much like black bars if you use 16:9 resolution.
- 2D graphics
- Artstyle might seem a little childish to you

BY ALL MEANS: THIS IS A CHILDISH GAME WITH CHILDISH HUMOR, IF YOU LIKE THAT, BUY THE GAME! IT IS GREAT IN WHAT IT DOES!

I like it. :D

review:
EBF4是一款优秀的RPG游戏。这款游戏有170多种的装备，150多种的技能和140多种的怪物，不仅能满足你搭配不同装备、不同技能的需求，还能满足你的收集欲。简单的解谜系统和战斗系统，欢乐的对话，可即时调整的游戏难度，让你在抖M和抖S之间轻松转换。当然，*****还是少不了的（你玩了就知道我说的是什么了）.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 & EBF系列相关介绍：http://steamcn.com/t103198-1-1
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 全成就指南：http://steamcn.com/t103848-1-1

author: {'steamid': '76561198028725379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1666657341}
review:
Excellent independent game! If you're a fan of Final Fantasy, Golden Sun or any other RPG along those lines, you'll find plenty of things to like here.

Its a fairly simple system in terms of skills and weapons. Find the right materials and you can forge your equipment to be better. Higher level equipment requires rarer items. After winning a battle you get ability points which you can spend towards spells and skills. Higher levels need more ability points and so on. This is in addition to a standard leveling system (get exp and level up). 

The skill and equipment sets feel very well thought out. No one skill or item is designated as "crap" each feels like its part of one option for strategy, and I can say you will probably use every piece of equipment at one point or another. Another cool touch is that each item shows up on the characters both in battle and outside. It's a nice little touch.

The story is also simple to follow, but its almost like a parody of the traditional RPG plot. It doesn't take itself seriously at many points, yet still keeps you somewhat invested in fighting the big bad guy at the end. There are references galore to other RPG's and internet stuff among other things, and its just a straight up fun ride.

Finally, the music kicks ass. That's all I have to say about that.

And this was made by one guy who made flash games in the past.  While the price might be a little off putting to some, buy this to help support the guy. Plus he threw in some extra content exclusive to Steam, so its a pretty good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970242268', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1414967225}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973938427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1412273414}
review:
Whether you're a RPG veteran or not this game was definitly worth the buy for its price. The story alone makes fun of typical adventure RPG's (like one moment someone gives you advice and your character pretty much says "well no shit.") The characters are memorable, there's numerous items you can customize your characters to look different so you're not staring at the same people over and over again, have seperate spells and advantages and even in the beginning of the game they give you a ton of of and the enemies you face actually take some thought to figure out (there's a scanbot in this game who pretty much can show you all the recommended spell types you need to use and etc.) 

The graphics are sort of flash-game looking but very easy to overlook, the music soundtrack is AWESOME. During battles or even walking around I find myself bobbing my head up and down because it's so catchy whether it's playing fantasy music or viking metal. 

The ONLY downsides I can really think of about this game is 1) the fps rate. When you're in battle it doesn't occur but when you're traveling the world you'll find the character looking like its equivelent of lagging. This isn't really a big issue considering the rest of the game is really well conducted and 2) some instances the game can come off as easy but you can change the difficulty at ANY time during the game if you don't feel it's giving you that competative edge, so really come to think of it my second reason isn't really that bad if you can work your way around it just changing the difficulty. 

It's easy to figure out and enjoyable, I played three hours worth when I first got it and it felt like 15 minutes I was having so much fun with it and I definitly recommend this game.

Games in relation to this one: It's like South Park Stick of Truth mixed a little with the beauty of Plants VS. Zombies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041600295', 'num_games_owned': 4724, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1415723702}
review: Very good, funny, turn-based JRPG. Final Fantasy but without the seriousness. Pokes fun at its own genre. Good (but simple) crafting and upgrading system. Spells and attacks against enemies can do extra damage or heal them depending on elements. It keeps you on your toes so you can't just click through most battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041382232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1474244112}
review:
Truly, one of the greatest Turn-based RPG games.
Great gameplay, amazing background music, the epic difficulty is really a challenge for one's brain, the bosses are interesting and challenging, yet not boring at once,... and I could go on like this for a very long time. 
For me, one of the best games ever. Keep up the great work, Matt and Phyrnna!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062889566', 'num_games_owned': 1143, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5956, 'last_played': 1478242279}
review:
*Revised* 
Old review can be found here: http://pastebin.com/gT51U0zY
Like JRPG combat but hate the melodramatic stories or overtly anime plots that only appeal to otakus?
Want a RPG that's honest to god funny without pointing out all the cliches we see in RPGs? 
Epic Battle Fantsy 4 is for you! 
With a deep combat system that's very much based off Final Fantasy, but with enough nuances to make it its own and an interesting equipment system that allows for more replayability, unlike in most RPGs, one sword or peice of armor isn't "better" than others simply cause you find it later in the game, each have their own pros and cons that allows for extra experimentation and strategy. 
Oh and the music is pretty great too, not the best in the world but is definitely worth a listen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 3575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3483, 'last_played': 1424022946}
review:
海外産同人っぽいRPG。
どこかで見たようなキャラやアイテム、スキル等が数多く登場する。ゲーム内容は、ストーリーよりは戦闘を重視しており多くのアイテムやスキルを強化していくハクスラ要素の強いものだ。戦闘はオーソドックスなコマンド式で、2Dポリゴンのようなアニメーションが見ていて楽しい。操作キャラが4人なのに3人までしか戦闘に参加できないことが残念だ。最高難易度に設定してのボス戦は、属性を考えて対策を練らないと毎ターンごとに1人が戦闘不能になり建て直しに追われるような非常にやりがいのあるものとなっている。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072622149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1602876701}
review: Like JRPGs? Anime? Honest to goodness humor? Well good for you, a game with all of that! Not too frequently do you see such a good game. The music is great and diverse, and really conveys the area. The art is cute, but not so much that you feel sorry for the enemies you kill by the millions. The humor is great, and the gameplay? AWESOME. Getting through with brute force is impossible, but you can't be weak and expect a strategy with no force backing it up to work. The game is hard but very possible, even on Epic. Extra versions of the bosses are insanely hard but give great rewards. Even with the free version there, this game is worth more than the big, expensive games you see all so often in stores. 11 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020795', 'num_games_owned': 6567, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1396641423}
review:
First impressions: http://www.cublikefoot.com/epic-battle-fantasy-4-first-impressions/

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a cute turn-based RPG. The art is fantastic, especially for a game of this genre.

The gameplay is simple, similar to what one would expect from a game of the genre. You've got the exploring aspect and the turn-based combat aspect, both of which are reminiscent of classic RPG flash games (Dragon Fable anyone?). It's nothing too special, but it's fun enough to not warrant a complaint from me.

The game's music was fantastic. I really enjoyed it and look forward to getting a copy of the soundtrack for future listening. Oh, and the artstyle, which was also very well done. Just like any other RPG, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 comes packed with a massive (and somewhat complex) skill system. It may have taken a while to get used to it, but it's certainly one of the game's positives.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a great game, earning my recommendation. The artstyle may turn a few people away, but the game itself is fantastic (and besides, that artstyle should be selling more than it already is, right?).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008261054', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1418138301}
review:
Alzi la mano chi leggendo il titolo del gioco ha pensato subito all’ennesimo gioco di ruolo in flash, stereotipato e valido magari per qualche pausa sul trono o mentre state aspettando l’ennesimo tram in ritardo. Bene, alzatevi allora e aspettatevi un tocco alla Kojima sul coppino, perché invece il gioco a firma Matt Rozsak si svela un ottimo divertissment che non ha nulla da invidiare a molti altri esponenti del genere. Epic Battle Fantasy 4, infatti, è una graditissima sorpresa, almeno per chi non aveva già esplorato le sue varie declinazioni che potete trovare gratuitamente su aggregatori di giochi in flash come Newgounds, Armor Games o Kongregate. Giunto su Greenlight, Matt Rozsak ha lavorato ad una versione enhanched ormai pronta per sbarcare nel negozio di Steam e, possibilmente, a conquistare a colpi di ironia il vostro duro e scafato cuore da giocatori di ruolo. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 è infatti l’ultima iterazione di una saga di J-RPG “occidentali” che, a cuor leggero, fa del non prendersi mai sul serio una delle sue specifiche più gradite e riuscite. Nei panni di quattro personaggi che andranno a comporre il nostro party di tre elementi di fiducia, dovremo sconfiggere vari nemici in una serie di dungeon e spazi aperti.

Leggi la recensione completa su TheShelterNetwork: http://theshelternetwork.com/epic-battle-fantasy-4/

author: {'steamid': '76561198024440251', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1575866249}
review:
This is one of those game I would typically NOT buy. Just look at childish graphics and that low-res jRPG style - not worth €11 in my book. I said 'typically NOT buy' though...

I had this game in a bundle and gave it a try thinking I'd remove it within 5 minutes. But 5 minutes of playing became 10, 10 minutes became half an hour and by now I've already played 4 hours. Why..? Aside from the first negitive impressions, this game is FUN and addicting. Not to mention that the story is fun and well written.

But is it worth the €11 Steam charges? I don't think it is. If you can get it with a 50% discount, grab it! If you can get it in a bundle, grab it as well! If you're a huge jRPG fan, then don't wait for the discount and just grab it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064034066', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1441196725}
review:
Kupo랑 NG 때부터 했던게임으로 초판 EBF1,2은 간간한 재미로 플래이하다가 
3편은 케릭들끼리 협동 개그 플래이로 하다가 
4편은 백업 시스템과,뱃지로 이용한 속성내성,추가 능력치,많아진 적들과 던전 암호등등 지금은 마치 플래시 코믹 파이널판타지를 보는느낌이다.
소소한 개그랑,색드립이 인상적이고 특히 귀여운 케릭터가 매우 맘에든다
그리고 예전에비해 매우 어려워졌다고 보아야 하나?
그리고 빈유 Anna 지못미... 
암튼 이게임을 추천합니다!

EBF For Ever

P.S
Lance ♥ Anna

author: {'steamid': '76561198046007748', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1512484910}
review:
一周目评测
画面:过场cg纸片效果非常棒，但实际游戏画面感觉缩水严重(不知道这是不是也是一种风格)，感觉过于q版，而且也不细腻，有种敷衍了事的感觉。

音乐：非常棒，大场景的音乐能和场景配合，战斗场景音乐也符合战斗气氛。音效也可以（印象最深刻的是喵^_^）

剧情：感觉没多少可说的，就当作是一个简单的童话故事好了。

系统：收回之前装备少而缺少变化的前论，该作对抗性装备依赖严重，所以装备是一大核心，搭配各种装备绝对是一件值得思考的事情。当然收集装备也不是件容易的事情，因为宝箱数目繁多，而且很多由于缺少关键性道具导致前期不能拿，只能最后再全图扫荡一番（如果你能做好笔记就当我没说）

总评：上品。适合核心jrpg玩家。上手阶段目前是第一个boss后开始上手，1周目大体上手。

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
初玩评测
说实话这游戏画面略奇葩（不要被过场骗了！）   但是音乐很不错 系统也很强大 属性繁多 技能也不算少
但日式rpg通病 装备不多且缺少变化  很容易上手 总体挺不错  推荐给日式rpg爱好者

If you are a jrpg fans,take a try and it won't let you down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041818023', 'num_games_owned': 4216, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1395857441}
review:
An old-school turn based RPG with a shiny modern coat of paint, that sums up Epic Battle Fantasy 4, but also explains very little.  Helpful, aren't I?  Um, anyway.  It's actually a really good time for fans of this sort of game, with game creation software in the hands of anyone who wants it, we have a lot of SNES style RPG games to choose from.  EBF4 really rises above the herd in many ways.
The graphics are pleasing and detailed, which is especially nice since the game has such a wide variety of gear.
There is a good variety of elemental damage and resistance in skills and gear, so that what you  wear can really change the outcome of a battle.  Along with that is the fact that you can always flee from battle and start it over, so you never have to find yourself in the awkward situation of being slaughtered by ice monsters because you wore your fancy fire armor that day.
The humor in EBF4 is self-aware and somewhat silly, without being over-the-top hey hey look at me arrow-knee pie-face lulz.  Well, not too much anyway.
I heartily suggest this game to anyone who likes fantasy, or epic battles, or the numeral four.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128052381', 'num_games_owned': 1380, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3918, 'last_played': 1695616280}
review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy Series have had a touch of brilliance to them and have come a long way from their first installment in 2009.

I thought the third one was brilliant and would be very hard to top, but looking at the fouth and playing it through I admit, I'm amazed at how far the game has come. The story was brilliant and had more key elements than the third. The music was as brilliant as before, if not better and as a bonus the audio files come included with the game.

The characters still had their uniqueness and the battles were what I had expected of this game.

Overall, I really liked the part about the cats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012442489', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2315, 'last_played': 1437411753}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052239687', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1506852938}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922281', 'num_games_owned': 3134, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1395702894}
review:
Having only played one of the prequels without even finishing it I don't feel adequate enough to write a review for it, but I will because I think it really deserves one.

For being a flash game, it really does a lot of things very well. It has a bunch of content and the feel of the game and combat offers more replay value than most other games. I'm positive there's some kind of overpowered gear/party setup to be found somewhere/sometime but as far as I have seen there is the complexity where switching equipment to counteract the zones you're currently in will benefit you considerably which is great. It should not be mistaken for an easy game other than being an RPG where you can farm/outlevel zones, because the highest difficulty setting does offer quite a challenge.

There's a whole lot of fun to be had with just the humorous dialogues and references to popular video games and anime culture. If that's not your thing, then you may want to seek elsewhere. The game may run a little bit slower during intense scenes where there's a lot happening on the screen (depending on your graphic settings) but other than that, the only downside I can possibly imagine is feeling a bit disconnected with the story if you haven't played the previous games.. though in my opinion, even that can be nullified because the story is quite bonkers to begin with.

The game can be played for free, but the Steam version does offer a lot more extra content. Whether that's worth the price is subject to personal opinion, but I think the sheer awesomeness of the included soundtrack by the great music artist (and another personal favorite) HalcyonicFalconX definitely makes up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051910668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1466305690}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994662237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1593436527}
review:
Surprisingly fun Final Fantasy-inspired (with a little Golden Sun and Pokemon influence) JRPG-style game. The game is pretty lighthearted and doesn't take itself too seriously. Large variety of items/gear to collect, skills to unlock and chose from, and monsters to encounter. On the higher difficulties, you have to make sure your party make-up is balanced as far as elements, as monsters all have various elements and status conditions that they are either strong or weak against. Combined with the possible synergies between gear and skills, it gives the combat system enough depth to have it not feel stale after a while.

Some minor knocks include lack of widescreen support and lack of built-in controller support. Also obviously, if you dislike JRPGs, this game will not appeal to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010120628', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1395439653}
review:
Really didn't expect to enjoy this half as much as I actually am. It's funny as hell! After getting a tad bored with South Park : TSOT I really needed something that played in a similar way to fill that craving for a good RPG. This just does it for me. The art style is over the top and fits the game perfectly, the writing is sharp as hell and the mechanics are solid and really enjoyable. 

This is a welcome addition to any RPG fans collection, it's also worth noting you can play it entirely with mouse clicks (I found this to be really rather nice for a laptop owner). Seriously, just buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970731100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 10825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10252, 'last_played': 1473837024}
review:
This game is a must buy for anyone that is a fan of RPGs and one of the best RPGs available for the PC. The art style is very easy to look at and is one of those styles that will never look old. The animation effects during battles are all awesome to look at. The sounds make every hit and effect seem very powerful. It's not something easy to explain, until you experience it for yourself. 

As the title of this game says, the main focus is on the epic battles throughout the game. Lots of care and attention to detail has been put into the battle system. Gone are the random encounters from outdated RPGs. You see every enemy on the screen now and can choose whether to fight it or not. As soon as you touch an enemy, the battle instantly loads. No more waiting around for loading times. 

The combat system has so much depth. There are *a lot* of different strategies you can use to fight enemies in this game. Different equipment, elemental effects/resistances, skills, crafting and items are all very important in taking down enemies. The boss battles are very epic and will challenge you to see if you have been learning how to play efficiently. You will spend a lot of time figuring out what equipment and skills to use for taking down a boss.

Postgame has the optional Battle Mountain area. Always thought it would be a great idea if RPGs would include a way to fight every enemy in the game during some marathon battles? Welcome to Battle Mountain. Where all normal encounters, minibosses and bosses are thrown into some very difficult battles to test just how good at this game you truely are. Not to mention the extremely difficult new enemies created for that section of the game.

Love collecting achievements in games? This game has over 100 Medals/Achievements waiting to be unlocked. The music is some of the best I have ever heard in a game. You will definately find at least a few songs that you think are amazing. It fits every area and encounter so perfectly. There is also a New Game + mode where you can carry over all your equipment and skills. Enemies will level up and everything will be even more difficult this time around.

There are so many things this game did right for an RPG. You are truely missing out on a great RPG, if you don't give this a try.

You will spend around 50 hours trying to complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080699976', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1658910587}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047850719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1693864356}
review:
A witty game, hearkening back to the older RPG's of yesteryear, where the battle system was refined, and the enemies made sense for the setting (no, not really, but just roll with it).  In this game, you command a three of four warriors at a time, and fight for the safety of the world.

Uses a turn based combat system, where speed is not a factor.  Your team goes, then their team, then yours, etc...
The summon system works well as any character can use it, but you still have to watch the summon's resource bar.
A large array of weapons, armors, gear, skills, and spells for you to arm yourself against the monsterous waves of enemies that block your path.  Will you stand tall and face the challenge? Will you fight in this Epic Battle Fantasy?

author: {'steamid': '76561198079143669', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1607385118}
review: I recommend this game if you love turn-based RPGs with some addictive skill progression, secret loot, and a huge overworld. I wouldn't take the story seriously, but for what it is, it does give the journey some nice context and results in some quirky bosses that are fun to fight. I've spent so much time experimenting and upgrading my equipment and skills in order to find the best way to fight certain enemies, and it's made me love RPGs all over again. Definitely worth the price in playtime alone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011004759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1678, 'last_played': 1535799113}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033293455', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1710398328}
review:
by reading that title you're probably gonna assume it's a Final Fantasy knockoff, but don't be so quick to drop this game!
Gameplay: 
you explore around the game's map in a zelda/dragon quest style overworld map,
you can use arrow keys/WSAD to move on the maps, but in combat it's mouse only (no gamepad support)
the game is a turn based RPG, battles aren't random, but instead you run into an enemy to engage them in battle, 
combat is done with 4 party members, 3 of which are active in battle and one is the backup that you can switch in without wasting a turn, and also recovers their HP/MP while in backup. 
you got your nature based archer Anna, your cliche powerful swordsman Matt, the well-endowed mage Natalie, and the crazy gun maniac and tank summoner Lance.
you defeat your enemies using all of your many equipments: weapons, clothes, accessories, Flairs which each have their own resistances/elements (there's a lot!) and they all can be upgraded to increase their effectiveness, not only that but you got skills and magic at your disposal as well!
each enemy has different weaknesses/resistances that you NEED to pay attention to, unless you wanna do 0 damage, or worse, HEAL your enemies by accident, luckily you can "scan" enemies using your summoned scanbot which forever allows you to see their weaknesses/resistances.
each character has their own skills to learn that are unique to each one, but there's also skills that are shared between them, but only ONE can use them so you'll have to plan around this a bit, you can forget skills if you really need to.
there's also "limit breaks" not unlike a FF game you charge your limit guage by taking damage and unleash powerful moves, like a rapid-hit sword slash combo, summoning a space ion-cannon, or fully healing your party
and then you can use summons, which use SP that you gain from defeating enemies, like a dog that throws healing items to you, an Ice elemental that freezes enemies, and a cat with no legs that slashes everyone, and later on even summon boss monsters to your side!
oh and there's quests that require you to grab certain (rare) items and bring them to NPCs, cause they're too lazy to do it themselves!
Music/sound:
this game's soundtrack is what makes it a little more unique, of course it's all original and done by an awesome artist (BTW soundtrack comes with the steam game!) it really sets the mood of the game. 
if you've played the flash game, the quality of both sounds and music are a LOT better on this version!
Graphics:
if you're looking for awesome 3D graphical eye-gasms... well you might not enjoy this
but if you like hand-drawn 2D sprites and comical anime-style character designs this game has all of that! 
don't worry though the graphics are pretty well done for what they are, with idle animations for both party members and enemies alike, no static combat sprites here! and a lot of the skill/limit break animations are awesome!
I should mention the entire game was originally designed in adobe flash, but personally this has to be one of the best flash graphics I've seen!
again, this version has better graphics quality from the flash game. with resolutions up to 1280x800 and fullscreen! 
Difficulty:
this game has an adjustable difficulty from 4 settings, that you can change at ANY TIME. 
believe me when I say it makes the difference of a cakewalk 10 hour game, to uber insane Bosses that 1-hit KO the unprepared!!
the games difficulty changes the enemy stats by a percentage, making them have more/less HP and do more/less damage to you
Easy (50%) normal (100%), hard (150%), Epic (200%)
you get the same EXP, money and AP regardless of difficulty, some achievements require you to play on epic that's all.
Replayability:
other than different difficulties, the game has a "second quest" and "third quest" mode which is basically the same game again but with higher level enemies. and also has a new game+ so you can play again and again while still keeping your levels, AP, and equipment.
there's a bonus area called Battle Mountain, that holds extra bosses and challenge battles, including one that puts you against  multiple bosses back to back! 
also you can try to finish every quest, learn every skill to max, and forge all your equipment to max, and reach lv99 if you wish to do so.
Summary:
even though it started as a flash browser game, it has to be one of the most AWESOME flash RPGs i've played, and in some ways better than a lot of mainstream RPGs.
this steam version includes  all the "premium" features from the browser version, with better sound and graphics quality, and allows you to transfer saves from the browser game to the steam game! (read in forum how to do this)
it's pretty damn entertaining, the game makes jokes on itself and the dialog, both in battle and out, can be fun to read. 
but, damned if your first encounter with "God Cat" won't catch you off guard, and it'll quickly remind you why this game is called EPIC battle fantasy!!

THERE'S ALSO A FREE VERSION ON KONGREGATE.COM, NEWGROUNDS.COM AND ARMORGAMES.COM
try that first, this one's an UPGRADED version with all the additional content included!!
for those wondering why buy the steam game over the free browser one:
-second and third quests included (premium only on browser game)
-higher graphics, and sound quality (1280x800, and fullscreen)
-Battle Mountain area which holds the "premium" items from the browser game.
-cloud saves through steam, if you realize how easily you can lose your browser game data, this is IMPORTANT!!
-26 track soundtrack included with the game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053503986', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2398, 'last_played': 1413829571}
