author: {'steamid': '76561198042049462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1403620318}
review:
Great turn-based RPG. Long-term strategy in choosing who gets which abilities, thus focusing each character around certain roles, and shorter-term stuff in deciding when you need to buff and debuff in-battle. And unless you're playing on Easy, you DO need to buff. (Which means the game has difficulty pretty much just right, especially as you can choose between Easy, Normal, Hard, and Epic.)
The dialogue is also very entertaining, the art style is nice, and if the enemy design isn't good there'll be witty comments on how unoriginal it is.

tl;dr: Good difficulty, good gameplay, good music, good graphics, good dialogue. Get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081491067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1512082367}
review:
If you've talked to me for more than 20 seconds you will no doubt know that my favorite developer goes by the name "Kupo". Matt "Kupo" Rozsak made his debut with a stupid ass fighting game where you pressed SPACE before the ai opponent. it had some nice artwork and it was well made for someone working on his own, but it lacked...everything else. Kupo's next game was something far, far better.The first Epic Battle Fantasy game.

5 years or so later he is STILL working on his own and produeced a game of a godlike calibre.  EBF4 was available (as were Matt's other titles) for free on Kongregate, Newgrounds, Armorgame etc for a while, but people where saying EBF3 was so good they'd pay money for it. One installment later, the Epic Battle Fantasy series had a big enough following that 3 or 4 months after the release Kupo decided to put it on steams greenlight, and so it was lit.

Kupo had already programmed an expansion pack for ebf4, so obviously that is included in this version. Some minor changes are the inclusion of grey text that appears when an attack isn't very effective, and putting some new mini-bosses in some places. However, one MASSIVE expansion is that of Battle Mountain. Battle Mountain is a gauntlet, essentially. You fight your way up from the base of the mountain to the top, along the way finding the bosses from the main storyline have returned wit a few...slight twists, aswell as the inclusion of the Dark Players should you get far enough in, which are evil version of the characters you play as, mentioned to be the hardest bosses in the game by Kupo himself.

EBF4 is an rpg, plain and simply. as the ladder part of the name reveals, it's taken inspiration from classics such as Final Fantasy among other popular stratagy games and rpgs. in this game you take control of 4 characters on you mission to smite god herself (yes, herself) before she can do the same to you and all the other living beings on the planet.

The characters you control:

-Matt: Self-inserted pirate-swordsman, Matt Uses almost exclusively physical, single-target attacks which typically don't give enemies statis ailments unless the equipped sword does so.Completely destroys Bosses and has the strongest Limit Break attack in the game (Even stronger than most enemies attacks i'd say) known as "Cleaver", doing 700 Base power(x5) damage without buffs. (The second strongest Limit Break does 550 base power). He also has an ability known as "Revenge" that deals more damage the more total-team health is missing (mostly accounting for his, but if an ally is dead the damage is boosted) making him able to shred through anything aslong as he doesn't die (obviously).

-Natalie: The Healer-mage with huge tits, Best used as a healer, but can pull her own weight using exclusively ranged-magical attacks, having the widest move pool she's easy to expiremet with and see whether battle-mage or healer is best suited for your stratagy. For Healer, she has the only ability in the game to heal all party members at once, (without summons) and can set up combos by boosting magic attacks of allies and weakening enemies defenses. As a battle-mage, she has the usual fire-ice-electric-boom setup, but also is able to use attacks like "Spectrum" which deals damage and inflicts statuses based on  your currently-equipped staff. Natalie also brings a devestating holy attack know as "Judgement" and it's opposite, a darkness attack "Pulsar" to make quick work of anything of the opposite element. 

-Lance: Gun enthusiast and soldier of an unknown army (maybe) -Uses a mixture of Magical and physical attacks, Easily the most powerful against non-boss enemies.He can unload an entire mag of his freakin' awesome gunblade or maybe call in an airstrike, whatever way he takes enemies out, it's always flashy. Lance is able to fire lazers from space, so clearly he is my favorite to play. Easily his most devastating attack is Hyper Beam, where it requires one turn to charge, then, in the the next 3 turns you may fire it, It hits everyone for massive magical damage and reflects the elemental typing of your weapon. Facing five fire enemies at once? Switch to the water cannon and shoop-da-woop their asses out of existence. Awesome.

- Anna: Nature's whore- personally my least favorite, good for inflcting status effects with her Arrow Rain ability, and she also attacks with a mixture of physical and magical damage, leaning more towards physical. She can also learn healing spells so Natalie doesn't have to do all of it, but none of her abilities heal more than one person, to make up for that she gives healed player "Blessed" status, preventing them from being inflicted with status effects. She's the weakest in terms of strength and I find she's only good as a support to set up combos.

The only negative things about this game-
1) It's not kind to the uninformed. Not knowing that you're supposed to summon the ScanBot to get information on your enemies' weaknesses and resistences can be devastating during fights. Also, not knowing which skills to get on whom, how to spread your stat boosting items, and other essential things to survival are not taught to you. I suggest playing EBF1 or 2 before attempting this game.
2) Epic mode is honesty TOO hard. in the older games Epic mode made enemies 40% stronger and gave them new moves. In this game, it makes them 100% harder, and start the battle afflicted with a status they are 200% resistent to (IE- Poison heals instead of damages). This makes the game boring as you are constantly buffing yourself and charging attacks and setting up to do the most damage possible to a level 3 slime because if you don't it will kil you by brushing up against your knees too swiftly.
3) Items essental to the area you're in being given to you 2 areas ahead. This happens surprisingly often. I recall getting my ass kicked by some ice enemies only to find a staff boosting ice defense and strengthening fire attacks in the next area. 

Number 3 is a personal problem, but 1 and 2 should be headed if you are not a veteran to the RPG style of play. Other than that and a few minor complaints I have about the distribution of critical items, I have no real complaints.

If you're not in to RPGs, this game may not be for you, as there is little in the way of minigames. If you do not like to spend time micromanaging every bit of equipment, play on normal, if you are used to RPGs in general, play on hard, if you have played through ebf4 prior, play on epic if you choose. The only reason to play on easy is if the Dark Players are making you rage and you just want to kill them already after your 40th attempt...in other words, easy is too easy

Tip- Use scanbot during your first move against the enemies, then run away. The flee command never fails, you can use this to get infromation on a new enemy before a fight and allow you not to waste a turn at the beginning of a fight by calling for scan bot after you enter it for the second time.

Meaningless and totally bias score: 10/10 as RPGs go. This is easily my favorite of the RPG genre and I encourage anyone to atleast play the free version if you are a cheap bastard.
Also, I did say he was working alone, but that's not entirely true, He also Had the help of HFX who handled the music, and was given some additional designs by various fans (listed in the credits).

I salute you, Kupo, You've come a long way since EBF1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096183993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1519407725}
review: j'adore

author: {'steamid': '76561198065348421', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1601777023}
review: Even if you've played the flash version and have mastered it, it's still worth it getting the game because there's plenty more to it. The game is simple. It takes on classic turn-based battles inspired by RPGs. They've pretty much nailed it. The artwork is great, the music is fantastic, the gameplay can get repetitive at times (But what can you expect from turn-based games, right?) The game is fun, and it's worth playing as the story is, surprisingly better than I've expected when I've first played this game on kong. The references and humor in this game balance out the overall seriousness that an RPG usually gets. The puzzles, not the best. Some can be too easy, and some can be just plain annoying. However, with all the new additions, the game didn't keep old. It's worth the money if you've played the game or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080959505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1408413133}
review:
Excelente RPG de turnos pra quem gosta ^^ Vale a pena comprar. Lembra muito RPGs clássicos da era 16 bits e tbm de muitos jogos em flash como Adventure Quest Worlds. O jogo conta história de um deus gato que irá renascer com o poder de 3 jóias sagradas (história meio clichê mas tudo bem). Vc joga com 4 personagens sendo que um deles fica na reserva. Há qualquer hora vc pode troca o jogador do seu time pro da reserva contanto que seja a sua vez se estiver em batalha. O jogo apresenta níveis de dificuldade que vão desde Fácil até Épico fazendo ser bem desafiante e difícil.

Pontos Positivos:Excelentes gráficos pra um jogo estilo flash;persnagens carismáticos e super engraçados;sistema de level up com skills,customização de roupas,adereços,armas e magias (muda a roupa e a arma do personagem em batalhas e outros eventos do jogo),dificuldade aceitável;controles simples.Interface do game completa em português.Trilha sonora excelente.

Pontos Negativos:Na maioria das vezes só se usa o mouse e o teclado.Batalhas bem demoradas que exigem muita estratégia em algumas partes sendo completamente cansativo.Fator replay só é bom pra desafios extras como dungeon secreta e chefes overpower.Tende a enjoar com o tempo.

O preço tá meio "salgado" mas é um jogo que vale a pena

Nota: 9.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198065209195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1394409074}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037729086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5971, 'last_played': 1498989858}
review:
In short - this game is absolutely awesome.
In long... Challenging yet not impossible, funny yet smart - it keeps you playing, but never lets you get bored. 
Personally I find fighting mechanics extremely enjoyable - well balanced, but requiring some level of skill to end up effective and successful. Storyline is nice, though I liked it more in EBF3 - there were more fun stuff and I really loved all those witty anime refferals. I want to point out - that in EBF4 quality level DID NOT drop, it's just that now such things are expected (for those who played previous part obviously). 
Characters are great - they are not one bit like classic boring "heroic" heroes or angsty anime kids. Well... there are some problems - Lance with his naz... black uniform does look a bit disturbing. I just don't understand authors position on this one. So I picked different outfit and tried to forget. =) And did I say Natalie got some classy eyes, -wink -wink?! 
     
I recommend this game to everyone...  unless you find Final Fantasy style of battle system unaccepatable. If so - accept my condolences!

PS Still a good game. Nominated it for Steam Awards. Now give me my badge!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081249908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1455127171}
review:
If you like RPG's it's worth the money.
For those people who are not that young and remember the SNES times with the Lufia will be happy with that game,
cuz it's almost the same. 
You can Upgrade a lots of things and have a large collection of abilities you can learn.
The nice thing about that you can't make anything wrong.
It makes a lot of fun and as i said it's similar to Lufia, round based Combat, but the traveling is like Secret of Mana / Terranigma.

For people from the old NES or SNES times, this is a must have. Trust me.

20/10

btw Good Soundtrack which in also included in the Folder where you have it installed.

Really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091311921', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2731, 'last_played': 1527363331}
review:
I've played EBF IV on Newgrounds and it was one of my favorite games, also considering that I've played through I~IV each on Epic Difficulty (although, the first of the series I have not succeeded in completing on Epic Difficulty). Seeing it released on Steam and buying it on the early release got me going with hours of gameplay.

Either way, it is different from the Flash Version, with Extra content and New Game+ and New Game++. Extra Content includes such as the Battle Mountain area which requires more of a strategic approach than the grinding approach. New weapons and armor to help customize to whatever best fitting for you through gameplay challenges.

Difficulty-wise, you can change the difficulty at any time necessary (although, one should be playing on Epic Difficulty); for those who need a challenge or are having trouble with a slime. You should be using strategies you know.

Gameplay-time, you can expect to look forward to of around 25 hours to 30 hours of gameplay for your first playthrough (and running on Epic Difficulty while gathering a majority of what you can).

It provides references to other material while adding its own hint of humor.

If you're still on the line of buying it or not, consider trying the Flash version for a few moments. If you do enjoy it and wish to support the creator, Matt (and HFX), then you may buy it as so. If you have travelled quite a long distance in the adventure, there is a way to transfer the saves from Flash to Steam.

Overall, if you like turn-based jRPGs with wonderful quality graphics and a different plot than most, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055542088', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1438, 'last_played': 1610751794}
review: EBF1? Work of art.  EBF2?  To good to be true.  EBF3? Gg.  But EBF4 just put all 3 together, and made the ultimate RPG Flash based game i've ever played in my entire life.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves a good RPG game.  With adventure aspects and amazing comedy, half the time I had to take a break from the game due to laughing so hard.  If you feel like giving the game a spin, play the free verison on Kongregate.  If you like it, why not buy a copy on steam?  Kupo Games surley deserves it for all his hard work on the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109456121', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1495203806}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198027299877', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1865, 'last_played': 1553413574}
review:
Back when I was a heavy Kongregate user in 2013, this little gem has had great potential. So much, it was worth buying Kreds to purchase the bonuses. So if this game runs on Kongregate, you are right: this game is Flash-based. Yeah, Flash games have a bad rep on Steam, but this one cuts that, the cake, AND adds icing on the cake, making it a great RPG to play on Steam.

What I have loved has, and always will be, the music (http://halcyonicfalconx.bandcamp.com/album/the-music-of-epic-battle-fantasy-iv). The $12 is worth it, believe me. Favorite track is 'Elfin': makes PERFECT battle music, comparable to many of the SquareEnix jRPGs out there. It's heard once you reach the cavern entrance. For those who have complained about this being a paid game over the free Kongregate version, this comes WITH the OST, located within the install folder.

This version is Steam Cloud-enabled, so a long-awaited feature, cloud saves, exist finally. Saves will be created in the install folder under .meow's (very funny, Matt...). This one feature has the advantage over the Kongregate version.

...Or maybe it's because I have had this fondness for Natalie, the red-hair, blue-eyed beauty who has this skill named Genesis. You tell me what the creator had in mind, given my username and avatar...

I say BUY THIS!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013608209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1661907381}
review: A stellar game, from start to finish, keeping alive the old turn based battles we used to fight back in the day, with a surprising fresh twist on it. Stellar gameplay and music, a simple yet somehow still gripping story, and the freedom to kill enemies wherever you might go. The skill system means that just enough player input is required to get the most out of your battles, and the equipment and forge system means item drops are relevant throughout the game, every battle fought is a useful one. All in all, this game deserves my glowing praise for it, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032282158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1394968132}
review:
Bien entendu ça va encore râler sur un jeu disponible sur Android ou flash gratuitement alors que ce jeu a été modifié, qu'il n'est pas totalement gratuit mais avec l'option premium qui permet d'avoir accès a plus de contenus sans pub pour 7.50$ et ce n'est toujours pas la version Steam qui a encore vu des ajouts de zones, de sorts, de pets, d'items.
C'est d'ailleurs là que j'ai connu la série étant donné que j'ai le 3 et le 4 sur ma tablette Samsung et j'aurais acheté la version premium si il n'était pas présent sur Greenlight.

Si vous aimez les RPG tour par tour un peu old school c'est que du bonheur avec un jeu plus riche que ne laisse croire ses dessins enchanteurs, des animations vraiment bien faites, des personnages attachants, plusieurs niveaux de difficulté, partie+ et une centaine de succès Steam très bien intégrées in game.
Quant au prix il suffit de prendre en exemple Final Fantasy VII et VIII vendus plus cher alors qu'ils ont plus de 10ans, qu'ils ont déjà rapportés des millions, que c'est une multinationale dérrière et surtout qu'aucune améliorations n'a été faite pour un tiers de plus !!!
Bref je ne regrette pas une seconde le prix que je trouve à peu près justifié en regard du travail fait par Matt Roszak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077796889', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1397689578}
review:
One of the Best RPG's I Have ever played. If your a FF fan BUY this it awesome. For those of you complaining "This is a free flash game!" it is and it isnt. The steam version includes

• Includes Kongregate’s Premium Pack, which adds:
• 8 new bosses, 27 new equips, 8 new skills.
• Huge new area to explore.
• Survival mode and boss rush challenges.
• Newgame+ feature, with higher level monsters.
• Support for different window sizes and fullscreen resolutions.
• Uncompressed audio and various visual improvements; the game looks and sounds better than ever.
• Integration with Steam’s achievements, trading cards, and most importantly, cloud saving.
• Includes the soundtrack. (26 tracks!)

So yah not the same flashgame you could find on kong. Kupo 707 is a great Developer and you should support him buying the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198038058805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2828, 'last_played': 1431268603}
review:
Turn-based RPG created by Matt Roszak and his first game that is not binded to a browser. 
Full of different equipment that have varying properties to help you deal with the enemies.
You will meet insanely hard bosses with attacks that may destroy your whole party if you're not prepared.
And of course your party has tons of epic skills and limit breaks (which are awesome :D) that may help you on your adventure.
Game is full of secrets and epic references to popular games, music and media and it has an awesome soundtrack made by HalcyonicFalconX.
Story is told with humour and it makes you laugh even in grim situations.
The world is pretty large so a lot of roaming is included altough you need to access a lot of quest items to roam free. In the end, game progresses in a linear fashion trough all different zones excluding some secret places and the Battle Mountain area.
Also, this game has achievements. A lot of them. And they vary from starting the game to killing insane bosses on epic difficulty.
Buy the game and support the developer. It is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007957968', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1394447555}
review:
Bonjour a tous et a toutes surtout a... vous amies gameuze mmmh ;) ( dit t'il avec un air psycopathe )

Aujourd'hui J'est acheter Epic Battle Fantasy 4 !  ( Applaudissement ) MERCI ! pourquoi tu n'applaudit pas le rouquin la bas  jt voit !
J'est vue ce jeu ce matin en allumant mon PC et oui comme beaucoup... c'est dingue ce truc...
Donc voila je vois dans les nouveautés STEAM ce jeu et alors j'est commencé a regarder ce que c'était un peu exactement.
C'est donc un RPG qui a l'origine si j'est bien comprit était un jeu Flash GRATUIT sur le web ( 10€ sur steam... )
ne cherchont pas amigos le pourquoi ! Mais ! Aprés avoir testé la version gratuite sur le site ou il est...
J'est très vite constaté ce jeu ètait très agréable et je pense très technique le debut a l'air facile mais déja au debut on nous annonce la couleur que on peut changer la difficulté allant de facile normal difficile le jeu est de base sur normal !
Les graphismes sont un peu enfantin manganisé ( sa existe ce mot lol ) mais j'aime bien sa change de style et le systèm a la Final Fantasy au tour par tour marche très bien, le jeu est gavé d'humour et de clins d'oeil a quelques jeux videos, animes, films, héros... etc.
Le jeu raconte au debut les évenements passé du précédent volet puis alors nous voila avec nôtre héroïne( a ne pas confondre avec autre chose ! )  du nom de Anna
Nous sommes dans le village de BOISVERT et on nous lache en plan, donc nous apprenons par les villageois que un joyau aurrait été voler et donc l'aventure débute... certains villageois nous propose differentes quêtes comme leur ramené différents composants voila pour l'histoire un peu et pour les quêtes secondaire...
Nous trouvons des armes, des armures, robes, casques, chapeaux...ETC que nous pouvons améliorer grace a au systèm de CRAFT !
Car oui le CRAFT est présent nous pouvons fabriqué comme améliorer nos equipements.
le system d'expérience reste classique au cours des victoires sur les monstres ont gagne des AP  pour ceux la ils nous permettent d'apprendre de nouvelles compétences mais aussi de les améliorer grace a ces points la .
Et bien sur de l'argent pour acheter des objets, compos, nourriture... etc
Les musiques sont je trouve excelente et agréable parfois nous rappelant certains jeux comme les FF ou Chronotrigger et d'autres jeux bien connues.
On apprend assez vite qu'il y'a un NEW GAME + ! et c'est agréable recommencé avec son matos de la partie précédente !
Il y'a une sorte de donjon spécial ou nous pouvons re-affronté les boss on ne gagne pas de XP ou AP mais ces boss gardent avec eux des trèsors !
Je vous souhaite Bon jeu et vous recommande de découvrire Epic battle Fantasy 4
Je pense vous en avoir parler assez je vous recommande de le testé en flash sur son site très facile a trouvé.
Et sur ces doux mots je vous dit a bientôt les choupidous !

Cordialement, MR PIPALOPS

author: {'steamid': '76561198062990137', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1542126373}
review:
Just to get this out of the way, it is my opinion first of all and i have already played this game on Epic at kongergate,so my play hours wont be as high on steam. I played the older veriosn first and other minigames made by the same person (group now i think) and enjoyed them in my younger years.younger being important because you would find many things fun. i was hyped for this game and i am  overwhelmed with it, it delivered 


Meow,Meow, MEEEOOWWWWWW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I mean come one  >:O Epic battle fantasy 4 on steam .This is where it belongs >:OOOOOO. Its a flash game but allllllllll that effort put into it is amazing .The art ,music everything and it all works. the combat may be turn based but once you have the swing of things  :D Its not a short game too which is awesome and with all that loot out there youre gonnna have a goood time. I played this on Kong yes the *free version*  ( DONT BUY IT ON STEAM ;=; this man is ripping you off)  yeah right >.>  only people who dont read say that ;ppppp so dont let that stop you from buying this epic game. Cause you have to buy that extra stuff online for more  so why are people saying this is a riff of if its a bit cheaper here >.> even if its the same price its still better on steam and why not support this dev , I mean look at the quality of the game and all the effort put in from this small team maybe even just the dev himslef has done plus no adds, no need to go on  armour games or anything like that . Its just epic battle fantasy and you till ya bored,which will take a very long time) . Another thing i like is how the dev uses fanart  
and even got one  of his enemies from the fanbase. How cool is that. 

Story 8/10 (yes there is a story)= Cats plotting to take over the world!!?? Now thats new.(wierd but it works alright,might need to understand ebf and is preious games to understand some jokes but it does eplain briefly)
Gameplay 10/10= its rurn based combat and it works like silk, you move around a the map from birdseye,play the free version because this can be an issue for some people.
Music 10/10= is Ammazing and everyplace has its own theme and combat mode themes adding atmosphere
Fun 9/10=depending on your difficulty, i play epic so there are some boss battles and even access to new areas when you just give up but do return.Ramping up the difficulty does provide and *Epic* challenge and it might seem undoable but with the skills and items you have Victory is always possible and for anyone whos into these types of games you will spend hours on this game.The homour is great among our characters who all have their own traits and since they are silent you can voice them in your own way.(Which can be extremely entertaining)

The free version itself is amazing anyway and thats all it took for me to throw my money at my screen when this came out. If you dont like this kind of rpg turn base stuff then maybe the anime refereneces will keep you going >.< if that does not maybe try the free version online and if you like it a lot  buy it and get all the extras here and share it with ya friends :DDD.
im to excited for the future of Epic Battle Fantasy series as a whole.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043960246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1419496337}
review:
This game is a must-buy for any RPG fan!

While its style is distinctly western, in everything but art Epic Battle Fantasy is very much a JRPG. The combat is heavily based on elemental advantage/weaknesses – brute force is rarely an option in harder battles, instead the key to victory is using correct skills and gear.

Speaking of gear, uniquely among RPGs, newer weapons and armor you acquire are not direct improvement of your old equipment. Instead, each weapon and armor has properties that make it good in some situations and mediocre to bad in others. The result is that no equipment becomes useless, and some of early gear may very much be an option for endgame battles.

Instead of acquiring stronger gear, the game features upgrade system for your equipment, allowing you to improve your gear as you progress through the game (most later upgrades require items that are not available until later). And on final note about gear, each item your character wears, from weapons and armor to small badges visibly changes your appearance, which is really a nice touch!

The story doesn’t even pretend to be serious, but it will accomplish what it sets out to: make you laugh from start to finish!

Overall, Epic Battle Fantasy is all kinds of awesome. If you like turn-based RPGs, give it a try and it won’t disappoint!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972406726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1504024845}
review:
I've played EBF since the first game, and it's always been one of my favourite RPGs.

The game has a nice aesthetic, a classic tried and true battle system, lots of room for strategy.
The characters are likable, if a bit cliche'd. The dialogue is not the best, but it is very light hearted and not intended for the overly serious.

The game it'self has a large amount of content, which will keep you occupied for hours upon hours. The story alone is 10+ hours, which is double what most "real" games have thse days. And that 10 hours is a lower esitimate, only if you are fast and don't go gear hunting etc.

You may see people complain that someone is daring to charge for a game you can play for free on New-grounds, Kongregate and Armour games.

A couple of points against these naysayers.

Firstly, you are paying to support a developer who already has this game and 3 others out for free (and others of differing genres, like bullet hell?) Don't wanna pay? you can play it for free, so how is that even a relevent complaint.

By paying for this game, you gain access to extra content, an awesome soundtrack (that I hear costs $12 by it's lonesome), which can be found in the install folder. And you support a developer who has devoted years of his life to creating such content to give to the world for free, think of it as a donation.

GFX 8/10 - The overworld spriates are lacking, but have a certain charm to them. The in battle sprites are full of life and charm.
Music 10/10 - halcyonicfalconx never fails to deliver. http://halcyonicfalconx.new grounds.com/
Gameplay 8/10 - A good old classic turn based RPG strategy battle game. Nothing groundbreaking, but don't fix what isn't broke amiright?
Replayablity 8/10 - Lot's of content, newgame+, battlemountain challenges, medals, achievments.
Overall Rating 8.5/10 - Well worth playing, even if you arn't willing to buy it, go play it for free on Kongregate or New-grounds

review:
One word review: [b]Awesome![/b]

Do you like RPG games? Over-the-top attack moves? Tongue-in-cheek humour? Cute graphics? Amazing soundtrack?  ~ Then this game is for you! ♡

With more gameplay than many AAA "factory made" games released by big companies (who dare to charge $40 for 15 hours worth) and much replayability with the new arena/boss modes - this little gem of a game will not disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980703059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2618, 'last_played': 1394462293}
review:
Есть бесплатная флеш-версия игры. Версия для стима включает премиум (большая локация со сложными боями, новыми боссами, снаряжением и навыками, Новая игра+, режим выживания) и саундтрек. Рекомендую сыграть сначала в третью часть. Много отсылок к ней, тем более она бесплатная в Стиме: 
http://store.steampowered.com/app/521200/

Плюсы:
+Интересная пошаговая боевая система, основанная на элементах с множеством навыков.
+Большое количество предметов с уникальными свойствами и система их улучшения.
+Удачно подобранные уровни сложности - на Easy вы вряд ли будете испытывать проблемы даже в боях с боссами, а Epic заставит попотеть (да, первые бои конечно легкие, но это только разминка).
+Полный юмора и при этом интересный сюжет.
+Превосходная музыка.
+Фансервис (кликните на них).
+Множество спрятанных на карте тайников.
+Достижения и карточки.
+Можно перенести сейвы с бесплатной версии. (http://kupogames.com/2014/02/17/ebf4-moving-saves-from-kongregate-to-steam/)

Минусы:
-Игра написана на Flash, в связи с чем наблюдаются тормоза в полноэкранном режиме и ограничено максимальное разрешение экрана (1280х800 максимум).
-Кому-то может показаться завышенной цена.
-Отсутствие русского языка, но есть неофициальный перевод:  http://kupogames.com/2018/05/08/ebf4-in-russian/

author: {'steamid': '76561198043506655', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1547456029}

Free versions are available online on various gaming websites like Kongregate, with content you wouldn't notice was missing unless you looked for it. Still not convinced about the game? I dont know what to say. It has cats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029247240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1698195839}
review: Anyone who was already a fan of this series who might feel weird about spending money on what was an internet flash game might want to give it a second thought. This game boasts 25 hours of gameplay which is around twice as long as most big budget games' campaigns and it had new game plus as well. The same humor that this series is known for is fully intact and the art done for the cutscenes is simple but definitely depicts the quirky nature of the characters and situations. For the harcore RPG players this game starts with higher difficulty modes to ensure that you are challenged right off the bat. To anyone who is a fan of the series I say you should definitely pick this up to show your support for the guy who has been doing these games for years now and to those who aren't familiar with this series I suggest you go find the other games online before you make a real judgement about this game. You won't be dissappointed :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013748040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1413980196}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4, la continuación del Epic Battle Fantasy 3, después de haber derrotado al anterior malo maloso (un tipo rarito negruzco feo), nuestros heroes, Matt, Nats (Natalie) y Lance roban la ciudad donde reside Anna, y esta cree que han robado la piedra del bosque. Descubren que estas gemas son necesarias para salvar el mundo y tienen la obligación de salvarlo (¡Por haber robado mi ciudad! - Anna). Es un RPG creado por Mattlikesswords, un usuario de Kongregate/Niugraunds, fan de los juegos clásicos de Final Fantasy decidió hacer el suyo propio, EBF1 jugabas como el Player 1(Matt) y Player 2(Nats), el segundo ya empezó a tener más historia y al pasartelo, Lance se unía a ellos, en el 3 ya empieza la verdadera historia del juego, y esta es su secuela. EL juego se destaca por su sistema de combate clásico, chistes refiriéndose al juego, parodias, referencias y que el mismo Matt ha hecho un análisis para su juego (http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198028049202/recommended/265610/). 

Vamos ahora a los pro y contras del juego:
Pros:
+Un sistema de combate bueno, con muchas habilidades desbloqueables y Limit Breaks.
+Muchos objetos que comprar, obtener, hacer, hay ropa de Miko, de Maids, la ropa de Yoko de Tengen Toppa, espadas clásicas y mucho más.
+Chistes, muchos. Demasiados. Repletos y delirantes. Y parodias. Muchas. Referencias, también.
+Los 4 personajes son únicos en su forma de ser (Anna es mi favorita de todos :3)
+Jefes realmente interesantes
+Una OST que se merece 11/10 "Perfection!!Amazing!! Would Buy again!!"
+¡NoLegs es muy mono!
+Exploración y puzzles
+Puedes probarlo gratis en Kongregate o Niugraunds (no puedo escribirlo bien, lo siento, Steam no me deja)
+Zonas extra en la versión de steam
+Muchísimos enemigos, demasiados.

Neutral:
Realmente no encuentro gran cosa aquí :u

Contra:
-Traducción en español de google translator, no va en coña.
-Pues... No se me ocurre ummm.. En serio.

Análisis:

Jugabilidad:9/10
Exploración, puzzles, y combate clásico por turnos. Los enemigos son débiles ante ciertos elementos y absorben otros.

Variedad:10/10
Muchísimos enemigos, jefes, escenarios... Para aburrirte vamos. Y zonas secretas explorables.

Música: 10/10
No me canso de escucharla, Halcyonix se ha currado la OST de este al 200%, ¡Además te viene con el juego grátis!

Estilo gráfico: Anime



Nota final: 11/10
¡Este juego es increíble!
Perfeción! Fabuloso! Nyah!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029152484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1497539338}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018929322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1457993064}
review:
I absolutely enjoy this game. I honestly find it to be one of my favorite Turn-based rpgs out there.

It has alot of heart, the gameplay is really fun, and the difficulty is there. Not to mention the surprising amount of depth to the combat as you progress further into the game. The Steam and Kongregate Premium versions have a pretty nifty sum of extras for the more devoted fans of the game to unlock as well. Plus, you get the soundtrack as an added bonus if you buy it here. Which really helps add to the value of the game.

If you are like me, then you will get a good 20+ hours out of this game, and that was before I got the premium edition. And with the new NG+ feature, New Battle Area, Survival and Boss Rush modes, and the new equipment and Skills to check out, there is no doubt in my mind that it will leech even more time from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039745455', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1394334277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030993489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1451432068}
review:
I am really glad that I gave this a try - it's pure fun! Nice graphics, great music, funny dialogues, fine-tuned turn-based battles, lots of skills, upgradable weapons and armor... its a pure gem! Also exceptionable are the many medals/achievements you can get - and many of them will make you smile (e.g. I almost fell off my chair laughing, after I poked some chicken). 

For the price - it's totally okay for me. Yes, I have read that there is some free version out there - but I like this game and so it's just a fair way to support  the developer. After all - that might help to get another great game like this coming...

author: {'steamid': '76561198062705943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1498854540}
review:
A bit about Epic Battle Fantasy 4:
- turn based RPG with max. 4 Characters (3active fighting + 1backup)
-no grinding for equipment just some for upgrading them
-Supports mouse and keyboard controlls (you will need a mouse no matter what)
-Good music
-Epic Battle against foes and bosses
-inclueds premium content + Soundtrack
-lots of humor
-newgame+

You can test the gameplay on sites like Armorgames, Kongregate ...
But please bear in mind that the Steam version has:
-improved graphics and sounds
-cloud saving
-fullscreen resolutions
-just the basic gameplay is identical

To those who think: " why buying this game on steam when you can play it for free in the internet/ is cheaper if you just buy it from Kongregate"
A simple calculation: Premium Pack on Kongregate( cost about 8$) +Digital Soundtrack ( cost 12$) =20$ 
cost on Steam Premium Pack + Digital Soundtrack = 11.99$!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994120171', 'num_games_owned': 1348, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1526650430}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198042750874', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1424737272}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042890140', 'num_games_owned': 2486, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1426608495}
review:
I know what you're thinking. "This guy hasn't even started playing this game yet, why should I listen to his review?"

Well, the truth is, I played the shit out of this game's free version on Kongregate.  I also played the shit of EPF3.  And let me tell you, if there is any game on Kongregate that deserves to make it to the big time, its EPF4.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 once again stars the trio of heroic, yet dimwitted adventurers Matt, Natalie and Lance.  This time, however, they're joined by a new character, the ranger Anna, who is easily the smartest of the bunch.  Together, the four this time must travel across the land, searching for crystals and uncovering clues about a new feline menace.

Epic Battle Fantasy has always prided itself on gut busting comedy and intense, over the top action, and this game is no exception.  There are hundreds of weapons, skills and summons to collect and use against literally hundreds of enemies, and the game is full of tongue in cheek moments such as Nat's oftentimes futile efforts to get Matt and Lance to care about the environment, or Anna trying to curb Matt's kleptomaniac tendencies.

Also, is case you're wondering why you should buy this version, well, its because it grants you access to the Premium Pack.  This pack adds a ton of new content to the game, including new weapons, new armor, new summons, new enemies and bosses, and even an entirely new area.

If you're a fan of turn based rpgs, of self-referential comedy, or just plain fun RPGs, then you owe it to yourself to try this out.  Check out the free version on Kongregate, and if you enjoy it, you should definitely considering going Premium by buying the Steam version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999316457', 'num_games_owned': 2577, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9005, 'last_played': 1659804284}
review: Thank goodness I got this game, Matt has always impressed me with his epic battle fantasy series, and when I heard that the fourth installment was going to be on steam I just couldn't keep quiet about it, I was extremely excited for this coming out on steam. It is definitely worth the £8.99 I spent on it. In fact I think it's worth much more than that! Turn based RPGs has always been my thing. The game also tickles me ribs with it's humour, crying with laughter at some points. I really enjoy some of the references that are made. I like the roaming around, puzzles and the mini-games too. Honestly Matt, I love this goddamn game so much. Would absolutely recommend to people who love a good, lighthearted turn based RPG.

review: Tämä peli on täynnä huumoria, seikkailua, toimintaa ja eeppisyyttä. Pelattavaa riittää useiksi tunneiksi ja vaikeustasojen ansiosta peli pysyy riittävän haasteellisena. Visuaalisesti peli näyttää upealta ja viimeistään HalcyonicFalconX:n musiikki saa mielesi sulamaan. Suosittelen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056183178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1613756737}
review:
This game is really fun! When i played it earlier I couldn't stop playing untill i finished it. Now I'm going to do same. This is just RPG with a turn-based battles, Where you can control 4 different heroes. Battles are very exciting and full of visual effects and references to the other games. When you're playing it, sometimes yu're ROTFL'ing, but always you're smiling :). More or less, this is an ,,Epic''<heh> RPG game, you will spend with her many wonderful hours for sure. Would play again 10/10.
PS. There is also weird bug when you can't stop play ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561197990895775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1523365573}
review:
Endlich auch für Steam!
Dieses Spiel ist einfach toll gemacht. Mit viel Witz und Humor ein Rollenspiel nach fernöstlicher Manier. Neben den schönen erstellten/gezeichneten Charakteren und "Monster" ist auch der Soundtrack sehr geil. 
Reinschauen lohnt sich auf jeden Fall, vorallem wenn man mit rundenbasierten J-RPG etwas anfangen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051362921', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1636235086}
review: Without a doubt a wonderful rememberance to the old classic rpg games you would play growing up. With lots of great challenges and a beautiful soundtrack, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is one of the best ways to spend your evening.
